description:
Decent dinner place. Some pretty solid food (nothing spectacular but had some tasty bites). I came during Happy Hour and the garlic ramen is dope! Would definitely recommend that. I had the unagi/salmon and avocado roll as well as the salmon skin roll. My favorite was actually the salmon skin roll! Surprisingly delicious and crunchy :)

Would probably be back for lunch or happy hour.
author: Taylor Z.

description:
Wouldn't come here again. We ordered a tonkotsu ramen. The broth was bland, the noodles were store bought, chashu was strangely sweet, eggs were not runny. Also got a katsudon which surprisingly had mushrooms and onions; the katsu pork was alright.

Maybe I'm spoiled by Japantown, but at least they have much better quality for the same price as Kama Sushi
author: Victor C.

description:
Sitting here at the sushi bar so far the food is unimpressive fish is not that fresh the sake belly was very average. At first I was upset that they torched the sake belly and after tasting the wrong one I know why their sake qualities just not that good. Would not come back here again for nigiri or Sashimi this is basically a roll house. Call me unimpressed.

My server was great, Sammie, and she did all she could but the food was just not worth the price. The kushiyak skewers  were almost as small as my chopsticks, the pork belly was more like tough pork chops and not at all like bacon as they should be....they are inexpensive but I ended up stopping at another place on the way home since I was still hungy.
author: James C.

description:
Two colleagues and I worked nearby and were here for lunch.  We got a table right away. Tea serving and order taking was quick, but we ended up waiting for the food for more than 30 mins which I believe it is unusual

Their food from the special lunch menu is kind of small in portion, we ordered two lunch boxes and a sashimi bowl.  We could definitely eat more after one serving.  It is no doubt this is a decent Japanese restaurant in this neighborhood, but I hope service can be improved :)
author: Shuyi L.

description: Came here for lunch. I don't know why this spot came up on the Yelp search for all you can eat sushi when they didn't even have that option on the menu. Anyway, ordered the sushi combination. Sushi and rice tasted fresh. I did see they had unagi on the menu board so I had to order that being a big fan of unagi. And it didn't disappoint. That was the highlight for this meal.
author: Gerard Y.

description:
The happy hour (5-6:30pm every day) is quite good, although I'm not sure that the prices are that much cheaper than normal (maybe $1-2 off). Check-in on Yelp for a free sake! 

We got the chicken karaage ($6.50) and some of the rolls like the spicy tuna, salmon, and eel rolls ($5.95). The karaage was nice and crispy and hot and had quite a few pieces. They fried the skin too which I think gave a strange texture, but otherwise it was very good. The rolls were fresh but didn't come with as much fish as I would have liked.
author: Amy C.

description:
In additional to all the normal lunch bento choices $12.95 (like chicken teriyaki, tempura, katsu, and California rolls), they also have lots of unique options, such as squid teriyaki and fried oysters, which is what I got. 

Squid teriyaki was tasty and a decent portion -- about 1/4 of a whole squid. I think the whole squid is available as a $10 appetizer. The fried oysters were heavily breaded and you only get two pieces with the lunch special. I think I would have preferred to something else -- Negi Hama, Ebi Cucumber, or Salmon Avocado Roll.
author: Julia C.

description: Reasonable prices and good portions for SF! Loved the NorCal roll, but the August 4th roll wasn't as flavorful as it could be. I really liked the crab appetizer, which had the perfect mix of a outside crunch and soft inside.
author: Alice Z.

description:
Love that this place is close by! A large variety of korean food that offers take out (even to-go bachan!)- yes please!

SOY GLAZE WINGS - I love me some korean wings and  I must say the ones from Kama are exceptional! These wings are extra crispy, glazed over with a tangy sauce that is finger-licking good!

KIMCHI FRIED RICE: Yum! Topped with a oozy over-easy egg that makes this a delicious combo with some short rib or other meat


BEEF TOFU SOUP: I have been meaning to try some Korean sizzling tofu soup for some time now. I was excited to see this place offers it accompanied with some rave reviews on yelp. Maybe it takes time to acquire the taste but I found myself a bit underwhelmed and disappointed:( it wasn't spicy enough for my liking and also found it to be oily and bland..

Will next time try the galbi korean short rib for sure!
author: Nina M.

description:
Features:
-We came here for a birthday event last week and it was awesome!  When I walked in, the restaurant appeared to be small like other sushi restaurants but to my surprise, there was another section to host bigger groups.  We had a party of 7 people and we did fit with extra room.  
-We had the fresh oysters which I thought were delicious.  We enjoyed two Warriors Rolls which had salmon and Hamachi topped with garlic.  This was REALLY scrumptious!  The fish were both fresh and went really well together with the toppings.  Do order this!  I had the 45$ omakase which came with 10 pieces.  For 45$, this was well worth it!  Remember to allow extra time for preparation.  The appetizer I liked least was the salmon tuna tower.  This was a little too dry to my liking and it was essentially bland.  

Improvement:
-The salmon tuna tower would have been great if they just added some flavor.
-The restaurant was a tad dark, I would have liked it if it was just a little bit brighter.

Tips:
-Credit cards and cash accepted.
-Wonderful customer service!
-Food came quick!
author: Kristy L.

description:
In San Francisco,  like in so many cities inn California,  sushi or Japanese can be found on almost every other street.  About a year ago,  my best friend and I ventured into the city to see a Broadway show at the Orpheum and stumbled across Kama Sushi.

We were charmed by the lovely golden wood interior, made welcome by the gracious and informative servers,  hooked by the plentiful and affordable happy hour menu then completely seduced by the amazing food. 

With tickets to Book of Mormon in hand,  we headed back tonight and were delighted once again. 

Tonight we explored the menu more deeply.  The spicy miso ramen balanced good heat with sweet corn kernels, delicious broth and grilled pork.  The brussels sprouts skewers were tasty, as were the butabara- pork belly- skewers. 

Both the albacore and salmon tataki were well seasoned,  fresh and flavorful. I tried,  but didn't care for the Tako Wasabi. While I LOVE octopus and wasabi separately,  marinating raw octopus in fresh wasabi results in what I perceive to be a slimy,  chewy mess... but I tried it. 

What sets Kama apart from other restaurants is the friendly service. It's clearly a popular neighborhood place,  but the staff make sure everyone feels welcome.
author: Sara E.

description:
Came back here again with the same girlfriends 3 years later. 
The health violations were corrected and we went onto the ordering spree. 
Hamachi carpaccio, uni, hotate sushi, pork belly skewers - were pretty good. 
The lobster roll that we ordered was not that good - it was recommended by our waiter.
Soups, appetizers - it was good. 3 adults and 2 kids - left stuffed. Not going to break the bank.
author: Anelya S.

description:
Cute little sushi spot in Soma with solid food.  We got in kinda late and stayed till closing, but they were very nice to us.  All the food was really good and we got a bonus for checking in! The menu is quite extensive and HH looks amazing

DINNER
Crunchy lobster- lobster salad with crunchy flakes
White out- unagi, mango, tuna, & avo
Foxy- hamachi, albacore, avo & seared fish
Salmon skin

All the rolls were bomb, if it was a more accessible location I think I would be here more often, especially for HH!
author: Lyn C.

description:
This is my go to sushi restaurant. Price is affordable, quality is good, and my boyfriend lives a block away. We've been here about 3 times already.

We ordered the crunchy lobster roll the first time we were here. It's a bit pricey and we thought the portion was small for the price. We both agreed it was avg. 3/5.

We got the warrior roll the last two times we were here. We loved it. The flavor is lemony and garlicky and it complements the sashimi so well, 5/5.

We've tried the tempura udon, Niku udon, and curry udon. I would recommend either the niku or tempura because they hit the spot on a cold day. Nothing to write home about, but it does satisfy our craving for some hot udon. 4/5.

Overall, I think the quality of the food is good. The ambiance is nice and the staff is pretty attentive. I definitely will come back here for more sushi and the free hot sake when you check in.
author: Valerie L.

description: Amazing service from EM.  I really enjoyed my meal and felt completely at home.  Thank you very much!
author: Joe D.

description: We really enjoyed Kama Sushi. We went for my husband's birthday (his favorite meal) and they did not disappoint. To start, he had the uni, oyster and quail egg shooter. He absolutely LOVED it! We had the soft shell crab appetizer (my favorite) and blue fin tuna and salmon sashimi. Had a roll but can't remember which one. It was good. The sushi chefs were expert and our servers very accommodating. Wish we lived closer to visit more often
author: Candy E.

description:
Takeout.  Disappointed.  

They said they changed the $7.25 chicken karaage recipe when I called back to find out if my order was right-& this $16.50 crunchy lobster roll is a quarter of the size compared to ordering house.  What's going on here?
author: Lady K.

description:
Very intimate restaurant with great decor. The staff were all very friendly and understanding when my boyfriend could not use chopsticks (they provide chopstick guides and forks upon request). They also offer free sake if you check-in on Yelp!

I ordered the chicken katsu dinner set, assuming it would be the curry version that I've had at different Japanese restaurants in the past. The katsu actually came with a liquid sauce that seemed to consist of soy sauce and perhaps black vinegar. It was still delicious, and the chicken was very crunchy, but not what I expected. It came with a miso soup, which had a great flavor, but I wish there was a little more tofu. The katsu also came with a spring mix on the same plate. 

For dessert I ordered the fried green tea ice cream, and was not that impressed. The green tea ice cream itself was excellent, but the fried tempura portion was not up to others I have had. It was not crunchy enough but overall, the dessert was just average/good. 

The check was kind of confusing because we weren't sure who our waiter was. Three different servers all took turns taking care of us which was fine, but then we weren't really sure who to ask for the check. There was a slight misunderstanding when we accidentally got two checks (the same check printed twice) but they quickly resolved the problem. Overall, I was satisfied with my experience and would likely come again!
author: Anita L.

description: Great service! the food was delicious and the environment was positive and friendly. Will come again!
author: Jennifer Y.

description: Anybody who likes japanese food should go to Kama Sushi.  It's some of the best sashimi that Ive eaten in all my life. The taste is so fresh, soft and completely delicious.  Every time I remember it, I want to eat it again.  I recomend the Chef's Sashimi Choice.  Also, the Sake was really good too.  The ambient decor with warm woods is so cozy that I wanted to stay there after my meal.  The dry branches in the decoration were beautiful.
author: St Giles I.

description:
The wasabi beef is is amazing. I usually get that and an order of the Omakase - fish is fresh and always generous portions.

Protip, cut out the rice and order double salad and you'll have a very good meal.
author: Rich C.

description:
It was a decent place to get dinner. Decor was pretty traditional and simple, nothing too special. Food was mediocre. The yelp check in free sake was pretty watered down. 

Service was really lacking. They first forgot one of the orders and made us wait a really long time after being reminded. 

Then they gave us the wrong bill - they gave us the bill from the table next to us, who had already paid, with cash inside the folder... yeah, they would've lost like close to 100 bucks that night if it was someone else who didn't care about doing the right thing
author: Iris H.

description: Kama Sushi is a solid Japanese restraint with a delightful amount of options to enjoy Japanese cuisine. The restraint is very nice but since I am close by often I love to pick up and eat at home with the convinient pick up system available.
author: Ryuma Y.

description: Friendly service, nice atmosphere. I ordered a California Roll to-go. When I got home and ate it, I found a crab shell particle in it.
author: Reena J.

description: Amazing sushi. The Crunchy Lobster is to die for. Left immensely satisfied and with an umami aftertaste in my mouth. Great sake selection as well!
author: Eric P.

description: This is my favorite new Soma sushi house! Loved all of the special rolls. Anything with spicy sauce or spicy tuna was scrump-diddly-ocious.
author: Michael K.

description:
They should call themselves Kama Ramen. I thought the ramen tasted better than some of the sushi options we've had - some of the fish we were served tasted a bit fishy. 

The sushi combo came with six: escolar, maguro, ebi shrimp, yellowtail, albacore, and a choice of the restaurant's select maki. When asking what's included in the sushi combo, the waiter will insist he does not know what is offered as it is 'chef's choice,' but I guarantee you will probably get what I received. I've never been to a sushi restaurant that didn't default to 90% of the fish I got when ordering 'chef specials' or combo varieties. 

We got hot sake (which didn't match my palate) for checking in on yelp (and there was quite a lot of it left by the end of the meal for three people). 

Enjoyable atmosphere, service was a tad bit slow but very friendly, and decent food.

Ramen: 4 out of 5
Sushi: like 2.5/3 out 5
Service: 4/5 (bumped up because I left something in the restaurant but the waiter let me pick it up half an hour after they closed)
Overall: 3.75ish
author: David Y.

description: Still solid. I'm starting to prefer their hot dishes like Gyoza, hamachi Kama, etc versus nigiris. Well priced compared to other places in the area
author: Laura D.

description: You can only book the private area if you have 7 people or more. Tried to book it for party of 6 and told we can only sit in the booths and nowhere else. Wanted to have a more quiet place to take my guests.
author: Morgan B.

description: This place was great! In town for business from the Midwest and hit Kama Sushi on my first night in town. Quick, reasonably priced eats (for the city) during happy hour, and far better sushi that the best place I can find back home!  Would absolutely go again.
author: Kiki D.

description: Had the hot mama roll and oysters and it was too good to be true! This place is so cute and quaint. Small and personal little spot. Best sushi I've ever had.
author: Mia M.

description:
The menu was honestly amazing. I was very shocked at how broad they were with sushi items and appetizers. They also had a great happy hour menu which I LOVED. 

Ordered from the happy hour menu:

Vegetable tempura - nicely fried and not overdone. A lot of times the tempura breaks off but it was very uniform here and the portion was huge for happy hour which is a big plus. 

Tako sunomono - I chose this because I love octopus. Also, historically I've had sunomono that isn't well marinated and just doused with vinegar but this place did it so NICELY. Crisp in flavor, well marinated, and super fresh tako. 

Fried oysters - massive, not gummy, cleaned well, and no dirty flavor. Four total. 

Wakame salad - easy winner, can't mess it up. Nice starter portion.

Ordered the fried lobster roll which was beautiful but I think it was overdone with the crunch. Just personal preference, I would ask for half the amount next time to really enjoy the flavor of the roll itself. Also purchased the hero roll which was clean tasting, had jalapeños which I LOVE and was just good. 

I rarely give anybody 5 starts. I'll definitely be back.
author: Courtney A.

description:
The nicest service and great sushi for reasonable prices. Everything we had was really tasty. There was no wait for 2 on a weekend for dinner.

My favorite was the hot mama roll ($11) which was baked with snow crab and salmon. It was absolutely amazing! I also tried the toro hand roll ($9) and una crab hand roll ($5.50). The hand rolls were good but I think for the price and quantity you get there are better things on the menu. The half dozen oysters ($10) were fresh and tasty. The wakame salad ($5) was light and refreshing. We tried the 2 pieces of chicken skin skewers. It's ridiculously rich but so good and crispy. Lastly the age dash tofu ($6.50) was a great appetizer.

Overall I would definitely be back again!
author: Linda X.

description:
Came as a party of two during happy hour on a Thursday night and didn't have to wait to be seated. The staff were attentive and were quick to respond to orders, questions, and keeping things tidy.
Ordered hotate, hamachi, shiro maguro, and sake nigiri. The hotate nigiri practically melted in my mouth and the hamachi had a smooth and silky consistency. The shiro maguro and sake both were pretty good as well. 
Overall very solid nigiri.
Also ordered the Mentaiko Yaki Udon and had a good expierience. Just the right amount of garlic added on to the noodles (I'd compare it to the consistency of parmesan cheese clinging to pasta) Nice firm udon. Really helped top off the experience.
The meal came with complimentary edamame which was a nice touch. I really enjoyed the soy sauce as well, but that may just be me.
All in all good food, good service, and good price.
author: Andrew C.

description: I came for happy hour. The establishment is clean and well put together. It wasn't overly crowded or too busy which I appreciate because that meant my food came out quickly. I had the fresh oysters and was delighted by the flavor of the sauce that was drizzled over them. I would hands down eat here again. The employees were respectful and kind.
author: Alora V.

description: Let me explain, if I could give minus stars I would. I got major food poisoning tonight from this place, and I thought it was a fluke until my best friend got sick as well. Super pissed. Calling in tomorrow to complain I'm also calling the health department because apparently (I was unaware or I would never of ate here) two other co workers on two separate occasions have gotten food poisoning from this place as well. That is too many times for it to be a healthy environment and preparation of food.
author: Christy M.

description:
Nothing really blew me away but it's certainly a top notch $$ restaurant in SF.
You can tell they've put some money into renovating and maintaining it as the small building feels quite spacious from the inside and there's no signs of wear and tear. Also kept very clean. If you eat at many places in SF at street level you'd know this can actually be a rarity sadly lol. 

Their service is fantastic. They check up on you promptly and are very polite. 

I've enjoyed their teriyaki chicken and their crunchy lobster roll special so far. I don't eat sushi enough to actually grade it beyond giving it a thumbs up and that every bite was delicious.

All in all there's nothing here that gives you a truly unique experience but it functions flawlessly and for a fair price to top it off(if I recall correctly items on the menu were about $15 or less). The only way you could go wrong here is if you didn't want sushi in the first place lol. Enjoy.
author: Blake E.

description: My friend and I went to Kama for happy hour and had a great time! The food was very affordable and tasted great. We also got hot saki for a great price, and the service was quick. I will definitely come back!
author: Joy L.

description:
Came here to celebrate my sister's birthday but kinda wish we went elsewhere due to lack of service and average tasting food.

Our party of 3 waited about 25 minutes to be seated on a Friday night. We ordered Geso Fries (crunchy but portioned tiny), Crunchy Lobster Roll (decent but not enough lobster), Dragon Roll (average), Golden Dragon Roll (couldn't see or taste the softshell crab), and the Warriors Roll. The food was overall nothing special and the free hot sake upon check in was nice but we were never checked on during the meal. This is only disappointing because we wanted a refill of water and after unsuccessfully staring down a worker twice, we gave up. 

For a sushi dinner in the city, I would definitely go elsewhere.
author: Anny H.

description: The beef curry is amazing, with a generous portion of grilled steak and rich curry. The salmon was also quite fresh. Service was good during lunch.
author: David C.

description: We had a terrible experience today but it could be from Eat24 and/or Kama sushi but not sure. We ordered $110 of sushi from Kama sushi and didn't hear back after 1.5 hours, the app showed it was still being made. We called eat24 and they said it's been ready, but we asked why we weren't notified because the sushi could be just sitting there, they said they'd call the restaurant and then they hung up on us. We called back and they said it was just finished so we believed it and went to go pick it up. We went to kama sushi and they said it's been ready for over an hour and then had cold soup and gross sushi. The Eat24 rep lied to us and it was terrible customer service. not sure if Kama actually told Eat24 that it was ready and not sure why Eat24 thinks it's okay to lie to customers.
author: Christine L.

description: 1.5 years later and still definitely a 4 star experience. Pretty good food, unbeatable happy hour prices, friendly staff and an overall great fun. Other recommended items on the menu are the Albacore Tataki, Mentaiko Yaki Udon (garlic fried udon noodles), and the fried ice cream dessert. Any of the sushi rolls on the happy hour menu is also great. Looking forward to coming back again soon!
author: John B.

description: I cannot believe I've never reviewed Kama. Been coming since they opened. Great happy hour, amazing sushi chefs, and servers, Em, Jason edmond, Cassie and angela are just awesome. Always Super fresh. Try the Wasabi Beef. If you're looking for omakase, call a couple days ahead. Well priced at $40/60.
author: Adam X.

description: Solid sushi for a reasonable price (very reasonable price given it's in soma) also great sake deal when you check in on yelp. Reliable. I come here at least once a week
author: Jessica S.

description: The food I did have was pretty good but I was pretty disappointed that they did not have any tuna.  They also close at 9 which seemed a little too early for the city.  The booths were great because they are very private.  The service was great and the waiter was very friendly and attentive.  I would definitely give this place another try.
author: Michele M.

description:
Happy hour is priced fair and plenty of things to pick from! Sushi has been on point every single time. Service is fast and friendly. My favorite sushi spot in San Francisco. 
This is the first spot I tried Escolar... and I have been in love with it ever since.
author: Rebekah P.

description:
We ordered the spicy tuna roll ($7.50), Negi Hama roll ($7), The Rock roll ($7.50), Fire Cracker Ball ($9), Spicy Pork Tonkotsu Ramen ($12.50).

The sushi was okay at best. The ramen was surprisingly half decent. Think of this as an acceptable, go-to neighborhood sushi shop. But definitely not a destination.
author: Judy S.

description:
We tried three dishes - miso ramen, oyako don, and the grilled while octopus.

Hit: Miso ramen. The spicy sauce really tuned up the flavor, and the chashu pork slices were perfectly marinated. Oyako don even had sliced mushroom in it!

Misses: octopus. Over cooked so a bit rough to bite. 

Really busy at noon that they tended to miss your order. So make sure you follow up well with your order.
author: Elaine H.

description: I think this place that you would go on dates to. If you love sushi. I forgot what we got. All I remember was crab sushi. Lol. Don't hate me. But overall, the place is very calm and soothing. Great place to take a girl out for booths.
author: Julia D.

description:
Meh. This place is very average- the prices are below what you'll find in other SF sushi establishments, so it definitely has that going for it, but beyond that I just found everything lacking in flavor and just...not great.

The tempura shrimp we had to start were so thickly battered it felt like I was eating a corndog, and the rolls we got just didn't taste like anything at all.

It's not bad....it's just not good.
author: Elliott W.

description: This place was good, but definitely overpriced. The portions are small and the prices high. My brother ordered the California roll and wasn't very happy with it. I ordered the Unago roll (eel and mango) and while it was delicious, it was definitely not filling. Both my brother and I only got six pieces in our rolls, and I guess we are just used to getting eight. My mom ordered the blue fin tuna sashimi which was very small and pricey ($18.95 for six small pieces of tuna). I know seafood can get expensive but this was not worth the price. The employees were all very attentive, however.
author: Neelu Y.

description:
I came here for lunch with a friend and had a fantastic experience! 
I got the tonkatsu ramen and it was literally the BEST ramen I've EVER HAD. And I have been to a LOT of ramen places. The broth was extremely flavorful and hearty. There was a huge serving of perfectly cooked noodles. And it came with so many toppings! There was chashu, corn, mushrooms, seaweed, etc. So worth the price, especially for lunch! It was around $11 and also came with a 4 piece avocado roll. 
My friend got a bento box that comes with soup, rice, salad, and 3 items. It was also a huge serving for such a reasonable price. 
We also shared the crunchy lobster roll, which was delicious!!
author: Jordyn Yian C.

description:
Amazing hamachi nigiri. The unacrab roll is also excellent. The hot sake is great. The following was not my cup of tea: soba nigiri, salmon hama, warrior roll.

Service is fast. They give free edamame.
author: Niniane W.

description:
Kama Sushi is your typical sushi joint. All the typical rolls you would find at a sushi bar exist, along with standard Japanese food such as ramen and skewers.

I came here for happy hour because I saw several reviews about the great prices. About that...I'd say that the only good deals on the entire menu were the tataki and Maki roll. Everything else---the skewers, nigiri, rolls, were all at a normal price. 

So onto the food!

Tataki: I ordered the salmon tataki, and I'd have to say that you get a lot of fish for the price. They put the fish with onions and a special sauce, topped with garnish. I liked the flavor of the sauce, but thought it was just too strong. After I finished the appetizer, I had this lingering vinegar and salty feel on my tongue that made me almost forget the taste of the fish.

Maki roll: For the unagi roll, I was really disappointed at how little meat I got. I was essentially eating 95% california roll, and that made me really upset. In terms of the roll, it's not bad, but I thought there was too much rice, the seaweed didn't chew nicely, and the temperature of the roll was too warm. 

Nigiri: I love just straight meat, and this was the highlight of my meal. The portion is plentiful, and the accompanying rice is placed pretty well under the meat. 

Chicken skewers: They were alright and you get a lot of meat, but two things threw me off. One, I'm a meat lover, so when the skewers came with chicken and scallions, my stomach turned a bit and told me dang it, really? But from the perspective of someone who doesn't hate scallions, I still felt that the scallions were a bit out of place with the meat. It was two or three pieces of scallion per stick, and it really just interrupted the taste of chicken. I also thought the sauce was too liquid and on the saltier side.

Overall, not bad, but definitely did not impress me. Even during happy hour, I had to spend a decent amount to fill myself up.
author: Michael Y.

description: I came here with a cousin and my family, and the sushi was such good quality. We shared 10 rolls between the 6 of us, with an appetizer of calamari. I would recommend the dragon roll, the hot mama, and the August 4th roll. Great ingredients, fresh fish, and beautiful delivery (that wood slab is so cute). The only reason I'm taking off a star is because we were here for my father's birthday and we were really hoping to get dessert, but the restaurant had run out. Otherwise, great food!!
author: Bethany T.

description: Had dinner here with a friend and was pleasantly surprised to find they have a happy hour! We ordered two rolls and some nigiri. The sushi itself was pretty standard nothing amazing. But service was great and we got a free bottle of sake by checking in on yelp :)
author: Linz C.

description:
This place has a good variety of different Japanese fare and is a lot more than a sushi-centric restaurant.  Ingredient quality seems good.  I will definitely come back here again and try some of their skewers.

Had the albacore tataki, Kama shrimp, and karaage ramen.  All were very good.  The portion sizes are actually exactly what I like -- you can order a few things and get a nice variety.  That does make it a little on the pricier side, but nothing out of the ordinary for a Japanese restaurant in SF.
author: AJ C.

description:
Pretty average.

I got the katsu bowl and it was meh. The egg was lazily cooked with the whites still runny and there was way too much rice compared to the rest of the ingredients.

Free warm sake with a Yelp check-in though, which was a nice touch.
author: Harry X.

description: I live a block away and come here often. 4 stars for the food, price and location. 3 stars for the service.
author: Jasper P.

description: Called-in to check the wait...waiter was super friendly and told us to come on by. Cute local spot. Friendly and attentive service. Sushi was delicious.
author: P B.

description: Update: realized my last review of Kama wasn't fair. The staff is really nice, food is good, and ambiance is great!
author: Will T.

description:
what to order: HH items!
tip: ask for Cassie, she is THE BEST SERVER

Came here with my boyfriend randomly because we were slightly hungry but not starving. It happened to be Happy Hour and we were immediately sat at the bar. THANKFULLY SO! Because we got the best service from our server Cassie. She was attentive but not too much, she had great suggestions and recommendations and always kept my water full.

Food was great, but service was even better ;)
author: Thuy-Vy N.

description: Happy hour was amazing. Just order anything - all of it is good. Also the serve very generously sized beers which I'm SO a fan of.
author: Madeline C.

description: This place was pretty good- kind of out of the way location- we came to try the HH specials- and a little celebration. Service was friendly and very quick- our fav were defin the fresh fish items (4.5 stars$ , I would definitely re-order these if I return. I was a little surprised to see when I got home I was overcharged (2 stars! for some of the happy hour Items tho SO check your bill closely!
author: Coco J.

description: Had lunch bento and Chirashi here but not very impressed. Everything is pretty standard to even a little boring. Quality is on average.
author: Weiyu H.

description:
Really great bang for your buck here! The prices cannot be beat for the quantity of the fish that you get and the decent quality. The staff here are very attentive and seem like they genuinely want Kama Sushi to be a great experience. Not to mention, if you check in on Yelp, you get a free hot sake! I've never had such a great deal dining at any sushi place before. If you're in the area, definitely come check this place out!

[Dinner]
I had the Chef's Sashimi, the Niku Udon, a really great tuna salad, and the uni nigiri. Sashimi was a pretty good deal as well as the Niku Udon. The portion size for the noodles here are definitely generous, but I didn't feel like the noodles were well cooked and the both was bland. The Uni was NOT fresh, tasted like it had been sitting for a day. I really like the tuna salad and would recommend getting this again. 

[Decor]
The restaurant does some aged. Some of the chairs have cracks in them and the place did seem a little dusty. However, you get what you pay for so I'm not trying to spend an insane amount of time here eating my sushi. It's more in and out. There's also a sushi counter. 

Overall, great little hole-in-the-wall and very affordable for a dining experience. Plus, you get the added free sake thrown in. The location of the restaurant makes it a perfect place to meet before going out on Folsom.
author: Alice Z.

description: Great sushi and service. Absolutely loved the service and environment. Would come back again
author: Julian C.

description: Omg, the best sushi I've ever had. The chefs are super cool, known each other since they were teenagers. Their presentation is worthy of Michelin stars. They value quality fish and sustainable fish and you can taste the difference. I will be back here and often!!!
author: Carrie G.

description:
Albacore Tataki is a must try! We also had Lobster sushi, prawn tempura, and fried calamari. Everything was great and fresh!
The staff is very responsive and friendly. Checkin on yelp to claim your free sake!
author: Rumaisa M.

description: Great service. Sushi wasn't anything special, just the basic rolls. We weren't too impressed by the taste of the sushi.
author: Nadia S.

description: Been coming here regularly, food is always good. Loved coming here...until tonight. 2 other tables dining, and waited, and waited, and waited, and waited. No offer of drinks, no acknowledgement of our existence. Came here to celebrate a special occasion, and the service put a real damper on that. I know the place is slow, especially when busy, but man...30 minutes with no one else waiting? Watched the server literally stand at the sushi bar, doing nothing for a solid 5 minutes. Only was asked if we are okay once I stood up to leave. Don't come here on a weeknight, not if you feel like eating before they close.
author: Erik D.

description:
Cosy wooded interior. Not crowded on a Sat night. There is complimentary edamame as an appetiser. But our dishes arrived fast anyways.  

We had the chirashi and the ramen. The sashimi was fresh and the rice well-vinegared. Ramen was good, with a nicely done onsen egg. 

Price was also reasonable. I'll be back!
author: Lindt C.

description: This SUSHI  was SO GOOD!!!! Super fresh. Great service. Awesome date  strongly recommend red dragon, super dynamite, avocado salad, salmon sashimi, red spicy soup. Enjoy
author: Jessica H.

description: Forgot a roll of sushi, place is dirty, sushi isn't worth the price. Beyond that I would never go back.
author: Tyler T.

description: I've driven by quite a few times but I finally pulled the trigger and tried Kama. I got a specialty roll, I believe it was tiger something. It was delicious but what stood out and I would say is the best I've ever had was their California roll. I highly recommend it. Great ambiance as well.
author: Dan M.

description: Great place for dates and bringing friends trip. Friendly staff! Food is good, I usually order udon chicken soup which I think is number T7. It comes with all the works in a cool bowl!
author: Yaya D.

description:
Wow. Had the best sushi roll of my life at this place. (And that's saying a lot I love sushi and eat it all the time). 

We found this place on Yelp, and what a great find. When you are first seated, they bring you edamame to snack on, which was a nice surprise.

We started with 3 rolls - all great but the most amazing being the 49er roll. It had super thin pieces of lemon on top of salmon, and was stuffed with real snow crab. Honestly the best roll I've ever had and the mix of flavors was perfect. 

We also had the rainbow roll, and another with eel, mango and tuna on top. Everything was super fresh, and even though they were busy things came out quickly. 

I am pretty sure we might eat here everyday while we are in town. The staff was so friendly and did a great job of recommending items. 

If you are a sushi fan, this place is a must visit
author: Trish B.

description:
Damn! Back at it again with the Kama.

Recently went in for Happy Hour (5-6:30pm), and it was amazing. Now I understand why it's listed as having one of the best happy hour deals in SF! There isn't that many people shortly after 5pm so getting a table comes with ease. Came here with a few friends, and we were all seated immediately.

Ordered the Salmon Tataki, Albacore Tataki, Sake Nigiri, Maguro Nigiri, Tako Sunomono, Salmon Avocado Roll, & Unagi Avocado Roll.

Don't get the rolls only because they're just alright. The nigiris I guess is okay too, but go here for their appetizers! I recommend the tatakis! 5 pieces a plate for $5.50 is a steal. Normally the price for this kind of dish is at least twice as much for about the same amount. It tastes really good, and the onions combined with the seared fish really balances out the flavors and textures. The nigiris use really fresh cuts of fish so those weren't bad. I guess I'm not much of a raw octopus kind of guy since I didn't find any appeal in the tako sunomono.
author: Kevin S.

description:
Everything you want in a sushi place: 

Good Sushi
Great Staff
Reasonable Prices
Usually very low wait (only on peak times) 

Highly recommend!
author: Rory O.

description:
Despite the low health score warning, this place was pretty good (hence the 4 stars versus the 5, because they do need to handle that little "situation"). We were able to get in and seated relatively quickly, despite it being happy hour. We were provided with complementary edamame, which was ok, although personally I prefer my edamame to be heated and lightly salted (but what the heck, it was free). 

All the sushi we ordered was delicious. My favorites would have to be the Hot Mama and the Firecracker balls (deep fried tuna rolls- delish, but hold the "special sauce" if you're like me and not a fan of mayo).

Bonus points for this place actually having sweet potato rolls (and putting it on the happy hour menu, which was pretty extensive compared to some places that claim to have "happy hour"). 

All in all, I wouldn't mind returning to this place for a quick bite to eat...but they really need to handle that poor health rating score first!!

Pros:
-extensive happy hour
-quick service
-free saki if you check in on Yelp!

Cons:
-poor health score rating
-cold edamame
author: Tracy T.

description:
Good sushi! Fish was fresh, rolls were a good size and there were many many sauces and accompaniments. The squid legs were a good app but kinda sparse for the price. Another fun food item was the tempura green tea ice cream. It's pretty intense and definitely something to be shared. Also don't forget to check in on Yelp for free hot sake!

Looks kinda small when you walk in but there's a room at the back with a few booths and what looks to be traditional Japanese seating on the floor but actually has space for your legs to hang down. They have a cool system where you can then on a light that'll call your server over since you're a bit secluded.
author: Emily L.

description:
I don't understand why my o-toro was chewy.  for $7/piece...I was expecting something a lot better.  At least it wasn't fishy.

Rolls were just okay.  I don't think I will be back.  

But if you do decide to try it, check in for the free sake.  

Service was wonderful.  Too bad the food wasn't.
author: Jenny L.

description:
Great lunch specials!! I only came here for lunch so far and it's pretty packed - especially during lunch peak hours but service is fast and seats free up quickly :)

Lovee that the ramen comes with an avocado roll or cucumber roll for $10.95 and $1 extra to make your ramen spicy! Considering this place is a sushi restaurant, the ramen here is pretty good!! - one of the better ramen bowls in SF!

The Sake Don is good here too!  - the salmon sashimi is always super fresh and the fish roe makes this dish tastier and unique compared to other sushi places.

Overall, the service is great, waters were refilled frequently, and I will definitely continue to come here frequently!
author: Leilani Y.

description:
Easy to find. They were busy on a Thursday night but gave my family and I are table right away. Within seconds we had small kids cups and glasses of water for all. Very timely in taking orders and delivering the food. I asked for small pieces and they were cut perfectly. They even brought us little bits of mochi for the kids. I would recommend this restaurant to anyone. 
I had the pyramid roll and my husband had the curry udon. Both were delicious!!
author: Barbara S.

description:
I really liked the tonkatsu ramen here. Melt in your mouth meat, good broth, and chewy noodles.

I also had some salmon sashimi which was good as well. Didn't try the rolls, but will be back next time.

Service was good!
author: Alicia L.

description:
It gets pretty busy at lunch so it's a SoMa crowd favorite. You get edamame when you sit down. If you want water, you must make a request for it. 

Recommend:
SAKE OYAKO DON: As a salmon sashimi lover, the sake oyako don does not skimp on sashimi. The sashimi was fresh and thinly sliced. Generous portions with ten big pieces. I also love the ikura and mixing that with my sushi rice underneath. For the lunch special pricing, $15 is a pretty good deal. You also get a miso soup along with the meal. 

CRUNCHY LOBSTER ROLL: Kinda expensive at $15 but it's so damn good with salmon, avocado and all the crunchy flakes on top.

TIP: Make sure you check in on yelp to receive a free hot sake! You can only use one per table. The offer states that it gives a small sake for 1-2 people and a large sake for 3-4 people.

Service gets pretty busy during lunch rush and it might be hard to flag down a waitress but they were generally still polite and tried their best to get to us. I think they have another room of tables that they might open up for dinner. The establishment looks quite new on the inside and the decorations and paneling remind me of the inside of a cabin. There is a consumer alert warning for their yelp page which worried me the first time but overall, customers are still coming and eating here and I haven't experienced any issues.

For happy hour, I highly recommend getting the tataki. The albacore and salmon tataki were delicious. Five big pieces for each plate. I thought the rolls were kind of average but still good. Happy hour times are from 5-6:30pm.
author: Diana C.

description:
The food was okay. I put it an order for butabara, sake nigiri, and katsudon for dinner. Everything tasted great except the katsudon. I had high hopes for it too because I normally do not get a donburi/rice bowl meal.

The katsudon was very salty. Eating each spoonful made me take a sip or two of my iced tea to wash the taste away. Normally, I save my drink until the end of the meal so that I won't get full so quickly. But this time, I could not keep up that habit. I tried to eat the rice bits to tone down the saltiness, but I guess it soaked up the flavors of the egg and mushroom mixture/omelette. I ate as much of the katsudon as my tea lasted me, which is not a lot. 

I am truly sorry to have stopped eating this bowl of katsudon and letting the food go to waste. I was extremely sad to see a good portion of the food be taken away. I do hope that if I come back next time, the salt level of the meal is fixed so I can fully enjoy the katsudon experience.

I do not mind coming back just for the butabara. That pork belly skewer is seasoned with just the right amount of salt and pepper to compliment the fatty bits. This is an excellent grilled meat.
author: Jasmine V.

description:
Came back a few times since and food is still good. During the most recent visit we ordered the August roll, tonkatsu ramen, and hamachi kama. The first two orders were delicious but the hamachi was so salty. There was also barely any meat on it. I ate some of it then my bf tried it and also said it was way too salty, so we asked if we could get it fixed. 

The one male server there was really nice and remade it for us with less pepper or seasoning,but the female server who brought it back gave us attitude about telling them earlier since a lot of the fish was eaten. Honestly I felt bad but there was barely any fish to start and the second serving they brought back was WAY bigger, so I'm not sure what was up with the huge size difference. 

Overall I'd still recommend coming but have to update that my most recent experience wasn't the best. I'm docking a start for that and hoping the next time will fix it.
author: Sophia H.

description:
i brought my BFF here for her birthday lunch since she wanted to try the sushi here.  came on a saturday afternoon around 1245 and there were plenty of tables for 2.  i was actually worried that we'd have to wait!

we ordered the rainbow roll to share, a beautiful roll with assorted salmon, tuna and yellowtail on top of crab and avocado wrapped in seaweed.  the fish was quite fresh and tender, not too hard, not too dry.

my friend decided she wanted to try the ramen lunch special, so she had that plus a cucumber roll, which was included with the special.  she loved her ramen and finished off the bowl, every last noodle and drop of broth!

i had some of her cucumber roll which was pretty standard, nothing special about this basic roll with slices of cukes inside.

service was good, generally attentive, even though there was only one waiter visibly working the dining area.  he did a good job attending to our needs, refilling our water glasses, bringing out the bill at the end of the meal, etc.

for the quality and quantity of food, it was worth the $30 which included tax and tip.  i would recommend this sushi restaurant and would return if i'm in soma again.
author: Ellen L.

description:
3.5/5- Rounding up for great happy hour deals and great service
Kama Sushi may not offer the best quality fish around but they have great service, an awesome Happy Hour Menu (5-6:30pm I believe), and a decent variety of food at an affordable price. I came here on a Thursday night around 6:20. The place was pretty full but later on I realized they have a back room they don't open up unless more guests come. I was eating alone and was seated at the bar area. There were a few other people dining alone so it wasn't too uncomfortable. Parking is pretty easy in the surrounding area. I parked outside the Costco a few blocks away and walked over. Parking is mostly street and metered w/ a 2 hour limit until 6pm.

From the happy hour menu I got the fried oysters for $5.50 and a large bottle of Asahi for $4. The fried oysters were pretty good for the price. I'd say it's about the same quality as a casual eatery but for 5 bucks I'm not complaining. I also got the chirashi deluxe. The chirashi deluxe was $30 and included a variety of your run-of-the-mill fish like salmon, yellowtail tuna, albacore, butterfish, etc. But it also had hotate, a small piece of uni, and amaebi. The fish quality wasn't great but it's about what I expected for the size/price. The rice also had some taste though I personally prefer a bit more seasoning since the fish isn't as flavorful as super fresh fish. 

Overall, I was very happy with my meal here and I will definitely be back for more of their happy hour selection.
author: Vivian C.

description:
I cant always get to japantown for my fav sushi and this place is close enough that it makes getting sushi so easy.

good stuff here. good happy hour prices and a vegie soy ramen that is freaking awesome.

the staff is super friendly and i have never had a bad time here.
author: John C.

description: Get the spicy miso ramen! And the hot mama sushi roll. Both are absolutely delicious and the price is so reasonable.
author: Steph D.

description:
I wish I could tell you how the food is here, but I didn't end up staying long enough to find out. I walked in the door and was cheerfully greeted by the hostess standing at the computer across the room. She asked "how many" and I stated one. She outstretched her arm and stated "any small table or the bar."
First off, I am a big guy. The bar appeared to be an uncomfortable option for with about only 10 inches of counter depth to a glass shield to the food prep area. Looking at my other options, I decided on the small table in the corner.
The hostess left the area.
As I was struggling to sit at the table (my pant leg got caught on the chair) a waitress came up, asked if I was alone and told me I would have to move as the table was reserved. 
She indicated a different small table in between two occupied tables. There was only about a 5" gap between tables. To sit there I would either have to pull out the table to enter and then pull the table back in, or allow the people eating at the other tables to participate in a proctology exam as I wriggled past.
So I left.
The staff really needs to communicate better with each other about the availability of the seating.
If they are going to have patrons choose the table they sit at, they should place signs on tables that may be reserved.
Asking someone to move after offering them free reign on seating choice is embarrassing, especially when the alternative would require a huge amount of effort (I didn't bring my crane to lower me into the seat between the occupied tables).
No one was particularly rude, just insensitive and unorganized. I am not sure if I will try again sometime or not. It was not a good first impression.
author: Ken H.

description:
I haven't tried their lunch specials or happy hour deals, but I thought the food was pretty good when I went for dinner on a Saturday night. The free edamame to share and the free small hot sake with Yelp check-in were both a plus!

My boyfriend and I were hungry and just wanted to fill up, so no nigiri or sashimi this time around. We ordered the Red Dragon roll, Crunchy Lobster roll, and Spicy Miso Ramen. Portions were nice, and we really enjoyed the rolls, even though I was worried at first that the Crunchy Lobster roll might be covered in too much sauce. The ramen could have been better--There was a good kick, and the noodles were cooked well, but the broth was just okay.

Sadly, service was really lacking :( It took a while for a server to get us anything, including water, the free sake, our check, and our check after we put the credit card in. I think they might've been understaffed, but I feel like a Saturday night should be expected to be busy.

Still, I'd probably still try it out again for their lunch specials or happy hour deals. Maybe their service will be better then.
author: Sara L.

description:
om nom nom nooom.

I had the Sake and Ikura don. SO GOOD. The fish was fresh and they were very generous on the portions! There looked to be a lot of other good things to try.

Also had the tempera green tea ice cream. They put red bean on the side which was AHHHMAZING! 

I think I'll bring my parents here :)
author: Angela L.

description: Good food & excellent service.  I had my baby girl with me today & the server went above & beyond.  She brought out a special snack for baby (miso soup w/rice), a plastic spoon & plastic plate.  Really great staff - I will be back!
author: Sarah Louise H.

description:
It was ok for the price. Hamachi kama, a roll and tempura were good. Nothing out of the ordinary. The squid fries were over cooked and hard to eat. 

Saw people with more hot noodle dishes that looked more appetizing than our food.
author: Angela N.

description: Kama Sushi satisfied our sushi cravings. Not 100% authentic Japanese, but that's ok. It was still good! Everything tasted fresh and the restaurant was clean. If you're looking for decently priced nigiri and appetizers to share, definitely stop by!
author: C E.

description: Ate here today at lunchtime and I'm very disappointed. There was a baby cockroach crawling around our table!!!  I informed the man that was working the register and he didn't apologize or anything. Then the waitress came over a few minutes later said they could only offer 20% discount because the manager wasn't there. The waitress was really sweet and offered free desert. The star is for her. Never coming back here.
author: Missy P.

description:
Ordered Grub hub for 3 people and split the Pyramid roll, Spider roll, Boston roll, Super Spicy Tuna roll, and the Saba(mackerel) nigiri.

My favorite was the Pyramid roll out of these, but even that wasn't amazing. The rice to fish ratio was a little high, which made it hard to taste the fish. Rolls were not that flavorful in general. Super Spicy tuna just tasted like Sriracha. Mackerel nigiri tasted fresh and not fishy though. They did give us low sodium soy sauce so maybe that's why things tasted a little bland.

Overall, not a bad place for ordering in sushi if you live in Mission Bay(aka food desert) like I do. Would I go out of my way to eat here? Probably not. Are there better sushi restaurants in SF? Definitely.
author: Stephanie K.

description:
Ew ew and ew. Came here after Pride parade based on awesome Yelp reviews. FAIL. Cold edamame as a "welcome" to the table. We ordered chicken karaage appetizer and Ika Sugatayaki appetizers off the happy hour menu. BUYER BEWARE! You get what you pay for. The food that we decided NOT to order anything else....and left 

DONT BELIEVE THE (YELP) HYPE.
author: EarthaStarr P.

description:
A place that has a free sake when you check into Yelp will always hold a special place in my heart. (Not an alcoholic, I swear!)

Kama Sushi is pretty spacious - lots of tables, bar seats, and even more seating in the room next door! Service is very attentive and friendly. Food came out in a timely manner, and our waters were always filled.

Rolls are around $10-$15. Although not the best sushi I've ever had, they definitely don't skimp on fish and the portions are huge! 

Happy hour is everyday from 5pm-6:30pm. Every. Day. I'll cheers to that!
author: Christine S.

description: I love eating here, the staff is very friendly and the food is great! I often go here for lunch and have never had anything I didn't like. The food comes out quickly and they put free edamame on your table while you wait. I recommend coming here for lunch or dinner!
author: Mandy B.

description:
Good lunch special!

I got the ramen combo. My husband got the lunch box and we were both happy. 

The broth and the eggs were highlights of my ramen. The noodles theirselves were the low point. They just were not very interesting. The other toppings were good

The avocado roll that came with the combo was actually my favorite - super simple but really good. 

Also, they bring you edamame when you sit down which was really tasty. 

It was crowded at lunch time but the two of us still were able to sit right down. They were very efficient - which clearly is important at lunch time.
author: Sarah C.

description: One of the best salmon skin rolls I've had, very crispy, and lots of flavor. The mango mochi was good, and all of the sushi was fresh and flavorful. Clean environment, friendly staff, and it seemed very popular, we arrived halfway through happy hour, but people kept filling in after happy hour had ended. Will go back next time I am in town.
author: Joshua R.

description: Very delicious sushi/sashimi and a good price too. Happy hour is a good deal. Service is also nice. Food is prepared quickly and I love the presentation.
author: Chiao-Yu T.

description: Great service here and their food were pretty decent. We ordered seaweed salad, sushi, ramen, and udon. The udon was alright as the flavor was somewhat bland and I wasn't able to really taste the flavor of the beef. The sushi and seaweed salad were good. Delicious food but it was also quite pricey.
author: K. O.

description: Fresh salmon and red tuna ! Yum Yum
author: Remi A.

description: Great happy hour every day from 5-6:30! Free small sake with yelp check in. Great service.
author: Joanna G.

description:
The line wasn't bad for lunch at 12:30, so I was happy to just get a seat at the sushi bar.  What made my day was the generous and tender portion of chu toro that melted in my mouth along with fresh shima aji nigiri.  The omakase combo was fresh and just right for lunch.  

I'd come back in a heart beat.  The service is friendly and I enjoyed my meal.  I'm gonna Kama Kama Kama Sushi back =b
author: Jenny L.

description:
This place was so delicious and so reasonably priced for sushi.

Atmosphere: Cute restaurant with lots of wood. Kind of small but we were able to get a seat right away.

Drinks: We got a bottle of the Malbec which was only $32- I would say a good price for a bottle of wine in SF.

Rolls: All the rolls we got were so good. Ranked in order of preference: The White Out (I loveeee butterfish), C27, Hot Mama, Red Dragon. The Hot Mama was pretty heavy since it was baked, but it was really different from the other rolls which I liked. The Red Dragon was really good but a little too spicy for me (I liked the spicy tuna but next time would ask for no red pepper flakes on top). All the rolls were priced between $10- $13 which is SO reasonable for really good sushi.

Came here a second time and got the white out again, foxy, and pyramid. Also started with the salmon tower appetizer. Everything I've gotten here has been so good!! And really good rice to fish ratio!!

They also have happy hours during the week from 5- 6:30, and a glass of wine is $5 and a large Sapporo is $4!!

Overall: Will definitely be coming here again! Love this place.
author: Jenna G.

description:
I give 3.5/5 for the food and 5/5 for the service. 

I like exploring different sushi restaurants around the Bay Area and I stopped by this restaurant for dinner with my friend on Sunday night.

They have lots of dishes on the menu and the food came pretty fast. Here are what we ordered:
Agedashi Tofu -- decent, but the sauce is a bit too salty.
Toro Nigiri -- $12.95 for 2 pieces, okay quality; a bit fishy
Torched salmon belly w/ shallots and ponzu sauce-- pretty good, if I go again, I would definitely order this dish. 
August 4th roll -- pretty mediocre. I wish the roll could include bigger portion of unagi. 
Dragon roll -- I like their dragon roll more than the August 4th roll but if I am craving for this roll,  I won't go out of my way to Kama to order it. The unagi in the restaurant does not seem to be that good to me.
Oyakadon -- the dish is a bit too salty but in general, it is decent.
author: Clare L.

description: Everything was perfect. From the ambiance, to the service, to the scrumptious food. Every single thing we ordered was fantastic. We couldn't stop eating the complimentary Edamame, their miso soup was great (they have a clam version!), the fish used for our deluxe sushi set was so fresh - it almost melts in your mouth, and the dessert we ordered - fried ice cream - was perfect! It was such a great experience eating in this restaurant and we will be back again for sure.
author: Trisha D.

description:
We came here for our friend's birthday dinner. His girlfriend had reserve a private "tatami room" for our party. Turns out that the private room was more like a booth without tatami mats.  The pillows looked like they hadn't been cleaned in ages. More than anything, it was extremely difficult to move around the table because we were all boxed in. I did not enjoy that part of the experience.

I did appreciate the light switch to alert our waitress. It was helpful. Service was great.

The food was good, but nothing too memorable.

I doubt that I'll return here in the future.
author: Richa N.

description:
Karaage (fried chicken) Ramen: 5 stars.  Every bite of the chicken was amazing and the broth was full of flavor.  I'm ordering this again.

Salmon and Tuna nigiri: 3 stars.  Great texture, but the salmon had no flavor.  Also, the rice was too loose.

Avocado and cucumber rolls (that came with our ramen): 2 stars.  Ok, I get these aren't supposed to be showcased in any way, but some of the pieces were falling apart.  Not sure if it wasn't rolled tight enough, or if the nori edges weren't wet enough to be held together.
author: Rego S.

description: We ordered ramen lunch special, dragon roll and fish taco. All of them were delicious, and the service and price were good. A good place if you want some sushi without paying much.
author: Tianjia C.

description:
I was blown away by how wonderful both the food and service were. My friend took me here and ordered a variety of nigiri from the menu. The walu (escolar butter fish) sake (salmon), and hamachi (yellowtail) were all delicious options, but the albacore cheek definitely takes the cake. We also ordered two options off the specials menu: kinmedai (goldeneye snapper) and medai (Japanese butter fish) and I'm totally in love with butter fish now. 

In terms of non-nigiri options, we enjoyed the Soft Shell Crab ($6.95) which is good if you are into tempura fried seafood. I wanted the Super Spicy Tuna Roll ($9.95) which is apparently the spiciest special roll on the menu... and it was pretty good! Kama is very generous with their portions of fish on their sushi and I have rarely tasted anything fresher than what they serve here.

Our meal was accompanied by hot tea (DELICIOUS!) and hot sake, the latter of which you can get by checking in on Yelp. The conclusion of our experience was brought to us by Fried Green Tea Ice Cream. Fantastic end to a lovely dinner. The service was very professional, although they are not very good with menu suggestions. Anyways, Kama is very near the top of my favorite sushi places list in SF!
author: Stefanie C.

description:
A surprisingly okay place to find ramen in a random sushi joint. My friend and I decided to come here on the suggestion of a friend, but after doing my due diligence of Yelp, it seemed as though most Yelpers felt a bit meh about the sushi. Plus I didn't want to risk food poisoning which looks like it happened to a few other Yellpers. 

We arrived right at noon and the place was basically empty during the hour that we were there. I went with the chicken karaage ramen which came with either an avocado or cucumber roll.

The chicken karaage ramen was actually pretty good. Chicken karaage was pretty spot on--not the best karaage that I've ever had, but it was still good. The ramen noodles themselves and the broth were great though. The noodles were on the firmer side though still chewy, and the broth tasted really peppery which I think is something that could be very bad to some, but something I ended up actually really enjoying since it was a nice change in pace. It's definitely not a purist bowl of ramen though--lots of corn and other random stuff floating around, but it's also ramen in a sushi place, so that's probably why.

tldr; decent ramen here!
author: Jasmine X.

description: First visit - had the sushi lunch combo.  It was just ok, with smallish fish portions.   Complimentary edamame were cold and a bit mushy.    Probably not going to go back.
author: Dave C.

description: Horrible food, there was a fly in my food. I brought a friend from out of town since this place is close to my place. However we received nasty service and they were not flexible at all. I offered a custom roll and told her to charge whatever, she came back 5-6 minutes later saying sorry we can't do it but you can choose a roll and we can make 1 change to it, I told her one change and she goes to ask the chef again and comes back 5 minutes later saying she can't. Are you kidding me!!! Never coming back again. When I finally ordered one of their basic rolls, they had a fly in it!!! Yuck!!!!!!!
author: Shanzay H.

description:
Dont forget the free hot sake with Yelp check-in!
This place is clean and is a great place to take vegetarians cuz it has lots of vegetarian options, but Kama also has a big menu of regular rolls and sashimi. I came here for dinner on a Saturday night and ordered the August 4th and Foxy Roll.  I was starving so I wolfed down the two rolls and I was stuffed! Overall, it's pretty good value for sushi especially in SF. I thought both of the rolls I ordered were tasty but I wish they had more rolls with salmon.
Next time I'm craving sushi in SF, I'd probably stop by here again.
author: Sylvia Y.

description:
Cheap Lunch menu!

I am very picky with Japanese food. There must be variety and of course, deliciousness! Kama has a wide variety with their bento box options, which also come in large portions. They give complimentary edemame when you eat in shop and the service is really quick and friendly. Everything I've had so far was decent but I wasn't a fan of their sashimi. Their bento boxes, sushi rolls, and noodles are a-ok in my book!

Also, try their ramen or curry noodles. Make sure you're not wearing a white shirt on that day, I learned it the hard way.
author: Linda K.

description: I came here with my bf for lunch on a weekend. The staff was friendly and welcoming, and our food came pretty fast. We ordered a few rolls, and we enjoyed the food here. Prices are not bad, fairly average. The rolls are tasty, portions are pretty big. They have skewers here, rolls, ramen, a wide range of dishes. The rolls are on average $13 and its fairly good. The only problem with this location is that you would need to find street parking. I remember when we came here, there was a couple talking about how great the tea tasted, and the server gave them a bunch of tea samples to take home, which was super nice of him. Definitely great service on that part! Small cozy location.
author: Amy Y.

description: Very friendly, probably family run. Lots of regulars. Good standards like Hamachi sashimi with lots of creativity; nice tatami & scallop skewers. GREAT happy hour and they even gave a "last call" rather than hope we didn't order before the clock expired. We had 7 items + soda for $61 before tip; complimentary hot tea and edamame. Surprisingly easy parking on the street; free after 6PM. We paid $0.50 @5:54
author: Jeff C.

description: Came here for lunch. The service is very good and it's a small space that's nice for a casual meal. Had the salmon bowl, the salmon was a decent portion and quality. I decided to splurge and order some uni nigiri but the uni was not fresh. Told the server and she was very considerate, removing it from the bill and brining us complementary strawberry mochi ice cream. Lunch also came with miso soup which was a bonus. I probably wouldn't return for sushi but if try a cooked dish. Looks like they have some soups that could be fulfilling.
author: Lauren K.

description:
This is one of my newest go-to Japanese spots when I'm in the mood for a variety of dishes and not just Sushi alone

What I love:
- Quality of food is definitely a 4+
- Sush is pretty solid, but not a 5 star. For $$ though it's pretty good
- AWESOME HH menu with tons of good deals on food & beers
- Gyozo is delicious
- Their skewers are really good and freshly grilled
- Even the Ramen is pretty solid here
- Wide selection of dishes on almost all the popular favorites
- The decor, plates, and accessores are really authentic and makes you feel like you're in Japan

I usually come here and order tapas style on dishes far beyond sushi (and share the larger dishes) with some sushi on the side. If you want purely solid Sushi though.. particularly nigiri style, I'd go somewhere else.
author: Pratul L.

description:
Tasty, good sushi-- prices decent for SF
Great deal checking in for free sake
author: Y W.

description:
First time tried the spoon.. yummmmmm..
Friend recommended and was delish - with quail egg, fish eggs n other awesomeness.
We also had a great hot sake to start with gyoza.
And chicken katsu Don was a huge portion
author: Div M.

description: Great time at Kama sushi spot. The decor is modern, friendly serving staff and good food! I enjoyed the sushi and the chicken teriyaki!
author: Rhett B.

description:
This is a great sushi place in San Francisco with easier parking and decent prices. It's not too far from the opera, symphony, and ballet in Civic Center, which is great because most restaurants in Hayes Valley are jam packed. 

I have enjoyed their sashimi platter, tekka rolls, chicken katsu curry, and chirashi box. All the fish was very fresh. The portions were very reasonable given the prices. The chicken katsu was my least preferred dish. Though it's a decent dish, there was nothing special about it and it came with no vegetables. Perhaps I'm an odd ball, but I like some vegetables with my carbs and meat.

Other offerings include ramen, yakitori, small plates, fried fish, rolls, and more. This place for both lack a food selection.

The alcohol selection is alright, especially the wine. The beer selection could use some work. And though I'm no fan of sake, they have a bountiful (to me) selection.

Service can take a while on busy evening, especially weekends. So plan ahead.
author: Adriana A.

description: We walked in an hour before closing. Everyone was super sweet and nice. When you check in you get a free hot sake! Awesome deal! We had the golden dragon roll, tuna Poki, ma Saba nigiri, chicken Katsu, and the cheesecake dessert. It was spectacular! Nothing was over salted or over dressed. The portions were shareable and just enough to keep us filled and ready to dance at the DNA lounge right next door!
author: Diana P.

description: Love the foods, love the people. They are so friendly and I promise the foods are so fresh.
author: Kelvin Y.

description:
This place was so great! Came on Saturday dinner for one of my best friend's bridal weekend. Jason and em(Emily?) were our servers and they were phenomenal. Mind you, we were a bunch of LOUD ladies, but they were never rude and even joined in in the fun. They were prompt in assisting us whenever we would turn on the light (such a great idea by the way!) and were so hospitable! 

The food was delicious! I can't remember exactly what we ordered because I'm not the 'foodie' of the group but it consisted of their popular rolls, udon, sashimi, and a fish and a rice dish, so we definitely sampled across the menu. Anyways, it was all delicious. We did several sake bombs too (do it!!!)

The location of our table was perfect (cute corner, private area!), which was absolutely conducive to our pre-partying (haha), and the location of the restaurant was great--walking distance to several strips of bars and clubs. 

Would highly recommend!
author: Julie N.

description:
Walked by here on my way to another restaurant but stopped here instead. Glad I did. I came around 12:30 PM on a Wednesday and it was really busy, but I was seated at the bar immediately. The service was EXTREMELY prompt and all the girlies who waited on me were super friendly. It felt like every time I took a sip of water, it was full again. Awesome.

I ordered the lunch special which came with miso soup, a small mixed greens salad, and 2 rolls. All for $11.95. DEAL. The soup and salad were good, average, on par with everywhere else. I got the salmon avocado roll and tempura sweet potato roll. Really really good. It tasted fresh and damn I love sushi!!! Hadn't had it forever. I'd like to make note that for the first time that I can ever remember at a sushi spot, I did not run out of ginger. Thank you, Kama, for giving me enough  ginger the first go around. Simple things make me happy. Anyways, food came out quick and it was all great. Would come here again and order lots more kind of rolls.
author: Erica S.

description: Great Sushi Lunch Spot in SOMA! Good deals and tasty food!
author: Julia R.

description:
this place was pretty good! came here last night with my girlfriends and ordered an abundance of food - tuna poke, gyoza, tonkotsu ramen (spicy), and 4 rolls. it was so much food. we all checked in for the free sake of course! yummmm.

everything was super fresh - the rolls too!  usually there is too much rice and not enough fish, but these rolls were packed with delicious and fresh fishies! my faves were the toro and white out rolls, the crunchy lobster was a bit disappointing.. service is on the slower side, but very courteous!  $100 for 4 people for dins before tip - not a bad deal!
author: Christina L.

description: I love this stop. I ordered delivery from them last night. The Sashimi chef's choice has really nice cuts of fish. I also like their Miso soup. They have an awesome happy hour where you can get rolls for really cheap. Highly recommend.
author: Cynthia G.

description: Would get four stars but the main room has the door wide open with the chilly SF air breezing through, and that isn't too comfortable for dinner. They give you cold edamame for free starter. The hamachi Kama was good, and the quail egg/salmon roe spoon. The negima yakitori was ok but too much sweet sauce on it and not very good quality chicken I think, tasted like food court chicken. The hamachi carpaccio app was good-- had avocado on it. We didn't like the oysters at all.
author: Bertha O.

description:
Great sushi and great service. Check in on yelp for free sake! So worth it. 

All the rolls are delicious, but I highly recommend the hot/spicy dynamite and hot mama roll! Also, for an appetizer, try the hamachi kama. Yum!
author: Gina P.

description: Came here for delicious sushi. I would say given the price point and area, it's totally worth it and definitely a bang for your buck. They give complimentary edamame too when you sit down, which is SUPER nice considering many restaurants charge you for that.
author: Nadia H.

description:
We got (4 people) room in the back room. Interesting service by buzzer. 
Good fair enough service though. 
Food was good. 
I just felt like not clean enough. The seating mat and area... is kind of typical old restaurant. 
I would go again but I wish they upgrade their interior.
author: Green Mango Y.

description: Really yummy, nice happy hour (5-6:30) and try the salmon tataki--it's amazing! Edamame was just so-so, otherwise it'd be 5 stars....but edamame was free, so no foul. ;)
author: Olivia S.

description: Amazing sushi! Fantastic prices, waiter was so nice and patient. The only bad part was my date. UGH, what a waste of money. Not on the food but on her. I swear next time I'm going by myself and just eating at the bar
author: Michael O.

description:
Terrific find. Rice is stand out. Great vessel for the perfect fish. Selection is interesting. Presentation is dynamite. Each piece of fish is the right size, with the right details. 

This is Nino:

The maguro nigiri style was a perfect mix of fish and rice. The maki rolls are the perfect size and you can customize them with whatever you want. And for those allergenic people they have gluten free soy sauce.  

There you go.
author: John P.

description: The place is very Japanese feel, ramen is good, food taste OK.
author: V P.

description:
This particular location on 9th and Folsom appears jinxed considering how it has changed from the Tyrolean beer hall of Schnitzel Haus to the embattled soul food eatery Daddy-O's to now this sushi spot. Strangely, it still feels like a Tyrolean beer hall with all the blond wood paneling even if the owners are trying to make it feel like a hipsterish sushi bar. The customers didn't seem to care. It was packed for a Monday night around 8PM when I was in desperate need for some ramen to soothe my work-saturated soul. I fortunately landed a table next to two German women who must be staying in one of the nearby motels given their complete ignorance of Japanese cuisine.

Under the mistaken presumption that I know what was good here based on my ethnicity, they kept ordering what I was ordering. Too bad they missed Schnitzel Haus. I checked in to discover I was entitled to a free bottle of sake which I took warm (photo: http://bit.ly/19yj4GY). That was a happy surprise as it was quite cold that evening. I started slow by ordering the $4.95 pair of Hamaichi Nigiri Sushi, which allowed me a taste of reasonably fresh yellowtail if the serving was rather paltry for the price (photo: http://bit.ly/1bxFn0F). Next came the $5.95 Butadara Skewers, which were again rather paltry with grilled pork belly served yakitori-style on wooden sticks (photo: http://bit.ly/1jfFu5n). The main event was the $9.95 bowl of Karaage Ramen, which was a marginal disappointment.

It came in a fashionably wavy black bowl steeped in a soy-based broth and topped with pieces of deep fried chicken that were honestly not as flavorful as McNuggets. There was green onion, dried seaweed and even sweet corn thrown into the broth, but the strangest touch was raw romaine lettuce which looked like it was lost on its way to a Caesar salad (photo: http://bit.ly/1b2QnrX). The noodles at least were acceptable with a nice al dente texture that diverted some of my attention from the random lettuce sightings. The German hausfraus seem to like it. Service was rather on the erratic side, but I still hope the owners beat the jinx of this corner location and stick around since quality sushi eateries are uncommon in SoMa since Sushi Groove South hit the bricks.

FOOD - 3 stars...erratic and sometimes paltry with a hit-and-miss ramen bowl that could be majorly tweaked to maximize flavor
AMBIANCE - 2.5 stars...strangely (though understandably) Tyrolean
SERVICE - 2.5 stars...sometimes they come and sometimes they don't
TOTAL - 3 stars...middling Japanese is better than none in SoMa
author: Ed U.

description:
Very accommodating staff, super friendly, flexible with modifications, and great food! Will be back!

Side note -request Edmond, and you will be in perfect hands! So nice to feel Chicago hospitality on the west coast for a change! Incredible experience.
author: liz s.

description:
Two words: Butabara Skewers (pork belly skewers).

Came here with a friend for happy hour and ordered ~$50 worth of food. Left so full I had to take sushi home (I know, a sin). Nothing really stood out for me: for example, the Wakame (seaweed) salad was just as I expected it to be; all the sushi rolls we ordered (e.g., Spicy Tuna roll, California Roll, etc.) were good, but not particularly outstanding (definitely not bad); the sashimi was exactly as it should be (fresh). Only the 2 pork belly skewers were memorable (in a pleasant way!).

Would come back if I had a sushi craving and when I stay in SOMA.
author: Sheryl D.

description: We love this place! Our go to spot in SF! Great service! Great food! Who can ask for more!
author: Misty R.

description:
The food was good, sake was good, service was good, atmosphere was great, but two complaints:

The seating was tight, and I have a sneaking suspicion they microwave everything.
author: Nishant G.
