description:
Wow. Horrible. I have not had food like this in a long time where the tonkotsu ramen was cold, the fish smelled like it had been sitting around for awhile and no distinct flavor otherwise. My fiancé and I are visiting SF and was hoping for some delicious sushi after a long day of sitting on the plane. Unfortunately we left the restaurant feeling sick and grossed out instead. When the ramen arrived, I was at first excited about the large bowl, but when I bit into the pork "chop" (it was mostly the fatty bits), I was hit with cold meat. The soup wasn't even hot! When I asked if they could heat it back up, they took it, probably nuked it in the microwave and brought it back lukewarm at best.

The sushi did not taste fresh at all and we couldn't even bring ourselves to eat the rest of it after the initial bite. When we got our check, the price was pretty steep at $50 for 3 tiny rolls and mediocre ramen. Don't go here! Im only giving it a 2 star because service was okay.
author: Anna C.

description: Service is good! fish is not that fresh, price is medium. The rice i ordered is way too much sauce.
author: Susana M.

description:
I think I've found my favorite sushi joint in the city. Yes. I mean it. This time. Giants game is on. Traffic was horrendous. But not this part of town. 9th and Folsom, across from that Mexican bar that I liked. He's sitting at the bar, ordered a cold house Sake for a hot night, waiting. I was simply frazzled because there were still a lot of work to do even though the weekend was upon us. He chose this place because I was about to head over to an art gallery later on. He rode his bike to meet me there and by the tim I arrived, he already ordered some specials on the board, some flying fish and hamachi nigiri. I was quite delighted by the fish to rice proportion. Reminds me of Japan, not a lot of rice, plenty of fish. Happy Hour menu rendered some delectables: saba, hamachi, skewers, spicy tuna roll and then some. But what really caught my eye was the tamago on display on the sushi counter.

Tamago = Japanese egg omelette. You may say, that's total cheap stuff! Not so. Not if you ever watched David Gelb's Jiro Ono documentary, you'd know that Jiro's tamago is a test must be performed by his apprentice, 200 times, no less. When done right, tamago tasted like savory sweet egg custard, it melts in your mouth and renders you speechless and breathless. Like the vegetarian version of uni, good tamago is the ultimate food euphoria. When I was at the Japanese fish market this winter, I found a vendor that sold nothing but varies versions of tamago. And at the famed sushi stalls in the fish market, when you order omakase, the sushi chefs will always start you off with tamago nigiri. I too once thought of tamago as the poor man's sushi, but ever since this Nippon expedition, I was a convert. The texture and color of this tamago looked great. I then found out that it was on the happy hour special for $2.95 a pair. I ordered one set to start but said to the waitress, "I may need to have another order of it, if you don't mind." She acknowledged and then walked away. "Unless it's terrible," I said to him under my my breathe. He smiled at my remark. It's not. As expected, the tamago nigiri had the perfect taste, texture and presentation. 

He was having a bit of too much fun observing me transforming while eating tamago nigiri: one minute I was this anxious workaholic talking shop, the next, a soft, giggling female looking ever bit of dreamy and lustful.. of the next piece of nigiri. 

The rest of the meal was filled with me waving down the waitress and asking them to load up on the rolls and more nigiri. He ate much less than I did, perhaps he's just less excitable in general, or less enthusiastic about the sushi here, meanwhile, I couldn't shut up about the softness of tamago. "You like this, don't you? Better than those places on California, Balboa, or Arguello?" He asked, already knew my answer. "Yes." I said. "This could be my favorite, you know." I added.

Hamachi, Maguro, Bonito, Walu, Tobiuo, Albacore, Saba, those are my favorite nigiri. The seared hamachi dish as an appetizer was also quite good with red onions. House cold sake was better than what I had in other places. Clean and pure. 

Busy night ahead. He parked his bike in front of the restaurant, then walked me to the car to unload the left overs, then we continued on foot to the gallery a few blocks down. 

We ate well. He and I. We always did. While this might be his suggestion, it's now my new obsession.
author: Victoria E.

description:
Kama's walls and ceiling are covered in beautiful wood paneling and makes you think you walked into a modern wooden cabin to eat japanese food!  Walking inside makes you think you are transported away from the SOMA neighborhood outside.  

I ordered the chicken udon and red dragon roll.  The udon is in my top 5 udon list!  It's really that good!  The broth was clear and tasty without being too salty.  The chicken was tender and moist.  Most definitely recommended!

I could have done without the red dragon roll because I was so full off the udon but if I wasn't so full, I would have enjoyed it so much more!  It was basically a spicy tuna roll with some tuna on top.  It had the right amount of spiciness and the fish was fresh!  I can see myself coming back here for lunch again!
author: Christy Y.

description:
Went for dinner last night, spur-of-the-moment as was in the neighborhood. I know the rule is to not go to sushi on Sundays, but alas, went anyway.

I was incredibly disappointed. From the wilted sad looking edamame, to the super watered-down hot sake, to the flavorless rice-less roll (can't remember the name) served with the flavorless ponzu sauce. We had a couple of other rolls and nigiri that were ok, and the seaweed salad was fine, but by then I was over it. 

Who waters down sake!? Shame!
author: Jen J.

description:
I give Kama a 2.5 stars.

I would say my experience here is mediocre. They have happy hour until 6pm and you can pretty much get the standard happy hour sake/beer/smaller dishes/rolls as any Japanese happy hour goes. 

What's is fantastic is the free small hot sake they give you when you check in on Yelp!

1. I tried what seems to be the most famous uni with quail egg - it was good but nothing special, pretty standard. It didn't taste really fresh but it didn't also taste bad. It was just meh. The uni without quail egg was a bit fishy for me.

2. Now the shocking rubber I bit into was the Spicy Hamachi Toro -- not sure what this creature was... rubbery, spices do not compliment the fish and overwhelms the fish

3. The roll (Lucy I think) was pretty good but I think the eel was a bit too sweet with tok much sauce.

4. Seaweed salad was very large and pretty good.

5. Veggie ramen was pretty good - good clean taste but nothing super special. Veggies are fresh and varieties of nice toppings (daikon, cabbage, bamboo, fried veggie dumpling, corn) - pretty flavorful. 

Overall, nothing is extraordinary where you would come here to eat a specific dish but if you're looking for decent Japanese in the area, give it a try.
author: Sarah K.

description:
I'm here 3+ times a week since my office is so close, but still... 3 stars.

Anything raw is going to be really good, but they clearly cut corners on anything involving cooked chicken, and the edamame is usually a bunch of different colors and levels of softness because they keep it too long.  
  
Prices are good. This place would be an easy 5 stars if they cared more about the quality of their non-fish ingredients.
author: Patrick S.

description: These guys really helped me out tonight. Sometimes a performance goes beyond the role of a restaurant but the victory remains secret. Kama deserves a medal but you'll never hear about the ceremony.
author: trevor c.

description:
Happy hour = amazing - huge selection, all delicious.

Service = A+ attentive but not overbearing. 

Food and quality = 5 stars! The crunchy lobster roll is a must. We also had the spicy salmon (highly recommend), gyoza, 49er roll, miso soup and seaweed salad. Everything was top notch! 

Bonus points = music selection was on point. 

Would absolutely recommend this place and come here again!
author: Malley D.

description: 10/10 service, very attentive and friendly staff, food was 7/10 nothing to die for but definitely delicious. Would definitely come again soon
author: Cory N.

description:
amazing rolls, fun to eat w friends at, and never have I had to wait to get a table. 

they have a wide variety of rolls, and their appetizers are also incredibly fun as well! I really enjoyed their hamachi Kama and dashi tofu. order some rolls to share with friends & you've got a great meal!
author: Cathy Y.

description: I was craving sushi and decided to yelp the closest spot near me. So glad Kama Sushi popped up. This place is amazing! The service was prompt, personal and friendly. The interior is clean/renovated. The moment we sat we were greeted with sake (yelp check-in) and edamame on the house. We ordered the Deluxe Dinner Set (comes with sushi, sashimi, Red Dragon Roll, miso soup), the Chicken Teriyaki dinner set (came with miso soup and salad), Spicy Salmon roll, Spider Roll. Everything was melt-in-your-mouth delicious. No thick chunks of rice around the rolls, sashimi and sushi was cut to perfection and so fresh (again, not chewy but melt in your mouth). The teriyaki and rice was yummy. The sake was warm. We were totally stuffed (2 of us) and our bill for all of the above was $60. Definitely going back again!
author: Anisa M.

description:
Had lunch here recently with a couple of co-workers.  Food was pretty good.  
Our group had:
Lunch box with Teriyaki Chicken and spicy tuna roll
Lunch box with Teriyaki Chicken and tempura 
Spicy Ramen with karage chicken

Not bad. Not bad at all.  I wouldn't exactly write home about the teriyaki sauce.  But everything about the lunch was reasonably enjoyable and tasty.
author: Lewis C.

description:
Just had Joe Sushi Dinner with free hot sake found on yelp. Food was prepared very poorly and food was below standard. I hopped place had more signature spice or taste to the dish but unfortunately when I tried Uni they've served two different type which was unacceptable. 

However, they have lovely environment, and staff were friendly and caring. I hope this restaurant invest more on tasting that allow people in SF to enjoy true sushi experience.

I'm very not SF person since I've just got here one year ago, but I believe who ever see this review will be similar who's looking to have great sushi experience. 

I believe their kitchen food is average. But sushi was somewhere C- I've tried to be nice to the place since I have so much experience with Japanese and Korean food, but C- is only acceptable grade to offer. 

Sake idea must stay there. If fish quality is little bit better would made this place line of customers who wants the experience.
author: Brandon H.

description:
The food was good, but the service was mediocre.  We always needed to flag down someone to refill our water because no one checked on us unless they delivered food to our table.  I even had to help myself to the pitcher I saw sitting on the counter.  The wait staff was really nice though.  Anyway, we ordered:

Mixed Tempura 
Aga Dashi Tofu - Breaks apart easily
Chicken Karaage - Very dry
Beef Skewers
Butabara Skewers - Sauce was good
Torikawa Skewers - We ordered 2 of these because they're that good.
Mochi Skewers
Crunchy Lobster roll
author: Rachel L.

description: This is one of my goto sushi places. Great balance of price to quality. They have a great menu of not only sushi but also some great izakaya as well. For me a whole meal of only sushi is a little flat but if i can balance it out with some skewers and hot soups etc its a much more balanced experience. Fairly easy to get a seat here and its in an easy to get to location.
author: Justin S.

description: Four leaf clover sushi is a vegetarian's dream! The best veggie sushi in the Bay Area. Veggie udon & ramen are also quite good. The vibe is friendly, the place cozy, it's a place you can come in and have a casual beer, a nice date, or a classy dinner.
author: Alex M.

description: One of the worst sushi experiences I've ever had. Not sure if it's what I ordered, but I usually love soft shell crab. It was horrible and burnt, but uncooked at the same time. Also the sushi...I ordered the lobster roll it was covered with all of this crispy stuff. I have no words for this experience.
author: Sereen S.

description:
KAMA TO MAMA!

This place was an absolute sushi jackpot after a boozy jaunt through the SF Beer Week Opening Night party. While I did learn that a belly full of beer + large quantities of sushi are not the healthiest or most digestion-friendly combo, I would definitely go back on an empty tank to stuff myself properly with their fresh, fishy creations. 

Things to love:
- The large, hip, lounge-y space with two separate dining rooms, and lots of space for groups. 
- The surprisingly awesome playlist (a la Little Dragon...yes please!)
- The "100% off sake" check-in offer on Yelp!
- The humongous menu with something for every palate: Americanized mayo-laden rolls, fresh sashimi, skewers or ramen...you name it!
- The ridiculously generous portion sizes
- The chipper & always-there-when-you-need them staff 

That Crunchy Lobster Roll is still haunting me. It showed up looking like a mound of tempura crunchies, but underneath was all the lobster love. Make your friends jealous and order this guy. The Golden Dragon roll was beautiful and sumptuous too. Nothing we ordered wasn't oooh-aaah worthy.

I don't think of SOMA as a dining destination, but the next time I wanna indulge after work Kama will be fresh on the brain.
author: Nique F.

description:
A restaurant with two rooms - one has two areas of low seating (Japanese style) and some booths, and the other is a straightforward open area with tables.

The food is fairly standard Japanese fare: mostly sushi, but with a fair selection of noodles and rice as well. The quality is perfectly OK, but not exceptional, though be warned that their noodle dishes tend on the spicy side of spicy. The staff were very nice and helped us out of a potential problem - we'd booked a table but another private party was so noisy we had to be reseated.

Very reasonably priced for the area.
author: David J.

description: Our go-to for sushi in SOMA. Good service, food, and friendly atmosphere. There's usually parking available nearby as well.
author: Alexis G.

description:
Spent a lot of time oscillating between 2 and 3 stars but eventually had to go for 2 stars.  To me, 3 stars implies that I would say "it's OK", but the honest truth is I would recommend strongly against friends coming here.  

I'm a big sushi fan, and have spent a lot of time checking out the highest regarded sushi places in each city.  I'd say the best sushi I've had so far was at the Shiro sushi bar in Seattle.

Here's the bullets:
 - Ordered 12 piece sashimi.  Wanted Omakasi but they were out (Sunday)

 - Sashimi was in the bottom half of sashimi I've had, but was not "bad".  Most of the sashimi didn't taste super fishy (good thing), but did have a stringy, almost chewy consistency (bad thing).  Good salmon, for example, tends to melt in your mouth, while this salmon was borderline chewy.  Not terrible, but not good.  3 stars on the sashimi plate.

 - The thing that really pushed me from 3 stars to 2 stars was the Toro.  Toro is my favorite kind of nigiri or sashimi.  Toro is a relatively hard to find, fatty, buttery, delicious tuna.  It's a bit more expensive than other types of fish: I've seen it range up to 30 bucks and as low as 12 bucks for nigiri.  Here it was 12.

Usually toro is "melt in your mouth" fatty and buttery.  I still fantasize about the toro I had at Shiro.

Kama's toro was EASILY the worst I've ever had.  It had the correct texture: fatty and buttery.  However, the flavor was not smooth at all: it had a fishy, borderline chlorinated flavor to it that made me wonder if it was even safe to eat.  It was genuinely gross and I would not be surprised to find out that I feel sick tomorrow.  My "best case" here is it tasted bad because it was Sunday and they were about to throw it out.  However, I'd say it's borderline negligent that they're serving toro that tastes THIS fishy and bad.

 - My table also ordered some rolls.  The lobster roll was actually super tasty.  If you're STRICTLY coming here for rolls, I'd say that some of these rolls are in the 3 or 4 star range.

Tl;dr: Some of the rolls were pretty good.  If you're only into rolls, not a terrible choice.  The sashimi was in the bottom half of sashimi I've had, and the toro was borderline gross.
author: Casey P.

description:
Just visited Kama for the first time because I was in the neighborhood. Ordered Ramen & Cucumber Rolls to go. I got back to my office and opened my paper sack to find two containers. One small cup with stock and a second rectangular shallow dish with noodles, pork & egg. While I was impressed to see the noodles separate from the stock for obvious reasons.

There was no container large enough to combine the two. Mind you this was a takeout order.
Needless to say, there was no way to eat this ramen as it was intended.

I called Kama to discuss this issue and they said I should have a bowl at my office to combine my soup.

I guess the next time I want Ramen at work I'll just make it myself with Cup o Ramen and probably end up less hangry.
author: Perry V.

description: A solid choice for Japanese food in the city and particular bonus points for their large selection of vegetarian rolls/entrees/dishes (two from our party of five were vegetarian or vegan). They didn't have vegan ramen options however (no veggie broth option). Our table particularly liked the white out roll (four kinds of white fish, including hamachi), the fried octopus, and the vegetarian dragon roll (topped with seared eggplant). Chicken karaage was on the dry side. One free hot sake with a check-in on yelp (the large size, too!), so be sure to do that. Overall, a good dining experience.
author: Will H.

description: Found this restaurant looking for rice-less sushi near me. On their cold appetizers, they had the Mango Tango and Sunset Strip, which are without rice wrapped in cucumber. They both were really good. I'm not a fan of Spicy Tuna, but would definitely come back for the Sunset Strip again. So glad we tried this place for date night.
author: Nicole C.

description:
The consequences of being CHEAP:

*A botched boob job. Ok, not the best example...look at Tara Reid. Poor girl. 
*A ceiling that cries.  Courtesy of penny pinching mom who hires unlicensed contractor(s). 
*Receiving a Eucci purse in the mail thinking you got a hot deal on BuyGucciForCheap.com

Sushi is one of my loves; a love that doesn't come cheap.  However, in an effort to be more conscientious of my spending and to fulfill my sushi craving, I decided to go for Chinese sushi aka jive ass rolls (coined by Nobu K) last week.

Kama Sushi in SoMa was my choice since they seem to have very good reviews (second location is in Noe Valley).  I even bought a $25 restaurant.com gift certificate for $10.  Whoo Hooo, my mom would be proud of me!!! The problem is the reviews are a bit deceiving. If you take a closer look, you will find that most of the 5 star reviews are for their ramen only and not their sushi. As for those 5 star reviews claiming their sushi is authentic and legit; Kama Sushi is anything but authentic; not at this location at least. Sorry but Chinese sushi is NOT authentic  sushi (I'm not hating on my peoples either). Go to Ino, Koo, Okina,  Kazu  or Tekka for the real deal. 

Originally I was going to stick with jive ass rolls since they're good, cheap fillers but I couldn't resist their blackboard specials (a sushi restaurant's seasonal specials). So we did a combination of both along with some izakaya/appetizer/skewer items.

*Spicy Hamachi Toro Nigiri (Blackboard Special $6.95): http://bit.ly/12b8Njz
*Ankimo Nigiri (Blackboard Special $4.95): http://bit.ly/Z3hOwx
*Uni w/ Quail Egg Nigiri ($7.95): http://bit.ly/UnOVDB
*Sake Nigiri ($4.50): http://bit.ly/QX8DZT
*Hamachi Nigiri ($4.95): http://bit.ly/RrwvWY
*Shrimp Tempura ($7.95): http://bit.ly/Z3hGgw
*Pork Belly Skewers ($5.95): http://bit.ly/UcNWXm
*Foxy Roll: Unagi, Avocado, Mango Topped w/ Tuna, Avocado & Tobiko ($12.95): http://bit.ly/12b8VzA
*Crunchy Lobster Roll: Lobster Salad Topped w/ Salmon, Avocado & Crunchy Flakes ($14.95): http://bit.ly/RrwFOa

The best part of the meal was the Shrimp Tempura which was deliciously crunchy and not too greasy. This is something I rarely order at sushi restaurants but Mr. NSS just had to order this. I'm glad he did. The Pork Belly Skewers were a close second except it was lacquered with salt. Though all the Nigiri looked beautiful, they all tasted the same...STALE. No butteryness whatsoever so the fish was definitely not fresh. The Foxy Roll was atrocious (this was Mr. NSS' pick). The sweet mango along with the sweetness from the unagi sauce made it taste like a sushi dessert. GROSS. The Crunchy Lobster Roll as recommended by Yelpers tasted like eating stale tempura flakes with mayo. The tempura flakes were not crunchy and were probably fried early in the week and kept in a bag for later use. 

The food was a bust but the service wasn't. The staff was very friendly and attentive. A fly flew into our sushi (while sitting at the sushi bar) and the staff was very apologetic. They replaced the tainted nigiri and gave another piece on the house for the mishap. Even though the food was  2 stars, I was going to bump up my rating to 3 stars just because of the service. That's until I got home...

The consequences for eating cheap sushi? Pissing out of my (       I       ) ALL night.

P.S. - I contacted Emily C. about her food poisoning incident at Kama Sushi (http://www.yelp.com/biz/kama-sushi-san-francisco-5#hrid:7zXQOOT2uua2hCkjadKcEQ). She got delivery the same night I got the runs from dinner here. A coincidence? I think not.
author: Cherylynn N.

description:
This place imporved a lot.  Great service, good sushi.   Reasonably priced.  Yelp check-in always works for a free small sake.

Minus one star for a Poor Food Safety Score. Fish seems fresh.  But just being an extra caucious.  Thanks.
author: Alex R.

description:
I'm so sad to see the poor health score pop-up when I searched this place!!!!

This place was our go to Japanese Restaurant for a quick lunch. The food comes out quick and the people are friendly.
I'm not a huge fan of their sushi just because I am a huge sushi fan, so I've tasted the good stuff and I have high expectations, but their lunch menu is still good and very reasonable in price. I really wanted to try their ramen one of these days, but MAN! I probably won't because of that health score :( so sad.
author: Kristina S.

description: I came to this restaurant because of the Yelp reviews and really just thought it was OK.  I came on the weekend for lunch and had the lunch special.  My sushi really didn't look like the sushi in the pictures.  There was so much rice (and too little of anything else).  The portions are large and the prices cheap, but I'd rather pay more to go somewhere else.
author: Christine L.

description:
This place is great for groups! I called and made a reservation & they were super chill about it.

When I got there I was taken to my seat and my server handed me the menu saying "Happy hour is almost up, I'll be back so I can get your order!" Amazing! I ordered some appetizers to share with my group and a glass of wine for myself. 

Gyoza: Your typical gyoza. Good but nothing to write home about.

Vegie Gyoza: Loved it. There was edamame in the gyoza! Tasted delicious. It was also in a green wrap so it wouldn't get confused with the regular gyoza. Excellent!

Tempura Sweet Potato Roll: WHERE HAVE YOU BEEN ALL MY LIFE?! Don't order this, I'd like to make sure they have enough for ME!!!!

Katsu Don: It doesn't look that big but it is, and it taste sooo good. They don't skimp on the meat either.

The servers did not rush us to order or leave. Our main server was super nice. 

I would recommend NOT driving or parking down here. During dinner my car was broken into. If you can take uber or public transpiration do it.
author: Tam T.

description:
This place was okay. It wasn't my favorite of places nor did it blow me away, but it did have good service. I liked the feel of the restaurant and the place does have a unique touch to it (especially since it's pretty dark in there).

I ordered a 49er roll (GO SEAHAWKS!), salmon roll, and some negiri, while my roommated ordered a bunch of small plates. The rolls weren't bad and definitely on the better side. However the flavors just didn't wow me like I expected it to. My roommate also thought the scallop spoon appetizer was a little too much on the citrus side for her. But hey maybe that's personal preference.

If I were you I would definitely check it out if you want to hit all the sushi restaurants around. Just nothing too great to be excited over.
author: Nathan L.

description: Hands down one of my favorite sushi joints in the city. Fresh and always so yummy. It's always a must to order the firecracker balls!
author: Anna J.

description: Amazing sushi and such a clean atmosphere. The ambience was perfect. Great service! The fish was beyond fresh and everything was priced reasonably.
author: Melissa S.

description:
I ate here for lunch twice.  I got the bento box special with teriyaki chicken and udon.  Both were yummy.  The next day I got the chirashi don for lunch.  It was so great.  I got 4 or 5 very large slices of 4 types of fish...salmon, tuna, Hamachi, and some another white fish.  This is a great place in a block that's void of many other lunch and dinner spots.

Oh, and if you check in on Yelp, you get a free small hot sake!!
author: Michelle R.

description:
I've came here twice in a week because it's one block away from where I live and honestly, I'm quite satisfied both times.
First time I came here I got crunchy lobster roll. It is very delicious!! Yum yum :3 9/10! 
And chu toro nigiri. - 6/10 decent quality

This time I got grilled toro roll - 8/10. Very balanced texture and flavor. Tobiko on the inside and outside gave this roll an interesting texture. albacore is slightly torched and you can taste that fragrance in your mouth. 
As for hamachi toro, quality is mediocre. Meh I'd say 5.5/10-You can find better ones with the same price in the city. 

I love how they have hot barley tea :) 
AND!!! Their wasabi is very fresh! Not the pre-processed ones you get in  supermarkets. For this I give them an extra star! 

Overall dining experience is pleasant, friendly staff too :)
author: Clair C.

description:
I came here for happy hour, which is from 5-6:30, on a Monday but there were only a few other people there when I showed up so I got a nice seat at the bar. The wait staff were very attentive and the food was prepared quickly, that probably had to do also with the fact that it wasn't very busy at the time but I won't complain. 

I ordered the unagi avocado roll, the hamachi, toro, and saba nigiri, the butabara(pork belly) skewers, and also the salmon Kama. Everything I ordered was off the happy hour menu so it was $5 or less except for the salmon Kama.

The sushi was nice and fresh and they put nice big pieces of fish on their nigiri. The skewers came with this amazing sweet miso paste that I ended up putting on almost everything. Lastly the salmon Kama was excellent, the meat was juicy and tender and the skin was nice and crispy, very well done. 

Overall I spent $35 dollars on mostly happy hour items so the food can get expensive, then again I think I ordered a lot for one person as well so don't let that deter you. This place does sushi well.
author: Zach C.

description:
This is by far my fave ramen spot.  The sushi is so so but I'm obsessed with their ramen.  It's a far walk from my work, but when I'm craving ramen this is my go to.  I've been here at least 10 times now, and the reason for the poor rating is due to their service.

Usually we sit in the front entrance area where 2 people tables are located.  I ALWAYS feel rushed and cramped in there.  I get it, it's a small restaurant that gets busy... but it's small, so there's no reason customers should not be checked on. 

The most recent time I was there, I came with 3 coworkers and we were sitting in the back booth area.  I was excited thinking we have more "personal" space.   It was a nightmare... we sat for 15 minutes waiting to order... I had to get up and ask a waiter to take our order.  The man with the mullet hair said "one second ok we are busy".

NEVER TELL A CUSTOMER YOU ARE BUSY - It's just plain rude.  At least APOLOGIZE and be polite.  I felt like he was talking down to me.

After that... food came quickly but my ramen was cold?  Now getting the check.. that was an obstacle in it's own.  My group and the group in front of us were complaining that no one was coming to check on us... we needed to pay and leave!  We were the only 2 groups back there..  Every time we would waive someone down or say "excuse me" they would quickly scurry away.  My colleague this time got up to ask for our payment back..  it was just sitting there along with 5 other payments UN ATTENDED.   

As much as i love their ramen...  they're service needs vast improvement.  Too bad i'm now seeing how bad their health score is....I will look elsewhere for ramen options =[
author: Vanessa T.

description: Food poisoning. My partner and I came here last Friday night for dinner. We shared complementary edamame, the dragon roll, super spicy tuna roll, and hotate sashimi. Three hours later, I was puking on the side of the street in SOMA. Be warned, these folks must have some sanitation issues. My tummy is still recovering. I have never had an experience like this before in my life.
author: Kit S.

description:
Amazing food and super friendly...definitely will come back, when I'm in town

We had sashimi, sweet shrimps & presentation on a wood place. So cute! 

When you sit down, just ask for chef choice and they'll bring variety.
author: Pauline L.

description:
After a long day of furniture shopping, we drove by this place and thought, why not, turned back around, easy street parking.  Cute little place, I think there may be more back space we didn't see?  Cute decor.  Friendliest waitstaff, and very fast.

Free sake after we checked in.  Cheap stuff, but made us happy.  The rolls were excellent, not swimming in sauce.  Yes, I picked out pieces of the fish to check out freshness.  Verdict: Yum.  The uni was very good, tempura was lightly breaded and crisp.

Had a great time, very good food, great service, great dining experience.  Will definitely return.
author: Lola K P.

description:
After my friend got in late one night from the airport, we stopped here randomly to satisfy a sushi craving. We were certainly not disappointed! And especially since you get a free hot sake with a checkin! A steal. 

We had a great evening chatting in a casual atmosphere, had very friendly and fast service, and were not rushed out (even when we definitely stayed well past paying). The sushi matched the service, adding to the experience. 

I got the Tuna Poki salad (very good) and the rainbow roll, which was fresh and delicious. I especially enjoyed the baked special roll I ordered, the Hot Papa - spicy tuna with scallop and cream cheese sauce. It was fantastic, and I'm glad we happened to be driving by and stopped in!
author: Bradley T.

description: how could you put bad fish on a roll and serve it...it wasn't even fully red anymore. It was discolored, taste had turned and the texture was not normal. We also ordered the salmon Kama which is supposed to be cooked thoroughly but instead it was raw salmon Kama...... disappointing. A Japanese restaurant with many fish options is supposed to store raw fish and cook their fish dishes properly right?
author: Michelle W.

description:
We went there for happy hour, it's my second time going to Kama Sushi.  Great variety of HH menu drinks and food. Sushi is fresh and service is awesome.  Our waiter, Jason, rocks!

Will definitely go back!
author: Brenda W.

description: Just bad. Had the runs after. Unsanitary preparation and overpriced selection for what you get. Ordered 2 rolls one was hot papa. What the hell was that? Not worth it, barely had anything in it. Rice was so minimum as well as toppings. It was like a baby miniature roll! Red dragon was like eating or slurping on porridge. It was so soft where it became disgusting to taste. Never again.
author: H H.

description: What a great find!  Our family of 4 got a table held open for us on a Friday night so that we didn't have to make the kiddos wait when we got there.  The staff was so fantastic and attentive, and very kid friendly!!  They had plastic cups of the little one and was just on top of it.  The best part was their food!  Sushi was so fresh and the donburi delish.  We will be back for sure...and soon!
author: D. S.

description: Kama sushi is by far the best! Been numerous times and have never been disappointed! Great customer service and their food is always super fresh!
author: Breannah r.

description: Came back and tried completely different dishes. This time I had the house specialty Tonkatsu Ramen and my date had Unagi Donburi. I thought the Unagi-Don serving, though elegant in the lacquer-style box, was small, both in comparison to Unagi-Don I have had elsewhere and for the price. My date thoroughly enjoyed her dish despite my unspoken observations. My Tonkatsu Ramen, which I ordered at full hot spicy was delicious. My one negative observation specific to the ramen dish was the pork was thinly sliced, and it fell apart in the broth, unlike the thicker pork loin slices I have had elsewhere - not ideal presentation. Service was consistently rapid and generally outstanding, but I did move this down to 4 stars, in particular due to the two cited portioning matters.
author: Scott C.

description: I just tried this Yaki-Mentaiko!!! So delicious!! I want more!!! If you love grilled fish eggs... You must order this!
author: Em C.

description:
Few things make me happier than finding a good sushi place. One thing that does sweeten the deal is a Yelp deal! The $10 for $20 drew me in, and imagine my surprise when I found out that checking in gets us a free small hot sake, too! Jackpot!

My boyfriend and I had spent an evening braving the cold weather of SF, so we were feeling like a bowl of hot ramen to warm us up. We chanced upon Kama Sushi through Yelp, and my goodness. We were so pleased with what we found.

First off, the establishment is cozy yet gives you enough space to enjoy your meal. Everything is clean and fresh, and the wait staff is among some of the friendliest I've ever encountered. We walked in craving ramen, so ramen is what we ordered. I had the Chicken Karaage with soy broth -- for your spicy lovers, you can spice up your ramen for an extra $1! I wimped out this time and took my ramen sans spicy. We both gobbled up our ramen in no time at all, and everything was perfect. The noodles were chewy and plentiful, the extras were generously portioned, and the broth was flavorful. All for $8!

And just when we thought we were finished, our waiter took the time to chat with us a bit to ask how we liked everything. We quickly divulged to him how much we loved our ramen. Delighted at our positive responses, he asked the trigger question that sent me over the edge.

"Would you like to try some sushi while you're here?"

Oh man, WOULD I?! But of course, you can't make yourself seem too excited. That's too easy of a sell. I had to contain myself and calmly nod my head and say yes as my boyfriend looked at me and knew that even he couldn't fight my sushi weakness.

The waiter's recommendation? Sake narami. What is that, you ask? It's like toro but for salmon instead of tuna. What is toro, you ask? Only the most delicious part of the tuna fish -- the belly! So, in short, sake narami is the salmon belly, which is something that I've seen only in their restaurant. And it was DELICIOUS. It melted in my mouth just like toro would. The waiter came back with more recommendations (their specials are actually all listed on a blackboard above the sushi bar), but I just had to say no because I was stuffed.

So, in short?
-- Yelp deal = good deal and good excuse to try Kama Sushi out
-- Don't forget to check in for free hot sake!
-- Craving ramen? You'll find good stuff here!
-- Black board above the sushi bar is your treasure map of sushi

Ahhh, drooling just thinking about this place... time to wipe the drool off and head to the city for some sushi!
author: Yvonne K.

description: Awesome sushi place and great service!!! The hot sake is smooth and the size is good for 3~4 people. We ask for chef's choice sashimi. Very fresh!!!  Will come back again for sure!
author: Yi C.

description:
Highlights
- Presentation of the dishes were nice, but the food was A-Okay at most. 
- Crunchy lobster roll that everyone hypes about was alright, a bit too much wasabi for me. 
- Golden dragon roll: I liked this one better than the lobster roll. It was wrapped in soy paper, fried soft shell crab, avocado, tobiko, and house sauce. 
- Chicken and vegetable udon: served in a large spoon like bowl, which was really cute. Vegetables used were fresh and tasted pretty good as well as a hearty portion size. 
- Service was great. Waitresses were quick and attentive. 

Improvements
- Kama Spoons (2 qty/order): I don't remember what exactly was included, but it was a generous portion of uni, fish roe, and raw quail egg from what I recall. Nothing special or overly spectacular. 
- Tables are really close to each other, especially the tables for two. 

Tip
- Free sake when you check in on Yelp!
author: Tracy T.

description:
Went in with pretty low expectations but was pleasantly surprised!  Kama has really great large pieces of fish, extremely FRESH, and a good deal of variety.  Their house sake is pretty delicious as well (no headache post cheap sake....win).

The happy hour specials make it a pretty decent week night spot, which is very much appreciated in the neighborhood.
author: Nikki G.

description:
Good value for lunch, especially considering the area. Not a place to make a special trip out for, but if you're in the area for lunch and craving some Japanese food, this does the job. 

I got the bento with Saba shioyaki and the hamachi negi roll. The hamachi was surprisingly pretty fresh and although the roll construction wasn't the greatest, it tasted good. The Saba shioyaki was also very enjoyable, just the right flavor with the outside nice and crisp and the inside nice and juicy. All in all, pleased with my lunch here, especially since it was only $12 or something like that.
author: Jenny W.

description:
Check in on yelp for a FREE sake! Small sake for 1-2 people, and a large sake for 3+ people :D

I came here with a few friends before going to Rave of Thrones at 1015 Folsom down the street. It was a Thursday night so it was pretty empty with around three other tables of people there. Their extensive menu has so many options for everyone: ramen, sashimi, donburi, rolls, skewers, salads, and more!

I ordered the Jo Sushi Dinner since I wanted nigiri but didn't really know what kind I wanted. It came with five pieces of nigiri and a spicy tuna roll (or california roll if you want) The fish was pretty fresh! Not the best I've had but it was good. Everyone else ordered ramen and they all said it was really good! I tried some of the Tonkatsu Ramen and it was yummy, the chashu slices weren't too thin and not super thick either. The egg was cooked perfectly too :D We also split the Karaage appetizer and we all thought the chicken was very tasty and fried perfectly.

Our waiter was very friendly and attentive and I liked the atmosphere of the place. I would definitely come back again if I'm in the area and try more of their dishes!
author: Sandra N.

description: Ordered karaage ramen and tempura udon. I would come back for a craving of these soups again.. And would like to review their service again. Service was so-so... Sushi  looked good so looking forward to trying that.
author: Joy L.

description:
A solid sushi restaurant.  I went with a few friends early on a Saturday night.  We were seated immediately.  We checked in on Yelp and got a free large hot sake, which was a really nice extra.  I had the following dishes:

Salmon Tuna Tower (3.5/5): The tower comes with salmon, tuna, and avocado and is served with fried shrimp chips.  The quality of the salmon and tuna was fine, and the avocado was fresh.  The chips were my favorite part - they reminded me of the shrimp chips I used to eat as a child.

Red Dragon Roll (3/5): Good roll, but not much to say about it.  I'm not a huge fan of tuna, but I enjoyed it.

Spider Roll (4/5): Quite good.  The crab was well-battered, crispy, and spiced nicely.  There was a good proportion of crab to cucumber and avocado.  Definitely my favorite of the night.

Regarding the other aspects of the experience, the service was prompt, and all of the servers were very polite and attentive.  The restaurant had a nice front area and a more secluded back area with booths, which I liked.  The bathrooms were clean as well.  Overall, a good experience, but nothing particularly stand-out in terms of the food.
author: Christina M.

description: Darn good and super reasonable! Friendly staff and not pretentious which is hard to find in this city! Definitely and solid go to spot.
author: Melisa O.

description: Came here for dinner on a Saturday when I realized they offer a free sake bomb for checking in on Yelp :). We ordered the chirashi bowl, 49er roll, pyramid roll, a large beer, another large hot sake, and the total came out to ~$65 before tip. The sashimi was very fresh and they gave a good amount in the chirashi bowl. The service was great and everything came out relatively quickly.
author: Angela K.

description:
Awesome sauce. LITERALLY.

On a recent visit with local friends, I ordered the tonkotsu curry, which featured a really captivating sauce with a deep, rich flavor with hints of a rich spice palate centered around the pepper. The focus of the dish, the pork, tasted good as well, but it was really the sauce that shone.

Summary: Kama Sushi can sauce me any time it wants.
author: Rene P.

description:
Was excited to discover this sushi place not too far away from my place. I've been here twice and both times no wait! Unheard of for a decent sushi place in the city. 

I usually order nigiri at sushi restaurants, and everything here's pretty fresh, and they have uni! Saw a table next to us order cooked food (noodle soup, sukiyaki? not sure) that also looked delicious. Will have to try that next time. 

The decor is contemporary with a nice woody loft feel. Great little gem in an otherwise sketchy neighborhood that doesn't have much else around. Also plenty of street parking too.
author: Nattie X.

description: What can I say?  I am lucky to have this place in my neighborhood and I come here all the time. Consistently fresh and tasty sushi and everyone is pretty friendly and the service is good so what more can you  ask for in your neighborhood sushi place?!?!  I love the hand rolls. I usually order spicy tuna and spicy salmon bad rolls. Tonight I also ordered what they call a rock here, which is eel and avocado and all 3 rolls were delicious. I also had the miso soup and the salad.  The dressing is particularly tasty and unique. Worth trying. And they are very yelp friendly.
author: Debra R.

description:
I went there for the all you can eat sushi at lunch.  The staff was friendly and made dining with my 2 toddlers easy.
The food, service, and price was good.  I'll definitely go back there again. But then again, I always love all you can eat sushi.  =)
author: Phillip G.

description: We stopped by Kama Sushi on our way to SHNs Lion King and we are so glad we did. The main area was tiny but clean.  Every staff member we interacted with was knowledgeable and friendly.  They had a killer happy hour, and the food was great. We had various rolls and nigiri, as well as mixed tempura and chicken skewers. The fish tasted fresh with a great depth of flavor, and the portions were reasonable for the price. We'll definitely will be back!
author: Sean P.

description:
Came here with a homegirl on a Tuesday night (7pm) & got seated right away. 

First impression: ouuu I like the decor! :D

Secondly, the servers were very attentive. We did NOT have to hunt them down like some other restaurant.

We ordered maguro(tuna), tamago(egg omelette), sake(salmon), and unagi(eel) nigiri. Food came out pretty fast! The fish pieces were huge! Almost couldn't see the rice haha. Good! I like it :)

Also ordered a reversed sake bomb, yumm.

Unfortunately, we weren't too hungry so we didn't order much. But I togo a dragon roll for my bf & he loved it.

DEFINITELY coming back!! ^_^
author: Joann W.

description: My goto sushi spot only 3 blocks from home! Service is always fast, friendly, and professional. The sushi is always quality and consistent. Great hometown SOMA sushi spot.
author: Kyle M.

description: Ordered take out from here 4-5 times in the last few months and then decided to stop. Their chirashi deluxe don was good but a little pricey and they were outta uni when I had ordered so I asked for more shrimp but def. didn't hit the spot. Then I decided to venture and order a few of their rolls and that was super disappointing. Granted I got it to go and therefore it was in a to-go box for maybe 10-15 mins - the quality of the roll was just not good. I also had a few pieces of salmon sashimi and that was no bueno as well. Granted it was slightly expensive for take out sushi, I decided I'd just stick with The Market which is only half a block over for some quality omakase sushi for cheap.
author: Vanessa K.

description:
Feeling that we wanted to eat something light and not heavy, my bestie and I meet for dinner here. We ordered the hamachi kama, snapper sashimi special, ika sukatayaki, beef skewer, and several nigiri: uni, hamachi, and ikura. For the snapper sashimi special, you get the whole fish, as after you finish the sashimi pieces, they deep fry the remaining body, head and all. 

The hamachi and the ikura nigiri pieces were ok.  The uni unfortunately was not fresh or top quality. After I started to eat it, I was overcome by an unpleasant taste in my mouth.  The taste reminded me of the uni that is sold in the local Korean market in Oakland rather than to Tokyo Fish Market. 

We both found the ika sukatayaki sauce too sweet. The ika meat texture was cooked properly and tender.  The snapper sashimi was fresh but small.   They served it with its own sauce, which I believe was a ponzu mixture.   The deep fried snapper body was good.   

I probably need another visit to re-asses my experience here. If I am nearby wanting sashimi and uni, I may stop in. I want to see what the uni will taste like this time.
author: Marck N.

description:
Good lunch specials. They always seem understaffed, though.

Their chicken katsu curry rice is really excellent.
author: William L.

description: Fast and efficient. Sushi rolls that I got was really good just melted in my mouth. Service good. Will come back.
author: Arlene F.

description: I haven't been here but I ordered it online for delivery, it was unexpectedly quick! Our food were delivered within 15mins! Bravo!  The rolls we've ordered were good and delicious. I recommend their super dynamite roll- not too spicy!
author: Des L.

description:
Great prices, decent sushi! Don't expect anything amazing though. It's good for what you are paying for it. Blown away with their free sake for everyone in the group with a check in. 
The deluxe sushi set was decent. Very filling and worth the money. 
If you are a sushi enthusiast, or just craving some decent, but not overly sophisticated sushi experience, Kama is worth checking out.
author: Luba Y.

description: Sushi was decent and the service was friendly, so I would've considered returning... But then my friend got food poisoning.
author: Allie K.

description: Really good service and variety of food specially when in big groups. They have a separate section for groups where you take your shoes off and get an awesome meal.
author: Blady M.

description:
I was surprised the restaurant was empty on a Saturday night at 8:30PM, but we were promptly seated. The last alcohol call is at 9:00PM @.@ I know ... Why would they do that right ? Haha but anyways we ordered:

1. Salmon(sake) sashimi (5pcs)  $9.95: Fresh and yummy
2. Salmon belly sashimi (5pcs) $14.95: came in with a topping of smoked skin. It was good and different but I liked the salmon sashimi better. 
3. Hot mama roll ~$10: baked salmon roll. This was DELISH!! Took a while to come but it was worth it.
4. Monkfish liver (ankimo) nigiri ~$4: not good ... 
5. Rainbow roll ~$14: Cali roll topped with different kind of fish.  The fish wasn't that fresh but not too fishy either. 

Overall 3 starts for food, but I added and extra star for their prompt service and ambiance.  

Recommended for a quiet comfy meal with your better half or your bestie :)  not a really a place you go have fun with friends, but Hey! The Asia club is like a block away *wink
author: Mily W.

description: I love going to Kama sushi! Very good food and great service.
author: Fanny M.

description: Incredible happy hour menu and drinks. Even better sushi. One of the better sushi places in town. Excellent customer service. Food came out quick! There was nothing we did not like.
author: Ray W.

description:
For non-sushi dishes, the food was average and place was fairly loud on a busy Friday night. If you went for a few sake drinks with some skewers, this may do it. It is not the place if you want an authentic izakaya experience.

One recommendation is the Mochi wrapped in bacon -- well done and highlight of our orders! The mochi was softened and almost melty like cheese inside the crispy bacon wrap, which makes this dish very fun.


We also ordered shishito peppers, wagyu beef skewer, and grilled yellowtail. They were all average but I wouldn't call it amazing. Yellowtail was grilled a bit dry.

Lastly, deep-fried green tea ice cream -- it wasn't the best green tea ice cream inside, although the warm, crunchy deep-fried crust will destract you anyways~
author: Ida L.

description:
Wow.  Well done.  Really fresh.  Make sure to order something off the daily special board for something interesting you may not have heard of yet.

It was crowded during my weekday lunchtime visit, but the service was friendly and fast
author: Ken B.

description:
The place is a pretty good Japanese restaurant overall for your go-to bento boxes, noodles, and sushi, but nothing super amazing about it stands out. Lunch specials are always good deals, but it's not like the restaurants in Japantown that give California rolls with the specials - only avocado and cucumber rolls (which are sort of bland). The katsu curry rice is good. 

I tried the crunch lobster that everyone raves about - the crunchy stuff was really good, but you could only rave about it so much. The sushi itself was alright. The grilled squid was also alright - wasn't really tasty or flavoring. I might have just had a bad experience that day. 

They also give free edamame (not salted or anything) to anyone who sits down. Presentation of the food is on point though. I love their unique plates and bowls.
author: Annie D.

description: Check in for free sake! Lol their food was great, average Americanized Japanese restaurant,  I like their interior design. Ohya,  1 point that I'm really disappointed about was, Why the uni ikura Don only for lunch!!!!!! Lol
author: Yuna Y.

description:
I've been to Kama a few times now and we always enjoy our meal.  Happy Hour was especially interesting this last time.

The 49er role is one my favorite rolls in the city.  The sashimi and nigiri is always fresh. Recently we enjoyed the Tofu Salad which is very large and tasty.

Kama is a fantastic value for pretty high grade sushi.  You can pay more elsewhere but the extra cost is not linear to the extra quality.  Unless you are really trying to impress someone, this is as good of a place as any in SF.

PS - I would stay away from the Hot Mama and Hot Papa rolls.  I'm note sure they are there for sushi lovers, but are probably good to have for those that don't care for raw fish.
author: Anand A.

description:
Not great.  Fish was sub-par and ramen tasted like chicken noodle soup (with some seaweed, ginger, pork and a weird looking egg thrown in).

I'll go for their sake specials though.  Free large one for checking in to Yelp and a June promotion gives you one small sake or beer for $1 (limit one per person).
author: Jane N.

description: Bastardized sushi done right!   No it's not your fancy traditional place by far.   But it makes big rolls that taste great....the sashimi slabs were great,  the rolls packed with flavor and they (unlike so many in this town) aren't afraid of quantity with quality.   My fave in this vein of sushi is still Sushi Bistro,  but this is closer for me.
author: A A.

description:
Sushi salmon is very delicious
Beef is so terrific. Hot sake is woeful so that we two drink four bottles and we can't help drinking one more
author: Xin C.

description: My favorite sushi in the neighborhood! They have a wide selection of sushi rolls, and the quality has always been good in my experience. Prices are average and I'd expect to pay ~$20 for a full dinner. The ambiance is nice and comfortable too, not a hole in the wall like a lot of sushi places. If you have enough orders, you can also get delivery which is a really convenient option.
author: Connie Q.

description:
Ordered: Yellow Tail & Yellow Tail Toro.

If it were just a food review this would be four star. Both were quite good.  The edamame was dry and inedible.

Service:
Where to begin...The ventilation in this place is nonexistent. Our party sat in the back corner of the restaurant so that may have contributed. Do not sit here unless in a bathing suit or naked. The service was also horrid. The waiter did not seem interested in returning to our table after the initial sit down.
author: Cam M.

description:
Good for Happy Hour. They have a good selection of standard maki, nigiri and sashimi. Atmosphere is quite for lunch. Nice place to stop for a quick, cheap bite, but don't expect to have your socks blown off. For example, I asked for them to just pick a fun role and send it over.... I got a salmon avocado roll...
Also, they are kind of slow so don't come here of you have somewhere to be.
author: Mallory D.

description:
This place is pretty good! In all honesty, I came here before going out to party (LOL) because it is located in SOMA, close to all those places like Raven, 1015 Folsom, etc... But dang, I am impressed!!!! 

My friend and I took a leap of faith when we came here. On Yelp, it said FOOD WARNING BLAHLBLAHBLAH. Basically, it means this place is dirty or whatever. But let's be real, most restaurants are all dirty. I think I will be ok. And after eating here, boy, was I ok!

My friend for the tuna roll and I got the ramen ( the one that began with the T). The ramen was chewy, flavorful and came with a lot of garnishes. If you check in, you get sake too ( great for a pre game). I think I like this place! I will definitely come back again. :) Thanks Kama Sushi!
author: Eileen W.

description:
This place is amazing!! Literally my favorite sushi place in SF and that's saying something!! I've always gotten amazing service from there wonderful staff as well as always had just divine sushi. The Crunchy Lobster, Fire Cracker Balls and California Roll are my go to every time. 
Also I feel like everything here is appropriately priced for the great quality you're getting. Always surprised when sushi places overcharge for mediocre quality. 

Appropriate for both casual or dressy attire. 

Also feel this is a great date spot. Good mood lighting, smaller intimate atmosphere, attentive customer service and great sushi always lends itself to a good experience. ;)

Also rented one of there 2 traditional Japanese party rooms in the other room for my birthday this year and had an absolute blast!!
author: Goth Kitty Jen J.

description: Insanely delicious sushi, friendly and helpful staff, received my food quickly and at a good price. Thank you so much!
author: Avia M.

description:
Salmon Kama
--This grilled appetizer was quite yummy. I've never liked salmon to a crazy extent but this dish was made really well. The skin was deliciously fishy and slimy. The salmon was really soft and melted right in your mouth! 

Foxy Roll
--My friend ordered this and I surprisingly enjoyed the mango! The fish was fresh and the avocado made the roll even better! I would eat this roll again if I returned. 

Super Spicy Tuna Roll
--This was a bit too spicy for me on such a hot day, but it was a nice small well made roll. The spicy tuna was yummy! Note: there is not only jalapeño peppers in the roll but also Sriracha sauce on top!

Katsu Don
--I thought the Katsu pork was damp from the heat of the egg and rice that it tasted like cold leftover food. If the Katsu had been nice and crispy, this dish would have been more appetizing! 

My friend and I had a pleasant experience here, so I rate this place a 4 from 3.5 from the food and 4 from the service!
author: Katelyn P.

description: We are regulars at Kama. We eat here at least once a week. I highly recommend the spicy veggie ramen. It is hands down the best ramen I have had in my life! I also highly recommend the four leaf clover roll it has become a favorite of my meat eating husband. This place has so many vegetarian options. My husbands favorite is the tetaki. My 4 year old requests that we eat here multiple times a week. She had a full on melt down the other day because we ate somewhere else. She loves the unagi roll. Seriously though get the spicy veggie ramen!!!
author: Melissa J.

description: Very nice place. Friendly staff. The ramen is great and I love the fried oysters. I hear the sushi is great too!
author: Ryan M.

description:
Happy Hour specials daily from 5-6:30pm! We got there at 6pm on a Thursday and there wasn't a wait at all. They also take reservations :)

Great food and sake selection. Check-in on Yelp and get a free sake for your table. HOLLA.
author: Mindy D.

description: Fantastic lunch spot, especially for the price. You can get a bento with lots of choices for ~$12. I got the chicken teriyaki and spicy tuna roll. All bentos come with rice, miso soup, daikon pickled veggies, and a little salad. Usually has people but usually still easy to get a spot.
author: Glenn J.

description:
Kama Sushi was amazing - delivered 6 party platters of sushi within 2 hours of my order!
Thank you so much for helping me in a crunch! Sushi tastes great :)
author: Lena D.

description:
Background: Upon first look, you would think, wow great CHEAP happy hour ($2.95 nigri, $4.50 maki rolls, and $5 hot dishes) and with a yelp check in you would get a free sake. 

The details: 

Ordered Yaki Tori - 2 chicken skewers for $5, I thought it was an ok deal, until I started eating my chicken and then realized it was RAW and BRIGHT pink on the inside. When I brought it to the attention of the server, he was hesitant to acknowledge that my chicken was raw, didn't even apologize and just asked me if I wanted more chicken?!

I got some hand rolls and and special rolls (non happy hour), simply put, they skimp on ingredients like no other. I ordered a mango roll with unagi and there was mostly well, nothing. A sliver of avocado, some slivers of unagi and bam mango filler in the middle... Quite disappointing. 

Finally, the restaurant tried to pull a fast one on us. My group was at least 8 of us who ordered tons of nigri, rolls etc, so what happened was that they ended up charging us for sushi we didn't have... we had to bring it up to their attention and they questioned our honesty.  Then they accused us for receiving food already when we asked where our missing food was. I was really disappointed by the unprofessional and borderline rudeness of the staff. (Maybe our server wasn't the greatest communicator, but if so, why not bring your manager out?) 

The Verdict: I definitely won't be coming back because of the quality and value of the food and especially the way the staff handled our service. I really can't stand a dishonest restaurant that treats their guests poorly.
author: Christine B.

description: First time here and I was really glad I stopped by, not to mention great lunch time special pricing. I ordered the Don Chirashi bowl, which had a delicious assortment of really fresh tasting fish, pretty much fell apart in your mouth. It was super good! I also order Amaebi, it's one of my favorite things to get and theirs was not a let down. Sooo gooood! Lastly, they serve complimentary miso soup and edamame. I'll definitely be back with friends! :)
author: Taz N.

description:
I came here before a show at the orpheum
And it was very good.  Service was prompt and people were friendly.  Sushi was very good, with a lot of options.  I could tell it was very fresh.
author: Kevina G.

description: Great happy hour specials. Enjoyed the complimentary edamame and all our appetizers and rolls were very good.
author: Steven T.

description:
Three stars for the food and service and four stars for value. So... Three and a half stars. 

I really wanted a sushi roll over lunch and wandered a half a mile from work to come here... $10.95 for a Bento Box...? SWEET!!!

I got Edamame for free as I sat (score!) but it was not hot nor salty. But free, so I shouldn't complain. 

Bento Box came with rice, soup, salad. Salad was overdressed so I skipped it. Miso soup very good. Bento Box included salmon/avocado roll & veggie tempura. Salmon wasn't cold, it was actually warm. Smelled/tasted fine so I proceeded. 

So much food I asked for a to go box. The staff took my box and provided me a bag with my leftovers. 

She placed the rolls on top of my hot food. Ended up ruining the rolls... Avocado and salmon discolored and yucky looking. I tossed them. 

Overall, pretty good for the price and if I go back I'll try something else and new ask for it 'to go'.
author: Courtney C.

description: Great sushi at an affordable price! We had the miso soup, Philly roll and Hama roll. The happy hour prices were very reasonable.
author: Damian B.

description:
When Kama Sushi popped up right by my office a few months ago, I was a very happy girl. I'm usually at Kama about once a week. The prices are very reasonable so I don't feel guilty having weekly dinners here.

For lunch, I highly recommend the bento boxes. They have great, yummy options (including rolls, potstickers, teriyaki, etc) for less than $12. It's a big lunch and delicious!

For dinner, the boy and I usually share a ramen and some rolls. The specialty rolls are creative and great. We've tried a lot of them and the rolls with spice are especially yummy. 

If you bring a group, they have two tables where you sit on the "floor" and your lags dangle down. It's not quite the same as sitting all the way on the floor but your feet are less likely to fall asleep and it still feels more authentic than sitting at a normal table.

Note that you can usually get a free hot sake if you check in on Yelp and that they do last call for alcohol at 9 PM. Apparently they are trying to extend this but, for now, it's 9. If you need a delicious beverage after 9 pm, head to Azucar across the street. 

Yay for sushi in deep SOMA!
author: Meghan P.

description:
Checked out Kama sushi as a recommendation for a vegan friendly spot in the neighborhood. The lunch deals were great, they were crazy fast about refilling water (if a little slow to take the order).

I got the veggie ramen ($10 special), which was vegan (so they said! I know vegan ramen is a rarity). I was told by my companions that it did not look like "normal" ramen, because it had lots of toppings. Personally, I liked the toppings (more veggies!), and the special ALSO came with friend gyoza and a lil order of sushi. It was an absurd amount of food, but definitely good.
author: Pam S.

description:
Fresh fish. Love the food here! Def recommend it!
Love how you get a free sake when you check in.
author: Raymond W.

description: I love love love this place. I'm there very regularly and it's always amazing. I've taken multiple friends and all have fallen in love. Veggie dragon roll! Spinach roll! So much amazing here. I've never had better vegan sushi in my life.(yes there's none veggie things too) If you're near soma, go here now!
author: A'Lizzabeth B.

description:
- decent sushi
- lots of rolls (large portion is has fried stuff)
- chirashi is on the puny side
- rolls are overpriced for what you get
author: Sherry L.

description:
Kama Sushi is meh. It's not gross, but it certainly isn't anything special. I've had sushi and ramen there and both have been rather bland. But I will say that it is pretty inexpensive. If you go for lunch, you can get plenty of grub for a little over $10 per person. Not too shabby. 

The restaurant itself, however, is very cute. It's clean and the servers are friendly. It has a nice bustling vibe at night, so it's a good spot to eat and have some sake bombs if you want to head to bars in SOMA afterward.

Again, not my favorite sushi spot in the city, but it's not sushi I'd kick out of bed, if ya know what I mean *creepy lechery wink wink*
author: Stephenie S.

description:
We were in the area so we decided to try this place. The portions were small and it was over priced.
 Services ok, not that many options on sushi rolls and it wasn't that good, sometimes we go places because people give them more stars than they deserve
author: Martha C.

description: Sushi is mediocre at best. Service is blah. I felt rushed and they weren't really that busy. Probably wouldn't go again.
author: Ana-Marie U.

description: Pretty legit grub.  Great lunch specials.  Be prepared to wait during lunch hour for a seat.  Smaller portions but it's quality over quantity.
author: Alice E.

description: This is another 'tweener sushi joint, somewhere between 3 and 4 stars.  Service was good, super-attentive but the sushi itself was not something that made you want to return right away.  I tried their most popular dish, the crunchy lobster roll and it was just so-so, even though the presentation was beautiful.  The albacore sashimi was just OK too.  Worth checking out again though, to see if some of the other offerings are a little better.
author: Saminda W.

description: The place overall was decent. No real complaints at all, but not a 5 star. I do have to give it to the waiter though; he was very helpful and ensured we got our free large sake with the checkin on Yelp as well as making sure we ordered enough for the Happy Hour. The place like I said was decent, with some good rolls especially the Spider Roll.
author: Nina L.

description: If you don't like this place... YOUR CRAZY AF!!!  Sushi is good, Sashimi is fresh, Rice plates are good, The Ramen is good, There appetizers are good.  You can't go wrong with this place....... So good here!
author: Jeff D.

description: Walked in here by random and I'm definitely coming back. We ordered the Whiteout Roll, recommended by our server (who was super sweet and helpful ), Fresh Oysters and Kumomoto Oysters. The escolar topping on the Whiteout Roll was delicious and lightly smoked. Oysters were amazing. And of course, FREE SAKE with a yelp check-in?! Heck yes!
author: Kim L.

description:
I've eaten here twice and ordered take·a·way once, each time I really enjoyed the taste of the protein, the quantity served and artistic layout.  The restaurant's interior is covered in warm wood boards, comfy dark booths on the front and side walls and the sushi bar in the back accompanied by the host(less) podium; the space is functional, quite and calming.  The staff were friendly and pleasant while answering questions about the menu, even silly ones.

I look forward to visiting again, trying there uni and quail egg nigiri and continue to grow my sushi palate.  Don't let the neighbor hood scare you, this place is worth the every tobiko egg.
author: Brett D.

description: Just awesome. Food is fresh and very tasty and affordable. We went several times. Boston and Phil rolls were really good and Hot Mama was amazing
author: Rachid R.

description:
I'm thankful for this neighborhood sushi spot. 

- Quality: Consistently good
- Prices: Stan
author: J L.

description:
Yum,

Edamame served upon ordering. My table had eel nigiri, California roll, pork belly skewer, and a Dragon roll. I do love fried shrimp. And the eel was great. Good service. Decent prices. Left full.
author: Kristin M.

description:
A friend and I came in here and had a lunchtime feast.  The place is pretty small, but it's nicely decorated with warm wood tones, and darker colors.  The lunch specials are also very reasonable.

We ordered a sashimi sunomono salad which was okay.  The sashimi was soft and fresh, but the thin slices of cucumber underneath were drowning in a the vinegar dressing.  I tasted more vinegar than cucumber.  

The curry chicken donburi had a decent taste to it, but nothing all that special about it.- typical yellow curry sauce with chicken.

The best thing was the sashimi special.  The quality of fish here is fresh, decent sized slices with an attractive presentation.  The service is also good.  You won't be forgotten, and the place is small enough to get someone's attention right away.

Next time I'm craving some Japanese food after class, I'll have to swing by here again and try other menu items.
author: Elizabeth S.

description:
The location of this restaurant is so perfectly placed for me because it is so close to my apartment and is a perfect go-to spot whenever I don't want to travel far. What's even better about this place is that they have an extensive vegetarian menu, especially for a Japanese restaurant and the food is pretty good! 

I've ordered the veggie ramen, the veggie dragon roll, and the veggie gyoza. My favorite is the veggie ramen - it comes in a huge ramen bowl and has a delicious assortment of veggies. Definitely recommend this. If you want it to be spicy, pay the extra $1 for spicy paste, otherwise the soup is plain miso broth which is pretty bland. The ramen also comes with 2 pieces of veggie gyoza, but I really enjoyed the gyoza so the next time I came, I decided to get a whole order. This gyoza was less gingery than others that I've tried and I really liked that about them. It's a good appetizer to share! The veggie dragon roll is just alright - it has eggplant on top which I did not like at all. The vegetable tempura inside the roll is pretty good, but I just didn't like the eggplant topping.

Overall, a great place for a quick lunch or dinner in SOMA, the service is pretty fast and all the waiter are really friendly. This is a place you have to check out.

Tip #1: Check into yelp! You'll get a free order of hot sake :)
author: Malika R.

description: Came here on a Saturday night after hearing recommendations from my friend. Service is great, the staff were super friendly and nice. We had ramen and chirashi, both of which were good. Would come back again for sure.
author: Kiki Y.

description: My fried tried to order some food for us today at 2pm via Internet.  We got a call back saying they closed 15min ago when the website says they're open till 2:30pm.  Hungry and frustrated.
author: Lillian P.

description: Very delicious and the food is amazing. Salmon Tataki  and fried green tea ice cream are must have!
author: Vivi S.

description:
Just meh. We were headed to a bar in SOMA on Saturday when I realized I was damn hungry, and needed some sustenance before embarking on a night of drinking! We walked right by this place, quickly yelped it, saw the 4-star rating, and decided why not (hard to pass up sushi). However, the experience was overall a bit disappointing.

If you check-in on Yelp you get a free small hot sake. So great, I love free stuff. Even when it's not good stuff in and of itself, you can't really complain, because hell, it was FREE. Still, the sake was pretty bad. Now I will completely admit I'm not a huge fan of sake to begin with, and even less of a fan of hot sake, because I feel like the hot temperature is just disguising the fact that it's really poor quality alcohol. Well yep, this sake pretty much fit the bill. They also give every table edamame, which is a nice touch. But unlike the sake, the edamame were stone cold, and I personally prefer them a bit warm! Picky, picky, I know.

We ordered 4 sushi rolls and I also got a miso soup. The miso tasted the same as every other miso soup I've ever had, which is to say great - assuming you like miso. The roles were...meh. We got the Foxy roll which was unagi (my fav) and mango inside, avocado and tuna on top. I didn't taste a speck of mango, and I was sort of excited about that part. The tuna on top tasted a bit like refrigerator. We also got a California roll with real crab (standard and decently good) and the shrimp tempura roll, which was also okay. The worst was the spicy tuna. I only had one piece - it was bad enough I didn't want to come back for a second. The tuna was the kind where they  mash it up rather than put a whole piece of tuna in there, so that's not my preference to begin with. The quality/taste of the fish was also not up to par.

The other downside is that the tables for 2 are so closely squished together it's impossible not to overhear the entire conversation of the tables on either side. It's also very difficult to get in and out of your seat if you're on the booth side.

I was debating between a 2 and 3 star rating, but the service was very good in the end, so went for a 3. Let's just say, there are many other better sushi spots in the city that I would highly recommend over this one!
author: Lindsey B.

description: My favorite sushi spot.. Very fresh fish, great prices, amazing staff! Must try: salmon tataki, hamachi carpaccio, shishito peppers, and rainbow roll.
author: Courtney A.

description: Sushi is fresh, service is quick and the price is reasonable.  I came her is lunch with a couple of friend.  You might want to get there as it opens at 11:30am.  It get crowded really fast but then if you won't mind coming for the 2nd seating, you could avoid the crowd around 1:15pm.
author: Wasiliza L.

description:
Amazing food, excellent environment and service. Great location too. Restrooms are clean, which is always a good sign.

The crunchy lobster roll (maki) is unbelievable. The dish was well served, it is easily a full dinner for someone hungry. It was the best roll I've ever had in my life and I consider myself a sushi lover.

They also gave my wife a complementary miso soup at the end. So it was a great night!
author: Felipe T.

description:
Nice little sushi spot in the SOMA. Been to here a couple of times now, and wasn't disappointed either of the times. First time I went with a large group (~10 people), and we were able to reserve a table to fit all of us. We got a variety of rolls and a couple of the teriyaki entrees. I thoroughly enjoyed all of the rolls that they served as well as their teriyaki meats. 

They also have a pretty neat check-in offer going on right now, whereby you get either a small or large serving of hot sake if you have party of 2 or greater than 3 for the latter.

The second time I visited Kama we were able to reserve a table for 3 for 7PM at ~5:30PM on a Friday night, and they were definitely busy by 7, nice of them to allow reservations despite a full house.
author: David C.

description:
To be completely honest, I go here only because it's a block away. This place is passable only for cooked sushi and other cooked dishes but for sashimi and other raw fishes, I would avoid it. 

The dinner combo is pretty good. No complaints about the  teriyaki chicken at all. All of the cooked rolls are still very tasty but going to a sushi restaurant means eating raw fish, at least for me. When it comes to raw fish, this place should be avoided. None of the sashimi or nigiri tasted/looked fresh at all. Personally it's very difficult to tell the difference between amazing sashimi and great sashimi, but it's very easy to tell if sashimi is fresh or not. I'd give this place a try if you live nearby, but I wouldn't put the effort out to go here.

MUST HAVES:
Free sake (if you check in)
author: William L.

description: This is my favorite neighborhood sushi spot. Always friendly service and the food is always excellent. Smaller seating area but not uncomfortable. Happy hour is a good deal and fun for a small crowd. I would recommend to try just about anything, you won't be disappointed.
author: Annette S.

description: This place is as good as it gets! The lunch special is only $11 and you get a choice of 2 entrees, soup, salad, steamed rice, and pickled vegetables. As well as all the edamame you can eat. The food is very filling and I especially enjoy their Chicken Katsu. I will definitely recomment this place to all my friends and all who work nearby. It is cheap, affordable, and has a high class feel to it. Very clean and friendly staff and good ventilation.
author: Michael P.

description: Very disappointed!  I'm pretty sure there is better sushi & miso soup from grocery stores.
author: Michael W.

description:
We meant to try the Noe Valley location but never made it. I am glad they now have a location in my neighborhood.

We came by around 7:30 and they were still honoring the Happy Hour prices which usually ends at 6:30. Great, but we already knew we were gonna go for the ramen since it was really cold and blustery out. We snacked on our bowl of complimentary edamame while we watched the place fill up completely. It was a busy night for our server yet our water glass was kept filled and our food arrived on time (as well as our check later on in the evening). 

I had the veggie ramen and opted for the spicy version. It was a heaping bowl and I couldn't finish it all. As far as taste I will have to admit I wasnt expecting too much but it was surprisingly delicious. Chewy, fresh noodles with a good mix of veggies and the soy broth was flavorful. 

Yay to no longer needing to schlep across town toward Japantown or the TL to grab a decent bowl of ramen.
author: Esther A.

description:
Came here for Father's Day dinner! We got there sort of late-9pm, but they were able to accomodate us!

We ordered a 3 rolls, a 5 piece sashimi, and a katsu donburi and it came out to be around $65. So worth it. The rolls were very good and the donburi was super tasty. I would love coming back here again!

The only reason why I put 4 stars is when I asked the waiter about something on the menu he had no idea and had to ask another server for help. Also I asked the same waiter what one of the fishes were in the chefs choice sashimi, he just told me he didn't know and stood there in silence.
