I had to ASK that he go ask the chef to find out for me. I would expect that he would be quick on his feet and tell me he didnt know but would ask.
author: Annie K.

description:
You want the local experience. This is the place!  The servers are real people and make you feel at home. Just don't be an asshole. 

I have enjoyed their service on top of the exceptional sushi. I am very picky on where to eat but this is definitely one of the best Sushi restaurants in SOMA. 

Also if you are friendly with the staff and take the time to know their names and respect their hard work they go above and beyond in service. Their regular service is pretty stellar though. 

This is a the local experience, which means treat the staff nice and share a story and they will be happy to share one back.

Best bang for your buck with SF prices. Ask for Edmund or Em they are great!
author: Joseph L.

description: Really good food!!! I had the hot mama, miso, and kama shrimp. My only regret is opting for a miso soup instead of getting ramen. I am here on business for two weeks, and will be back for another hot mama roll and to try their ramen and shrimp tempura!
author: TheResults O.

description:
My mom and I loved the ramen at Kama Sushi. I had the veggie ramen and my mom had the tonkotsu ramen. 

The veggie ramen had corn, cabbage, carrot, bean sprouts, scallions, tree fungus and seaweed with soy flavored ramen, $9.95. I loved it. The soup was really flavorful and the vegetables were bright and the textures were so great together. 

The tonkotsu ramen had cha-su, egg, bamboo shoots, bean sprouts, red ginger, scallions, tree fungus and seaweed with pork flavored ramen, $10.95. My mom said it was really flavorful and the egg was a special treat. The egg was soft boiled so the yolk was slightly runny. 

My mom and I also shared the Age Dashi Tofu, $5.95 and two Inari Nigiri, $3.50. Both items were great. The tofu was crispy on the outside and warm and soft on the inside. I loved that it wasn't soggy.  The Inari was a sweet treat. Loved it's shape and how easy it was to handle. It didn't fell apart in my chopsticks. 

The restaurant is nice and has nice tables as well as a sushi bar. 

The staff was extremely nice and polite. I love anyone who is extra nice to my mom. I really appreciate when people are respectful of their elders. 

Overall I would recommend this place to anyone who loves a good bowl of ramen. I'd love to come back and try a few of their other noodle dishes.
author: Joyce H.

description:
Kama kama kama kama kama chameleon....You come and go, you come and go-o-oooo!

(I've decided to begin my review with a theme song, like they do for TV shows. Wouldn't the world be a better place if more Yelp reviews began with a theme song?)

Aaaaaanyway, Kama surprised both me and my boyfriend. I'd just received some bad news and my boyfriend wanted to take me out to dinner to cheer me up. Since I believe all of the world's problems can be solved by ramen (and Popeyes), I decided a nice, hot bowl of noodles in soup was exactly what I needed. We were too tired and hungry to make a long trip out to a ramen-only joint, Kama happened to be conveniently located, so that's where we wound up.

My ramen (tonkotsu pork broth with bamboo shoots, mushrooms, corn, pork and spicy chili pepper flakes (add $1 for that)) came out no more than 5 minutes after we'd placed our orders. We were assured my boyfriend's would be out soon. He encouraged me to start eating first, so I did. The broth was nothing too spectacular, but the noodles were perfectly-cooked: chewy and al dente, just the way I like it. The pork was tender and delicious. 

However, 15 minutes went by and they still hadn't brought anything else out, while people who had arrived much later than us had already received all their orders. Eventually, I flagged down another guy and asked what was going on, and he promised he'd look into it. He never got back to us. I know because I could see him standing by the host's podium avoiding us.

Finally, our server came back to reassure us the ramen would be out soon. We reminded him about the hamachi carpaccio appetizer we'd also ordered and never received. He said he'd talk to the sushi chefs, who I could plainly see were standing around doing nothing. The ramen and carpaccio eventually arrived, but by then, it had been about 20 minutes after we'd placed our orders.

The carpaccio was just okay, mostly because the hamachi was very obviously not fresh. My boyfriend had also gotten the tonkotsu ramen but without spicy chili flakes. It was piping hot and delicious, definitely just made. Despite that satisfaction, he asked our waiter what the hold-up had been. The waiter stammered some kind of gibberish response, which confirmed my suspicion that the kitchen had forgotten our orders (I know it wasn't the waiter's fault because I saw him record our order and give it to the kitchen). Without this incident, Kama would have merited 4 stars for the food, but I'm docking a star for the mix-up and the staff's inability to be honest with us about it. 

With so many other ramen options in the city, I'm afraid that where Kama is concerned, it's just going to be a one-time "come and goooo, I come and go-o-oooooo" (too cheesy?).
author: Josephine L.

description:
Wow, I can't believe the karaage ramen. It is not even comparable to real ramen. 

1. Noodles were of the instant variety, and not even the fresh good tasting ones you can get at a Japanese supermarket.
2. Lettuce in my ramen. Need I say more?
3. Shoyu broth was bland and had no flavor
4. Overall, it was not hot when I had it.

The food was edible however I will search elsewhere for better eats in SOMA. If you are expecting authentic Japanese cuisine, please search elsewhere.

The staff was attentive and friendly and that is why I gave a 2 star rating instead of 1.
author: J Y.

description:
I had the pork ramen, veggie and shrimp tempura and chicken karrage.

This morning I threw up twice and had diarrhea. On the way to work, I fought back vomiting and had more diarrhea when I got there. And just as I thought I was over it, I rushed from a meeting I just ended, barely making it to the bathroom to throw up yet again.

Never have I ever had such terrible food poisoning. I ordered from here last night for the first and the last time. I'm never ordering food from Kama Sushi Soma again.
author: Frances L.

description:
Great Sushi Happy Hour!

I really liked this place, and the happy hour is amazing. A good portion of the menu (from poke to rolls to hot dishes) as well as many drinks are heavily discounted, two people can eat and drink their way to merriment for about $25. I especially liked the sweet potato roll, but was NOT a fan of the sunomono. It was actually the worst sunomono I've ever had, and I think it scared my date into never trying it again. BUT, everything else was really good.
author: Brian S.

description:
perfect little happy hour spot! Was super pumped to find this gem after a quick Costco run- it's kind of in the middle of nowhere but the happy hour deal cannot be beat.

Must: Salmon Tataki.  Seared salmon with jalapenos, garlic sauce and whatever else, it's so good and half off for happy hour! The Nigiri was an amazing deal- yellowtail super delicious.  Even the pork belly skewers were pretty tasty. 

The sushi was decent, mostly rice. Skip the Spicy Tuna, but the Salmon Avocado roll was pretty flavorful.

Oh yea, don't forget to check in on Yelp and get that free sake!
author: Reyana F.

description:
Not a bad place at all. The location was a little odd for me, the surrounding streets were pretty dark so please travel in groups for your own safety! If you check in with yelp, you get a free small hot sake for a table of 2 or a free large hot sake for a table of 3 or more.

Took the waiters a little while to tend to us but I'll give them the benefit of the doubt and don't mark them off for it. The sushi wasn't bad, but I had better elsewhere. Not much options for people like myself who enjoys the "cooked" sushi....
author: Elaine Y.

description:
My friends and I got food poisoning from eating the sushi here. Should've looked at the other Yelp reviews before visiting this place. 

The sushi isn't extraordinarily good, so I would recommend skipping this place.

PS: This place got a 64/100 on their latest health inspection, so you'll probably want to skip eating here.
author: Eric Z.

description:
This place seems to have really upped their game lately.
I have lived in SoMa 3 years and been going to Kama for a while, but this is my first review.

Their fish is some of the best I've tasted in SF. Delicate, complex, never stringy.
The deluxe sushi dinner is the best way to experience it, as it comes with sashimi, nigiri, and a large fancy roll for $26.

The yellowtail is spectacular. Even in the negihama rolls which can sometimes have the rattier cuts, the flavor was great and the flesh was soft.

Their oysters are also very nice, perfectly dressed with vinegar, chile, and scallion at $1.50 each.

You MUST save room for the fried green tea ice cream when you go. It's such a great dessert. Deep fried with a crust that is both crispy and thick enough to have some soft cakey interior as well, it matches perfectly with the slightly sweet and subtly flavored ice cream.

I'd also like to call out their great happy hour with superb deals on rolls and sake.
Portions are right on the money and you always feel satisfied, maybe a little over the top if you forgot to save room for the ice cream!
author: Wolf R.

description:
You know--for happy hour sushi, it was really good! And cheap!

Nothing I ate was over $5, and everything tasted fresh and delicious. The inari were a little small, but they were folded in a unique way, so that was cool. The pieces of salmon on my nigiri were really big (although, alas, the sticky rice was not so sticky--the fish wouldn't stay on the rice). And the cucumber avocado roll was tightly packed and as good as can be. 

Will definitely go back for more happy hour!
author: Allison S.

description:
Great service , they give you  free edamame which is really nice. They don't put avocado on the outside of their rolls, but they made it just for us. 
Nice place !
author: Sonia S.

description:
Went for the first time yesterday, and it was excellent. The fish is high quality, and the service was really good, although there were only about 5 people in the restaurant. The atmosphere is also nice. The dining room has a very cool setup, and includes a small VIP room for private parties (you might fit 12 in there comfortably, give or take).

For sushi restaurants, I usually need a few visits before I can give my final grade, so we shall see how the next few visits go. Also takes a few visits to give the menu an overall grade. 

Great overall first impression, though.
author: Fletcher G.

description:
First time I was here, I ordered spicy miso ramen $10.95, maguro nigiri $5.50, and red dragon roll (cucumber & spicy tuna topped with seared tuna & tataki sauce) $11.95, I loved them all. I favor tuna over salmon and the combo of spicy tuna and seared tuna just sounded too good to pass up. Ramen broth was full flavored, tuna sashimi was fresh, and the red dragon roll was definitely worth a try if you like tuna.  Service was great, attentive to our needs even though we were in the "back room".  Price is not cheapest but seemed reasonable with the quality of fish. Price, service, quality....all worth a second time coming back.

I liked my first experience so much, I'm back for my birthday dinner and asked for the back room for our party of 10.
author: Cathryn T.

description:
I'm a sushi-snob and Kama Sushi Soma rates, (have not tried their other locations.)

They have the quality of fish you demand, they offer decent size portions, (always better when you sit at the bar and befriend the chef of course...), they have an inventive sushi chef, and a full kitchen,  and a nicely remodeled space with easy parking and no waiting, (yet).

As others have noted, the quality here rivals that of the best, including such notables as Live Sushi, Ebisu, Sushi Ran and Sebu locally.  And at quite good prices compared to others of this caliber.

Try a Yelp Check-in, there should be a free Sake offer or such, at least for a while longer.  

Save me a seat at the bar...  (The udon is quite good as well.)
author: Rob T.

description: Great service. Great sushi. Quick service. Lots of variety. I always order from them when I'm craving sushi and they've never let me down.  You can order online which is amazing! I mean delivery sushi ... need I say more!
author: Mal L.

description: YAY Kama Sushi ! South of market this is THE best place for happy hour. They have their killer sushi and drinks for like 1/2 off - it's incredible. And on top of that - they are the nicest people in the whole world. Every one of them. I work over at 8th and Brannan - so Kama is the perfect place for after work drinks and sushi with my buddies. Last time we sat at one of the large booths in the back and M was our waitress. And she was amazing too. : ) I highly recommend this place - we always have a blast.
author: L.M. W.

description:
We were dissapointed with this sushi place.  Coming from the burbs we expected way better quality and presentation from a sushi joint in SF but it did not happen here.

Our server was very nice and great at upselling us on the pricier items on the menu.  With her recommendation and paying more for the hamchi belly appetizer and higher priced rolls we thought it would be great and it instead it was average and very small portions.

And nothing bothers me more than somebody ordering after us and receiving their food before us.  Yep, that is what happened.  The table next to us ordered after us and had all their food before we received our two rolls.

Needless to say we won't be back.
author: Lydia K.

description:
No need to make reservations for 2, came in on a Saturday night and was seated right away. Great for a date night in an intimate setting. Servers were attentive and helpful. You must order: 

Tuna poki-- amazing! Almost as good as the poki bowls I've had in Hawaii. Fresh, marinated bite-size tuna with spices and seaweed 
C27- spicy scallop cucumber roll topped with hamachi and salmon. Very delicious! 
If you love raw fish and poki, this is the spot to try. I will definitely be back.
author: Emily Y.

description:
Solid sushi at a reasonably price. 

It was a Saturday night, so naturally my friends and I were headed to Bootie. But we needed someplace to refuel first. Sushi seemed like the perfect call. We were not disappointed. 

We ordered a lot of rolls, and I'm going to be honest...I remember only one. The uni (sea urchin) and quail egg. My friends were not down to try uni, and I hadn't before so I decided to go it alone. And I'm a fan! Interesting flavor and consistency. The flavor of the quail egg added to the richness. Definitely an interesting dish I'll be trying again. 

Though I can't remember any of the other rolls, I can remember thinking to myself "damn, this is good," every time I crushed a new roll. My friends were also enjoying everything. So I can tell you that it was all good!

Good service. Reasonable prices, and a happy stomach. That's all we needed before dancing the night away at our favorite Saturday spot.
author: Eli Y.

description:
Came in here on a Sunday night to grab some sushi and offer my mind a break from the study material. Was pleasantly surprised by the atmosphere and quality of service. Not used to sushi places where you sit at the bar but order from waiters but it worked out. The place gets pretty backed up with phone and online orders so I would recommend accounting for that. 

My selections arrived fresh and very tasty. If the sushi came out faster this place would be a 5. Will definitely return for some sushi in the future. I
author: Andrew V.

description:
I ordered the sashimi combo and a Sapporo. Amazing fish - some of the freshest I've had in a while. 

The service was prompt and friendly. The location is easily accessible.
author: Jeremy P.

description:
Was getting a little concerned about how long it took to get our two rolls out, and soon learned it was well worth the wait! My boyfriend and I have found our new favorite sushi spot! 
The wait staff was friendly and fast, and the sushi was so, so, so, fresh. Even though the rolls took a bit of time to come out, the quality of the food is worth it, the chef definitely knows how to do his job. I cannot wait to go back! for my favorite 49er roll.
author: Katie B.

description:
3.5 stars, actually. 

A year ago I'd have given this place a solid 4 stars, but I'm a little spoiled now after trying some of the truly amazing sushi places in SF.

Here comes our good old pros/cons: 

+ Friendly service
+ No wait on a Friday night (woohoo!)
+ Super affordable (especially with the $10 for $20 Yelp deal) 
+ Has more than 5 tables (gosh I'm so fed up with those hole-in-the-wall family style sushi bars) 
+ Complimentary edamame (not that fresh though, sad face) 

- The hamachi nigiri was a bit disappointing (texture seemed wrong and it was way too fishy). 
- None of the nigiris/rolls we tried were impressive (but they are still pretty good by general standards) 

This place is NOT for snobs, but for the rest of us I'd say it's a decent place to get sushi in SOMA.  If you set your expectations right, you will have a good time and your wallet will be happy too :)
author: Rachel Z.

description:
There is some fantastic nigiri at this place.  In short get anything "belly" if you can:
- Toro! (fatty  tuna / tuna belly: almost falling apart!) 
- "Sake Harami" (salmon belly) that was like 50% fatty... amazing...
- "special seared hamachi toro" which we had to order extras of.... get it if they have it!
-  Super white tuna ("walu") - perhaps my favorite Walu in the city

I've had mixed luck with everything else though: Yelp's algorithmically recommended  crunchy lobster roll was tasty and varied, but their staff-recommended bacon wrapped mochi was just "OK."
author: Aaron M.

description: Food was good, but later that night my friends and I all got food poisoning. Never going back.
author: Arvin R.

description: wooden, branches and modern soma interiors...free large hot sake check-in offer taking...browsing roll heavy menu...taking a few rolls and small plates...pyramid roll actually a fat triangle shaped roll...thick rice chewy roll...mostly fillers...dragon roll not the standard and more rice filler bites...deep fried rolls with hot sauce heavy battered and unpleasant...small gekkeikan horin junmai daiginjo sake three-hundred ml $thirty basically double market price....good sake...chicken karaage standard...$one-hundred-twelve for dinner for three with sake....experienced far better rolls in comparison....
author: Hen A.

description: Expensive food poisoning.  Food was terrible, and they got a 64 for their health inspection.
author: Michael T.

description:
Originally I thought 3 stars but according to yelp 3 = A-ok and 2=Meh. I've experienced better. and wow, that pretty much sums it up EXACTLY for me, so 2 stars it is. It didn't suck, but this was the epitomy of mediocrity.

I wanted Ramen, this is the 2nd time I have gone here for Ramen. The first time I saw Karaage Ramen on the menu and thought it was a great idea and I blamed myself for ordering stupidly, when it was Totally mediocre.

This time I went for Spicy Tonkotsu pretty straight forward, classic Ramen. Mediocre beyond words. The key to good Tonkotsu Ramen is the soup has to be a rich velvety symphony of porky goodness. The soup tasted like Campbells chicken noodle.

The egg was hard boiled, not soft boiled, which is another key to delicious ramen. I will confess that its pretty food-snobby to demand a soft custardy yolk, but if you want 5 stars from me, thats what it takes. What really sucked about the egg was that the center was cold, and not like not hot, like straight out of the refrigerator cold.

Moving on, the Char siu was a little off too, one slice tasted kind of spoiled, another was completely drenched in 5 spice powder. Inconsistent would be the nicest thing  I could say about it.

Noodles were a little overcooked and completely blah.

One last thing, and this is sort of a personal taste thing, but WTF is with corn in Tonkotsu Ramen? Miso Flavor? OK. Salt flavor? OK. Butter Corn Ramen? Absolutely! Yum! But Tonkotsu? Hmm, I don't think so.

OK so the Ramen was not spectacular. I do want to say that it did not suck. It was not per se, "Bad Ramen" I have had bad ramen in my life and this definitely was not that bad. If There was a massive earthquake and everything south of San Bruno was inaccessible, I might order Ramen from here again, otherwise I'd rahter head down to San Mateo for exceptional Ramen at any of the many fine shops there.

On a more positive note, We also ordered some Ankimo and Yakiniku (butabarra and bacon wrapped mochi) All of which were great. I also had a Asahi Draft which was cold and foamy as it should be. Service was OK. Cost seemed a little high for what it was, but what do you expect in SOMA. $80 for 4 for lunch seems a little high to me. We eat similarly at other Ramen shops for $20-$30 less.

I did not notice any of the cleanliness issues mentioned in other reviews, seems like they got that under control, and service was fine.
author: Andrew B.

description: Was there for dinner a few days ago with friends . Great customer services . The food was amazing had a blast hanging out with my girlfriends . Love the crunchy lobster roll , hamachi Kama ,soft shell crab, Kama beef , sunrise , enoki skewers , and Mochi for desert . Great place nice atmosphere to hang out grab dinners and drinks . My girlfriend check in on yelp and got an comp saki . It was an fun girls night out need to do this more often . New spot for girls night out .
author: Ella L.

description:
If i could give ten stars i would. every time i have eaten here i have had great food and amazing service. for the price and location it just can't be beat!  
check out their happy hour food, even better prices for the same great food.
author: mic r.

description:
I thought this place was pretty good, but I was not totally blown away.  

The sushi deluxe combo was good, but some of the fish was chewy.  Salmon was pretty good.  The edamame was a bit wilted, but I still ate it and it tasted fine.  I had an issue with a dirty glass that they replaced with a clean one.  Service was pleasant.  

I'll give it another try and update this review, but as you can see, it was A-OK.
author: Daniel V.

description: Went here for lunch with my son who works around the corner.  Went in about 12:45 waited to be greeted and never was, another guy came in behind us and grabbed the last table.  We didn't know it's a free for all at this place.  Finally we got seated and ordered, took a long time to get the food, it was busy.  The food was good and the prices fair.
author: pochini m.

description: The veggie ramen was very flavorful and it came with either an avocado or cucumber roll! The portion was huge as well, which I liked!
author: Tay J.

description: yes, my homies over at Kama Sushi have a killer happy hour. must get: tataki, scallop skewer, 49er, and the hamachi. No problems noted. The servers had good items to recommend and they were very friendly. I am definitely coming back next time I visit SF. peace out homies
author: Wyett S.

description: The bomb dot com... This place is doing me real good. I've been getting the cold appetizers often. Lots of variety and the quality is on point!
author: Adriana S.

description:
Decided to check out this place out with a friend due to a recommendation from my roommate. The atmosphere is modern and laidback. The sushi was fresh and the portion size is rather large. I recommend the waitress Annie ! She was very attentive and nice. She made the experience 10x better.

This is my favorite sushi place in the city!
author: Sarah C.

description:
" High risk vermin infestation"

i used to like this place. the steamed spinach with sesame sauce and clam soup were dishes i would order almost every time. i would have given them a 3 stars if i were to write them a review before last night.

last night, there was a roach that joined us for dinner. and it wouldn't go away. 

it was alive! first on the table, then on the wall, then it was crawling all over the bench i was on, and it just wouldn't go away. i literally jumped out of my seat when it was approaching me, fast. the waiter happened to be right at our table giving us the check. we told him. he walked away. and never came back.

same with me, i will never come back.

food was disappointing, too. the spinach dish was different. the sashimi was tiny. tamago sushi was no good. and the ramen was meh. 

then the roach. yuck. i have been to many ghetto restaurants and NEVER had a roach on my table or seat before. first time. argh. and i hope this will be my last.
author: Diana C.

description: I Love this place!  The staff are very professional and polite. The decor is nice and calming. If you are ever in the soma area stop here for great sushi and a good selection of sake.  But don't be surprised if you have to wait a few minutes outside to get a table.
author: Jean S.

description:
My friend and I were in the area for an event. After we had a good time shopping, we decided to find a close by place to eat. We were both craving sushi so decided to come here base on reviews.

What we ordered:

* Seaweed salad
* 7 piece sashmi chef special 
* Golden Dragon 
* Rainbow roll

The sashmi was really fresh and yummy. Everything else was super yummy too. 

When I walked into the place, it looked really small but when I walked to the bathroom there is another side. The decor is super cute that I wanted to take some of it home. 

Definitely a place to return!
author: Huong N.

description:
I LOVE this place!

Very nice service, fresh fish, delicious sashimi.
One time we even got ice cream on-the-house.
author: Marin U.

description: I had their Pork Katsu Dinner Set and Unago (Unagi + Mango) roll, both of which tasted great and were priced fairly. Also tried my friend's Salmon Kama and Unagi Don. The salmon was grilled extremely well, and the Unagi had excellent flavoring.
author: A L.

description:
If I could give 10 star...
Just had a sumptuous meal with excellent service!

9th and Folsom here in San Francisco.
author: Mike L.

description:
My boyfriend and I went here because I ALWAYS crave sushi and have been trying to find a good place in the area.
I was feeling sick, so my boyfriend wanted to take me out and make me feel better by feeding me everything that my stomach desired.
I called ahead of time to see if there was a wait and they said they always keep a 2 seater available for drop-ins without reservations. I think when we got there, that had just been given away, but we were able to be seated at the bar.
We ordered:

Appetizers:
Salmon Tuna Tower - AMAZING. Loved it so much
Tofu Salad - I love tofu, so anything with tofu is delicious to me
Edamame - standard
Miso Soup - standard

Sushi:
Hot Mama - delicious!
Red Dragon Roll (?) - don't really remember exactly which roll he got, but it was good I think!

Drinks:
Sake - free!
Sapporo - he drank
Hot Tea - my drink cuz I was sick (made me feel better!)

Dessert:
Mochi lover - it was okay.

Great service and great food for a great price. 
Before getting the bill, we were trying to guess how much we ate and we both guessed numbers over $100, but it ended up being about $70 which we were both pleasantly surprised with!

Overall: I will definitely be coming here again for my next sushi craving
author: Tiffany G.

description:
My friend and I stopped here on our way to an event down the street. We were pleasantly surprised; I wish my office was in SOMA so I could get happy hour here some time...

+Pyramid roll (Signature roll) - hamachi, salmon, avocado roll topping with red &
green tobiko, delicious! It came out fresh and it filled me up.

+Chirashi Don - sushi rice topped with various pieces of sashimi; there were two of each types of fish! 

+Check in on Yelp for a free hot sake! Awesome. 

+/- Service was ok; this place is small and there weren't many people here when we first came in; it started filling up during our meal. There was only 1 waitress though, so things were moving a bit slower.
author: Katherine S.

description: Came here Saturday with my husband as we had a mini stay-cation in flag. My husband ordered the chicken noodle bowl I ordered the "Pluto roll" the food was tasty however the morning after this last dinner meal my stomach started killing me I had the runs for a couple days now don't know if I'll try it again...
author: Kimberly C.

description:
*Good vibe, friendly service, great HH prices, decent sushi
*Their seared salmon was good
*kinda sketch neighborhood, def an adventure wading through the TL to get here
author: Dan S.

description:
Attended a birthday party at Kama Sushi and I am glad to have tried it.

I ordered a chirashi which is what I usually order when I try a new sushi place. The fish was of good quality, everything was prepared well, had generous portions, and it was even priced fairly (~$20)! If I actually lived closer to the place, I can see myself coming here often to get my chirashi fix.

My party of 9 tried a wide variety of rolls and other appetizers and they seemed pretty happy with their orders. I didn't get to try any myself but they all looked pretty legit. The only exception was the veggie ramen. It was alright. Tasted more like spicy instant Korean ramen than anything else. haha

All in all,
author: Samuel P.

description:
Excellent Sushi!   Very delicious and very authentic... specifically the rice preparation is consistent with Japan (not too firm) as is the method in how the fish is presented (e.g. thickness, placement on the rice, amount of wasabi).  Of course they have to start with fresh fish, too. 

Tonkotzu ramen (regional specialty in Japan) was also very good as was the Yakitori chicken.

Service was excellent but we were the first customers of the night.

Loved it and would go back again.

I assume that if you are willing to go to an area like 9th Street in SF you will know there is an extensive homeless population... just be forewarned in case you are taking a 9 y/o daughter like we did.
author: Tim Z.

description: Great sushi and reasonably priced! Also a huge plus for SF that there's parking nearby
author: Anna N.

description: My favorite place in the area ! Food is good! Fish is super fresh! Love the girl who works here! She is super friendly and always smile ! Wish I know her name ... I think she is Korean :)
author: Kiko W.

description:
This is my favorite Sushi spot in San Francisco. 

Easy parking
Friendly staff
Delicious food
Reasonably priced

Thanks guys
author: Hugo L.

description: Great chirashi Don that I ever had !!!!fish very fresh good portion. Excellent service and easy to find parking.
author: secilia c.

description: I really like the dim ambiance and wooden interior of this place. The sushi was great too (HIGHLY recommend the Hot Papa, which we ordered as a wild card but ended up loving the most). It was really nice to see creative ingredient combinations for their rolls, instead of the cream cheese-infested rolls I see at other sushi places. The free hot sake for a Yelp check-in was a good deal. They forgot about one of our orders after the sushi bar was already closed for the night, but the waiter offered us free mochi ice cream dessert to make up for it.
author: Christine C.

description: Kama.sushi is one of my favorite sushi place to go in the city.  I have been here many time with friends and family and they all like it.  Reasonable price and good food... definitely will be back soon
author: Mavis L.

description: Foxy roll!! tonkotsu ramen!! 12 pcs Sashimi special!!!  They are all my favorite. Love the atmosphere and decor here, food as well. The servers are decent and attentive. I definitely will be back again. Hope they have ten zaru soba later on....
author: Lynny S.

description: Love this place! We ordered delivery and made notes to change our order from Sushi to Sashimi - they are so accommodating that they made what we wanted and now we're all happy! It doesn't hurt that the restaurant is right next door to our apartment! Can u say FAST DELIVERY! Really fast! Love them love their food!
author: Andrrs B.

description: Serving was huge! Tried the chicken and beef teriyaki lunch and the food tasted fresh and delicious. Very beautiful interior design and a clean place. Service was fast too.
author: Krizzia C.

description: I haunt this place for lunch. Love the sashimi and sushi rice bowl. Took my boyfriend here and he likes it too :)
author: Steph N.

description: Came here for my first time, and the food and staff was amazing. Tried the "hot papa" roll, and it was out of this world.  The staff was more than courteous and showed us an amazing experience for our first time and this is the place that I would 100% recommend to anyone.
author: Spencer K.

description:
This is my go-to place when I'm at home and I'm too tired or too lazy to cook. I've been here about 20 times since I moved into the City in June and have always had a positive experience. The frequency of my visits is a function of convenience (I live across the street), quality, and my preference for Japanese foods. 

This is a Chinese-run-Japanese restaurant with modern decor and dark uniforms. After being seated, you can expect a glass of water and a bowl of complimentary edamame. Free food is always welcome. Service is prompt and professional. This place is generally busy but never packed. I've never had to wait for a table or a seat at the bar.

My favorite dishes include the Tonkotsu and Karaage Ramen, Curry Rice, various sushi, and Sake (Salmon) Oyakodon. The food is consistently between good and great, but not amazing.

A solid 4 stars.
author: Daniel W.

description:
A surprise birthday dinner with friends was complimented with the delicious menu,

Their menu is pretty expansive, and they have great seating for a large group,so our party of 8 enjoyed themselves with good food and the biggest bottle of sake.

- Chicken Karaage: Fried chicken, japanese style. Delicious.
- Ike Karaage: Fried calimari. Light and tasty.
- Geso Fried: I think the legs have the most flavor, so delicious.
-  Ika Sukatayaki: This was suprisingly delicious.  Its a bit startling, because its a whoel squid, but flavorful and has a nice smokey flavor.
- Beef Enoki: This was the least enjoyed thing.  It wasn't that it was bad, just the other things were so much better.
- Sake Nigiri: Fresh, and hefty portion.
- Hamachi Nigiri: Also clean flavored.
- Fire Cracker: Good crowd pleaser roll. It's fried.
- Hot Mama: This was ok, as I enjoy only raw salmon.
- Dragon: Classic, and good.
- Rainbow: Beautiful and fresh fish.
- 49er: My fav roll, as the lemon really compliments the crab and salmon.
- Red Dragon: Nice spin with teh seared tuna.
- Foxy: Good roll, with a the surprise of the mango.

This was a fantastic place for a large group dinner as they have tables where you sit on matts, but are really sitting in a chair. Hard to explain, but remember this, totally ok to keep your shoes on.  All in all, I would recommend coming back here again.
author: Natalie G.

description:
I love finding hidden gems like this one. And I usually discover them in the most unexpected of ways. 

I had no idea what to expect before coming into Kama Sushi and the neighborhood certainly didn't help swing my opinion favorably (it's in the shady part of SOMA fyi). However, I was completely sold from the second we entered. The place is small, intimate and cozy with a strong bamboo/woodsy vibe. And our waitress was one of the friendliest women I've met. She was very helpful with our decision making process, made some great recommendations and was extremely attentive. 

I was initially hesitant to order Ramen at a Sushi spot but did so anyway as it looked rather enticing on a windy and cold night - totally stacks up to one of the best decisions I've made this month! The Ramen is remarkable and entirely unlike any other Ramen I've had before. The flavor is unique, spicy and creative - I could seriously live off this broth for days! And the pork meat is so tender, fatty and juicy, mmm. 

I also highly recommend the Crunchy Lobster, the Hot Mama and the Hot Papa rolls. As a specialty roll craver, I was beyond satisfied with how delectable these cheesy, baked and fried rolls were. 

The highlight of the meal, however, was in our wine of choice - the plum wine. Oh dear lord this is a haven for dessert wine lovers. They even threw in actual plums in our glasses! 

I highly recommend this hidden treasure for dates and intimate gatherings with friends - it's a bit on the quieter side which is perfect to actually hear what your counterparts are saying and engage in great conversation. 

Happy Eating, Yelpers!
author: Priya S.

description: Yelp again doesn't let me down. Great reviews hold true to their word. Very fresh, reasonable prices for SF, and fast friendly service. A bit loud to carry on a conversation due to the popularity resulting in every seat taken, but perfect for lunch!
author: K D.

description:
My favorite SF sushi spot.  

I love this place because its reasonable, fresh and a small intimate place.  I get a feeling locals frequent this place so you know its good.  Check in on yelp and get a free round of sake...yay!
author: Farhana D.

description: I've been here many times because we live in the neighborhood, not because this place is very special. The sushi is just ok. Not always fresh tasting and quality not up to par with better places like Blowfish. Rolls really loose, almost fall apart. Stick to the hot sake and ramen bowls.
author: Jim D.

description:
2 stars for 'eh i've experienced better. 

It's hard to find a 'cheap' sushi place in SF. I guess you don't really want to find a 'cheap sushi place'. But I don't know. 

The place had TOO many specials..seemed odd. Like they were trying to get rid of something. 

Service was nice, but didn't seem experienced. Place seemed clean and friendly. 

Thanks to YELP we got free sake. We had a few fried rolls which were good and some fried balls. Everything was mediocre. We didn't get any fish or i'd tell you how that was. 

My recommendation: Ehhhh, i don't really have much to say on this place.
author: Heather H.

description: If I could give 6 stars I would!! Love this place and the fast friendly service! Absolutely one of the best sushi places I have come across.
author: Alexis D.

description:
The free hot sake with your first check-in on Yelp  is awesome....even better was the second free hot sake I got on the house. 

Decor: modern, with great wood elements throughout. Tableware was cool....though some of the plates were awkwardly wobbly. 

Service: Spot on! I sat at the bar and felt the staff was quick to clear away trash/empty plates, and to fill my glass with water at least three times. They were also all incredibly polite, and even called me 'sir' on several occasions (heheh). 

Food: Standard-fare, with some plating flare. Nothing to write home about, but fresh and tasty at least. 

Overall a pleasant experience. I'll be back....hoping for more hot sake!
author: Brandon J.

description:
tonkatsu ramen is bad.
Table surface is so sticky. 
I will not recommend my friends go there. OVER PRICE.

Soup base without pork favor, deduct a star.
They put some little pork meat on top of the noodle.
I can't even find a full piece of chashu on it, deduct 2 stars
They charge $10 for a bowl with cheap ingredients, deduct 2 stars.
author: SteveMorris M.

description:
Semi great service, but after what happened... I'm not sure if I'll be coming back. My friend and I were paranoid the whole time at Kama.

My friend and I came in on a Tuesday and sat down. We ordered the following:

Karage ramen ($9.95): Broth was a joke. It was bland and seemed like chicken powder broth with the salad type veggies. I came make this at home for $1.00.

Bento box ($9.95): Spicy tuna had no flavor (wasn't even spicy) and the quality of the fish was not good. Chicken tariyaki was a very small and very thin strips drowned in sauce. 

Lemon Hama ($12.95): This was the only reason why I gave this place one extra star. This roll was actually really good. The lemon was very refreshing. The items altogether was very compatible. 

After the guy took our order and left, I decided to pour soy sauce for my friend and myself. I lifted the saucer, placed it in front of me, picked up the soy sauce container and poured the soy sauce into my friend's saucer. Something started moving and I flipped out! There was a cockroach moving in his saucer. I quickly called the server and had him remove that saucer out of our table. The manager or owner came rushing to our table and apologized. He asked if we were still comfortable eating here and we were both hesitant, but stayed anyways. The manager said things like that never happened here before and that he can't change what happened, but was willing to give us drinks on the house and 20% off our meal. We said ok because our lunch hour was nearly over and couldn't afford to look for another place to eat.

The whole time during our meal, we were very uneasy. We kept wondering if any other cockroaches will pop up or ended up in our meal. I would ask my friend if he had any crunch to the ramen.

I have this place two stars because of the attentiveness from the manager and the Lemon Hama roll, but I don't think I will be coming back.
author: Erica T.

description:
I'm all about supporting small business and local businesses but I think this place needs major improvement. 

The Tables were sticky.
Overpriced Sushi

I'd come back for the Hamachi and Miso Soup, but the ambiance really took off the stars.

Good Luck.
author: Lee L.

description:
How anyone gives this restaurant below 5 stars is beyond me! 

We came in with a group of 12 people on Saturday night (the reservation was made less than a week in advance). I realize large groups can be a pain in the ass... they were wonderful and accommodating and SO easy to deal with!!

We ordered at least 15 different rolls... all of which were absolutely delicious!! We had a squid appetizer (a whole squid!). This would not normally be my thing, but our server said it was his favorite.. everyone loved it!! 

I cant begin to think about how much saki we had (at least 5 hot 3 normal bottles of cold and one GIANT bottle). BTW if you have a group... get the GIANT house saki... its not on the menu and costs 4x whatever the price for the normal size is, but its at least 6x as big and its good!! 

On top of all of this... we brought a birthday cake and gave it to the hostess when we arrived... at the right time, they dimmed the lights and brought out the cake lit and ready to go (no one had to ask or say anything). It was fabulous! 

To top it off... after tons of food and drinks, we split our bill a bunch of different ways and had cash (there was not even a hint of complaint or frustration from our server). I asked him to tell me if we had anything short of 20% tip in cash after he had taken out the cards (I thought we had more... but like I said... lots of sake). His response "Don't worry you can get me next time." WHAT?!?! We definitely made sure we had more... but come on... what server says that?! Did I mention it was only $30 per person after all that??? 

GO HERE!!! GO HERE NOW!!! I will go here for any group dinner!! (I have also been informed from a friend that their take-out is even delicious... thats impressive!)

Seriously... new favorite sushi restaurant!!
author: Jess K.

description: Excellent sushi, fresh and tasty, at a surprisingly affordable  price to boot. Sashimi (Omakase!!) and rolls are great. Can't comment on other dishes but the place was packed during both my visits and everyone was devouring their food with relish.
author: Blazej K.

description: Came here last night for dinner with a few friends . The the food is amazing we had the oyster shooter, white out roll, crunchy lobster roll, sashimi , daily special , skewers, seafood salad , omakase , large selection of veggi rolls , and fried ice cream . The have a large selection of sake and beers . The customer service was amazing they took great care of my party . I didn't know about the check in on yelp but our server told us about a free hot sake . Would be coming here more often for dinner great food and customer service !!!
author: Edmond T.

description: Very nice ambient and service. We sat in a cabinet in Japanese style. Good for chatting with privacy. Then, the food quality is obviously first class. I had been to many Japanese restaurants but the creativity of Kama Sushi impressed me: e.g. deep-fried whole fish, and sliced sashimi in grey (sorry I can't remember the original names). With freshness, the look can further stimulate your appetite. And in the end, when you somehow combine the food to the ambient, the experience is superior.
author: Lei J.

description:
Although this is a sushi place, their RAMEN is delicious! I had the tonkatsu ramen, it came with pork, egg, some bamboo shoots, seaweed, and various other veggies. You can also get your ramen spicy! So far one of my favorite places for ramen in SF. 

Happy Hour 5-7! Delicious spicy tuna roll for $5. 
Also during lunch you can get a free avocado roll with your ramen!  Yum!
author: Jamie T.

description:
I like Sushi places but this will definitely be my last time coming here.

We met some friends here and within 5 minutes of our arrival we ordered our food. We all ordered about 10 different items on the menu.

I ordered the not so fresh and tender beef Undo soup. I've had Undo soup many places and this was by far the worst to say the least. The beef was tough and the whole soup lacked vegetables and flavor. I also tried a soggy salmon cream cheese mango roll and it was mediocre at best.

The only redeemable part of my meal was the Hot mama rolls, which is baked salmon on a crab roll. The service was friendly but inaccurate because they completely forgot about an item and by that time it arrived to our table because we asked for it the hot dish was lukewarm.

In a nutshell this whole experience was less than average and for $99 I could have gotten better food and service elsewhere. Kama sushi gets 2 thumbs down and I'd recommend going elsewhere.
author: V W.

description:
Oh my god how haven't I posted my review of Kama to Yelp?  I eat here so much it's not funny.

Not once have I had a bad meal here.  I have never had trouble with food poisoning, never had anything under cooked, and never had trouble with their service.

I come to eat in the afternoon and evening, from the first day they opened until the night of this review.  I actually came here after eating a very unsatisfying meal at a new place nearby, because I needed a good roll that wasn't going to make me feel like I wasted my time.

I see a lot of unhappy reviews, and even remember sitting near some of these reviews when they were served (YOUR YELP PICTURE BETRAYS YOU!).  I've always seen a lack of communication or a "the place I usually go does it differently so this place is wrong" attitude in response to an unhappy meal.

Fake sushi?  Poor quality?  Bad fish?  I haven't seen any of it.  And I'm a stuck-up asshole when it comes to quality.
author: William C.

description:
WHOA- ultimate fail. 

I love sashimi and japanese food in general but this place definitely did NOT hit the spot. 
My friends and I came here for happy hour since we heard that it was "good" (which now makes me question her standard of "good" and will most likely not trust her again on the topic of sushi). We were excited when we saw the cheap beer (large kirin for $3.50), $2.95 for nigiri (2 pieces) and $4.50 (generic maki rolls). We went a little overboard with the ordering and ended up with a lot of (wack) fish!

It was extremely disappointing when all our orders got messed up, they overcharged us, accused us of "receiving" what we ordered despite not delivering like 4-5 orders. -___- As a group that loves to eat out and explore delicious restaurants, we all left with a sour taste in our mouth and unsatisfied. 

Review of the fish? My hamachi still had skin and a piece of fat hanging from it's side, tuna tasted like rubber, salmon was way too chewy and not fresh......
The service wasn't spectacular but it wasn't rude so hence the extra star (?).This is definitely not a legit japanese restaurant nor worth the money (despite being happy hour price).
author: Patricia K.

description:
We drove by the restaurant and decided to try it. We got seated right away since it wasn't that busy.  We checked-in on yelp & got free sake. :) 

We ordered a couple of dishes to split between us 3. We had the Hamachi Carppaccio which was delicious. We tried the fried squid legs and that was probably the best dish we ordered all night. The sauce that came with the dish  was sweet and went perfectly with the fried squid legs. Another dish i really enjoyed was the crunchy lobster roll. 

There was one dish i didn't like too much and it was the pork belly skewer. It was tasteless & the sauce that came with it was not good....

Overall, the food & the service was good.
author: Stephanie W.

description:
Came here because of the yelp deal. The Soft shell crab appetizer was really good, the spicy tuna roll was okay, and the ramen wasn't amazing and i found it strange there was lettuce in mine, seems like SF doesn't have any amazing Ramen places that i've been to thus far. Most of the better ramen places are in the peninsula or in the south bay.

The place has an interesting layout it looks small but when u turn the corner theres extra seating and bathrooms on the otherside.
author: Darnell L.

description:
One star is for the food poisoning. Otherwise, I would've given this place three stars. This isn't a legit sushi place, so I don't really understand why people are raving about it. However, this is certainly the most edible Japanese delivery I've had in SF so far. I ordered the spicy tuna roll and tempura udon and sorely regretted it for the rest of the night.

There's not much to say about the food at Kama, so I'm going to go into detail about my food poisoning.

- started feeling nauseous
- started sweating and feeling like i'm burning up.  
- the room starts spinning and i had to take my glasses off. 
- VERY nauseous. feel as if I drank patron shots all night.
- ran straight to bathroom (won't go into details).
- lying in bed, freezing and shivering.
- bathroom again.
- rinse and repeat

All in all, a very horrible night.
author: Emily C.

description:
Delivered to me. 

Very fresh sashimi, very fresh uni.

Yummy rolls

Delivered on time and everything that was suppose to be warm was warm and sashimi was nice and chilled still.
author: Jenn T.

description:
The happy hour is awesome, and I believe the sushi is worth getting for the price.
The udon was OK at best, and the ramen is totally unsatisfying.
I came here a few times before, but lately the service has been slow and sub par.

The reason I give it two stars is because my waiter took FOREVER to give me my check, and I found out he gave it to the wrong table with my card inside.
He didn't even notice until the table got up and said that he gave them someone else's card.
No apology.
Wait about 15 minutes for my "new check" and my card. I leave the restaurant and find that they charged me THREE times. When I go back in and talk to the girl about the charges, she got flustered and defensive. No apology.
They did void it, eventually. After about 2 weeks of going to the bank back and forth. So I was short in my bank account until they took off the charge.

Being a waitress myself, I was really peeved by the unprofessionalism of the staff. I understand mistakes happen, but a simple apology goes a long way in the restaurant biz.
author: Jacqueline C.

description:
Wonderful restaurant with great service! The sashimi was fresh and wonderful. We had about every skewer on the menu, well maybe four. The chicken skewer, beef skewer, pork belly skewer, octopus tempura, and after the umteenth bottle of Sake everything started to blur.

Chicken and beef skewers were tender and not dry, very good.
Pork belly skewer was unbelievable. Crunchy but soft with great flavor with a sort of jelly to paste all over your pieces.
The octopus really set things apart. I was skeptical about the octopus because I thought the deep fried octopus would come out either chewy, dry or both. Just the opposite. They were cooked perfectly.

The service, although there were only a few tables occupied at 1:30p.m., was prompt, courteous and respectful.

This place is well deserving of it's five stars.
author: eric w.

description:
I would not eat here again if it was FREE meals for life!

Nigiri was a JOKE.  
Looks fine, but they have no clue how to manage the fish so you get "bad fishy" instead of "good fishy" (your Hamachi should not taste fishy, which it did... nasty... vs. a good Saba).   Nobu said they were good when he went, so maybe its the staff.  When I went, it was three kids playing sushi chef, and I wouldn't trust a one of them to scramble eggs, and this was Saturday night!  Any monkey can make a roll, but the Nigiri... wow... again, looks fine, but rice was so sadly assembled with the poorly managed fish... bleh!

Bummer... would have been nice to have decent Nigiri in the hood.  

Note:  For the best sushi a human can eat, see Nori-San for Omakase Fri-Sunday at Sushi Ran in Sausalito.  Beats Jiro, Tuskiji at 6am, and anything else in Japan.  Seriously.  If you are a rolls person, skip it... you can be satisfied almost anywhere (jingles keys for entertainment).
author: Dan M.

description:
I usually go here for ramen when I don't want to go all the way to KenKen or Japantown. Their Tonkatsu ramen is pretty good--delicious chashu and a good broth, though the noodles are not homemade and the egg is meh. 

The sushi is okay, though the variability in the quality (sometimes it's really good! sometimes it's awful #spitthefoodintoanapkin) means that I rarely order it and usually just try my boyfriend's. 

They have a tendency to bring out peoples' dishes at different times, so if you all want to eat your curry / ramen / udon at the same time then I recommend asking for them to be served simultaneously.
author: Zoe E.

description: Love this place. Great service n fresh sushi. One of my new faves#! Their spicy ramen was just ok. But their sushi is amazeballs. Their house rolls are fantastic n their oyster shooters were tasty.
author: ThuZ W.

description: Great place for some late 10pm sushi night. Great japanese drought beer and cool wood panels onthe walls make you feel like in a sushi fishing boat heading back to Nagoya harbor...! Good stuff
author: Boehm B.

description:
We went to Kama the other night based on my friend's glowing review after having eaten there three times.

There was nothing wrong with the food, it just wasn't exceptional, and there are many better sushi places in town with fresher tasting fish. We didn't have anything other than sushi and sashimi, that's why I go to a sushi place, not to try noodles or tempura. The only extreme faux pas was when I ordered the special fresh-not-frozen Toro at $33 for 5 slices of sashimi, and it came out seared. WTF?! Seriously, WTF? The whole point of special fresh fatty tuna is to eat it raw, I suspect I got ripped off and it really wasn't what they claimed it to be so they seared it to disguise something.
author: Rob C.

description:
It's Monday,8/5/13 it's cloudy and cold in SF. And my co-worker and I were feeling under the weather and decided for some hot ramen kind of nearby our office. 

1239 Parked and added change to meter
1239 Enter Kama Sushi
1243 Waited for staff to clean and seat us
*Sticky table
1247 Finally got menu but knew exactly what we wanted to order (Tempura udon & Tonkastsu Ramen).
1252 Got Hot tea at our table
1310 Customer next to us got his ramen
1315 Decided not enough time to eat at restaurant
1318 Ask if order hasn't been made to cancel it; was in process; paid meal
*Thank you for the 1/2 off bill for the wait but it doesn't excuse you for a wait for Ramen and Udon. 
*I still gave you a $2 tip. 
1323 Finally had order bagged and ready to go and left back to office - * Really over 30 minutes for Ramen? Really? Even I can get Pho from Turtle Tower under 7 minutes. 
1327 Parked
1331 Contemplated whether to eat it and write this. 
1445 Fintally got a break to eat - it was decent. 

So advice: if you're wanting to come here for lunch, make sure you have more than an hour that we, goverment workers, are allowed. Expect a long wait just for ramen, udon, bento box, etc. If the restaurant wants to keep these new lunch hours open, have enough staff to accomodate customers. 

I'll change this when and if I ever go back. I just wanted Ramen. 

But a new Ramen place is opening up at 174 Valencia very soon which is just around the corner from my goverment office. Hint: Block 3512.
author: Christopher V.

description: The grill squid is pretty delicious, good customer service .The sushi chiefs are understandable willing to customize the rolls as customer request. They knew customer comes first . I am strongly suggest their ramens and omekase which are unique and make them so special in bay.
author: Jason T.

description: Ate here last night and found the service and quality of food to be fantastic! We were quickly seated and served with a free edamame appetizer. Our food came out in a timely manner and we tried the C27, Firecracker balls, and another which I forgot the name of. All were very tasty and decently priced. The only issue I had was squeezing through the tables to sit on the seats against the wall.
author: Jamie B.

description:
This place is fantastic.  The decor is super modern, the music is nice, and the happy hour rocks.

From 5-6:30 they have a GREAT happy hour where you can buy tons of appetizers and small plates at SUPER reasonable prices.  

I LOVE the ahi tuna tataki!  Check in on YELP and get a FREE sake for you and your friends!  

A MUST try for sushi lovers!
author: Stacy S.

description: I made a dinner reservation for 10 for a girlfriend's bachelorette party, and we had a great experience! We had our own back room to ourselves with pillows to sit on (and shoes off at the door). The waiters were very friendly and attentive, and they even gave us a sake on the house since we were celebrating! We ordered the tempura, and lots and lots of different rolls which were great considering how inexpensive they were. The real kicker was the bill at the end - 4 appetizers, 10 rolls, too many glasses of wine and sake and beer pitchers - and our total was only $360 (gratuity included)! I definitely recommend this place for a fun group dinner that feels a little fancy but doesn't break the bank.
author: Bianca T.

description:
It is one of the great restaurants I've been recently!

When I first stepped in the restaurant, I felt a warm atmosphere. The design is thoughtful and innovative with tables for couples by the windows and tatami party rooms. The service is good as well. The food are fresh, delicious, and prepared with heart. The prices are reasonable. I will go to this place again, for sure! It is now one of my favorite restaurants!
author: Santino B.

description:
Came here twice bc I got suckered in by the uni and quail egg photo. I got tricked!!! I also saw on Instagram uni and salmon roe rice don....looks amazing, but heard its only available for lunch. Wah Wah.

First time:
opens later than other sushi places. the sushi was decent. uni here was ok, but potions were smaller than most. The bacon wrapped mochi was disgusting... Don't order it.  The mochi wasn't even fully cooked.

Second time: needed my sushi fix and wanted to try the happy hour menu... I was disappointed. Hh menu sushi was not fresh.  Chicken karage and soft shell crab wasn't bad, but wasn't a great hh deal.  Ordered a rainbow roll and it was ok, not as bad as the hh sushi.  On top of that, it took forever to get the waiters attention for anything!  

Won't be coming back.... Unless to try the uni rice don to give this place one last try.
author: Lorraine W.

description:
everyone else has written everything that's worth writing so I'll keep this simple:
 - at this price point, this is absolutely 4 star sushi
 - Tuna Tataki and Toro are great calls
 - the happy hour is fantastic
 - the playlist is everything from country to pop to rap...baffling in a good way
author: Jeff F.

description: Mark the date. Yesterday was the first time I've ever walked away from a bowl of ramen. It was the spicy miso ramen with chicken(?). The noodles were somehow overdone and underdone at the same time, the broth was incohesive to the point of incomprehension, and the chicken, well, it might have been chicken at one point. I didn't bother sending it back. There was clearly no saving this bowl of noodles.
author: Jarrod S.

description: seriously people?  how are you giving this place 4 stars.  It better not be for their sushi because it is mediocre at best.  and the cooked food is just ok too.  I live in the neighborhood and tried this place a couple of times, but if I want japanese food and sushi would never go back.  for cooked food go to nojo in hayes valley or izakaya sozai in the sunset and for sushi - go to koo or akiko's or ryoko's or even the sushi nazi ichi.  pretty much anywhere else.  so mediocre
author: a g.

description:
I'm an over-the-top ramen fanatic. I've waited probably a total of 20 hours in the past year alone for the best ramen in both the South Bay (see Orenchi Ramen) and New York.

I'm floored that Kama's spicy tonkatsu ramen hasn't created more of a buzz. Maybe it's because it's in the middle of my sketchball SoMa office's hood. The broth, the eggs, the noodles, ... it all comes together perfectly.

Thank you, Kama, for giving me exceptional $9 ramen that I don't have to wait 1.5 hours for!

(Minus 1 star because I waited 25 minutes for my food during lunch on one occasion. However, the service was superb every other time.)
author: Jeena C.

description: I came here during happy hour with my family and ordered a dozen oysters, spicy tuna roll, unagi roll and yellow tail roll and dragon roll. Food was delicious!
author: Mrs. F.

description:
FAVORITE. SUSHI. EVER.

FRESH! DELICIOUS! And the service is wonderful!!

I can't stress enough though how fresh their sushi is and made with delicate care and love. I can easily compare the sushi to sushi I've had in Hawaii. 

This is my place of choice for sushi always and forever. You should give it a try! You can't go wrong!
author: V V.

description:
I've only known Kama through their delivery service but, wow, they are my go-to SF delivery sushi joint. Fresh, tasty and quick, free delivery. Brownie points for their easy online ordering system, I love being able to order for delivery without having to talk to anyone :)

Note: Also, very friendly customer service on one occasion when their online ordering service went down and lost my order, they were very apologetic and on top of getting back to me as they got more info. 

Overall, definitely recommend them as a delivery service, can't get better sushi delivered to your door :)
author: Jen P.

description: Nice sushi and great options! Service was a bit slow at times but the atmosphere was nice and chill, the fish was fresh and the no-shoes seating was adorable! I liked that we took off our shoes and crawled into the booth but it was a normal sitting booth so no cramped knees :)
author: Amy Y.

description: 2 stars = "Meh. I've experienced better." That sounds about right. I came here for lunch -- mediocre food, small portions, and slightly high prices for what you get. I HAVE heard from some friends that the sushi here is actually not bad.. Perhaps I'll come back and try it, but I just have this feeling that it definitely won't live up to my standards.
author: Kazu O.

description: I am very upset with the delivery services of kama sushi. They called me after 45 minutes of waiting to tell me that they don t deliver to my street and that i should call their other shop. I called their other shop, i have been waiting for an hour and a half and still the sushi is not here. Rude and unbelievably bad delivery service, i couldn t be more dissapointed. NEVER again!!!
author: Christina C.

description:
Sunday night around 5 and I get the inkling for some ramen. Since we were in soma I figured the other half and I could find a good spot before we headed out to the movies. Street parking was easy around this time and the place was pretty much bare except for the servers and a few people dining early as well.

(+):
-Happy hour 5-6:30pm with pretty good selections of snacks / drink, and free small hot sake with check-in
-Edamame served while you wait
-Spicy tuna roll - had a nice kick to it and at 6 pcs/order it was a good appetizer for the both of us.
-Servers came around frequently to check on us, refill waters, take plates away
-Sake. Love it. Hot or cold with or without beer.

(-):
-Tables were so close together. I could hear everyone's conversation as much as I didn't want to. Darn these super hearing abilities!
-My veggie ramen. Disappointed! The broth lacked any sort of flavor and the veggies tasted a little off. The cabbage was super soft but I was hoping for some fresh crunch to it.

The experience wasn't very memorable. But I'd be willing to come back, order some items other than ramen and see if it's any better.
author: Loriel L.

description: I've mentioned again and again that good Japanese spots are surprisingly lacking in San Francisco, but I'm somehow able to discover some hidden gems conveniently located close to me. Kama Sushi has a trendy vibe, and their food mirrors that feel. Their menu is pretty extensive, from rolls and nigiri to noodles and rice bowls. I had the tonkotsu ramen, which was some of my favorite ramen that I've had in SF. I loved that they are generous with the toppings (corn, egg, bamboo shoots, seaweed), so that you end up with a bite of topping with every bite of noodle, rather than being left with a huge chunk of noodles. Their pork was also really flavorful, and the overall dish didn't leave me as thirsty as most ramen does. We also tried the chirashi, which was beautifully presented in a bento box with generous cuts of fresh fish. The sushi rice was really good, and they do not skimp on the fish. If you're into hot sake, you get a free carafe if you check in on Yelp! I'll definitely be back for my ramen fixes and any Japanese food cravings in general.
author: Ashley T.

description: We ordered chirashi, beef skewers, shishito skewers, agedashi tofu, and uni w/ quail egg nigiri (to die for). Everything was so delicious. I can't wait to go back again. Highly recommended!
author: Christina C.

description: Sushi was really delicious and perfect texture.  REALLY SOFT!!!!! I've been looking all over for a good sushi place! This was wonderful! and no line!
author: Elaine H.

description:
The very first rule of rāmen, is that the broth must be piping hot. This rule is clearly stated in the landmark film, Tampopo, and is rather fundamental.

Here, the bowl came lukewarm at best, with the noodles themselves looking over-soaked and tired. The tonkotsu broth was adequately flavorful, but the pork was mushy and textureless.

The mushy, textureless theme also carried over to "shari" or rice. Instead of individual grains creating a structure, rice was basically a ball of glue. It's not supposed to resemble Gerber's.

The waitress kept calling the broth, "tonkatsu" instead of "tonkotsu." Tonkatsu is pork-cutlet, and tonkotsu is pork-bone (broth). Various misspellings dotted the menu on the wall, too.

To do anything decently, you have to cover the basics. Here, the food is simply hacked together by those who have no idea how they should be, or don't care. These basic errors are a marker of carelessness or indifference.
author: Anonymous M.

description: Tasty ramen (I ordered the seafood, paid the extra buck for spicy) that is priced appropriately and the free carafe of sake with a Yelp check-in was a nice little bonus.
author: Rob G.

description:
Service is prompt and polite and welcoming.

Good selection of fish, the fish is fresh, prices are reasonable, and we got a free bottle of sake for checking in on some social media app or another.
author: Julia C.

description: This place has really great sushi. We had The Rock and the Golden Dragon and they had sooo much flavor. Their service is super fast too! Definitely coming back.
author: Jess E.

description: From Florida and on vacation. Stopped in for our last meal of the trip before flying for home tomorrow! Sushi here was delicious! Staff extremely nice! I would come here again and again if I could.
author: Skip W.

description: This place is fantastic! It helped that I had purchased a Yelp deal a year ago, which made the prices very reasonable. That aside, the quality was top-notch. I came at lunch and sat down with not wait. I ordered the salmon chirashi bowl, which had both sashimi and salmon roe. With those two things you can't go really go wrong. On top of that mess of freshness, I ordered the sweet shrimp nigiri - I love raw shrimp and this is one of the few places I've found that serves it! It's great to have a go-to sushi spot in SOMA.
author: Jennifer H.

description:
KAMA? Sure why not. 

5 Stars total - 1 star for slow service - 1 star for dry overcooked edamame - 1 star for soggy pre-fried karaage + 0.5 star for good atmosphere... In the end, I'll be a good citizen and round up for a 3 star. 

Definitely not a Ramen joint. I ordered the "Lunch Special" - Karaage Chicken Ramen (+$1 for spicy, more like WTF? why?) and Avocado Roll (included, because I would never order this). Appearance was definitely good when they brought it to the table. But things like this start to get really bad if your a picky ass foodie. I tried the karaage first and almost instantly I knew it was pre-fried. Microwaved or reheated when the noodle was ready. Noodles could take a few more seconds in the hot water before meeting the broth. The broth on the other hand was pretty decent for a non-ramen joint! 

Necessary to talk about the avocado roll? Nah, i'm good! 

Service was a bit slow. I was seated quickly but the waiter also quickly forgot about me until he looked at me directly in the eye. He finally realized that no menu or water was given. oh, i wished he didn't bring the edamame, because it was dry and overcooked. 

In the end, wasn't bad to the point where I'll totally say no. But i'll come here to try something else. Maybe chirashi or sushi, or maybe nigiri.
author: Eric Y.

description: That's perfect service. The uni nigiri is so fresh when I came here every time. Anyway everything is so awesome!
author: Li S.

description: Bomb. The Sushi is great, my beautiful wife always ask for herself roll,... The HOTMOMA roll which is baked, hot and scrumptious, yep, just like my wife. Anyway, I honestly and truly enjoy the chicken and veggie Udon, wow, wow, wow!!!! If your a soup fan!!! Absolutely amazing!!! I also order, and this has to be the BEST tea in SF, it's perfectly hot in temperature and hits the spot every time before our meal to help digest properly. Service is great almost always and the vibe is pretty chill but a bit tight for a 6'1 215lb Mexican, but I've been in worse scenarios in a car full us parting with 40oz of OldE. Man..... The good ol days...
author: david g.

description: Delicious and reasonable prices!  Trying to find a sushi place in the City as a tourist is hard with so much competition. I always use yelp to help with deciding where to go and so happy it brought us to this place! Definitely recommend!  Not a huge place, so making a reservation would be suggested.
author: Kayla C.

description:
We order here mostly for delivery.  Sushi is just passable enough for a low key weeknight.  I also think it's a bit inconsistent.  When we first started ordering, it was much better, but the last time we ordered. The salmon in the salmon avocado roll was very weird. 

In any case, good for nights when you want sushi, but don't want to spend a lot of money and don't want to go out. I do not recommend you take a date here or go here for an occasion. =)
author: Li Y.

description: My girlfriend is vegetarian which makes it hard to find a restaurant that both of us like. Kama is perfect as it has a full vegetarian menu plus a full sushi menu. I tried the baked sushi and she got the veg ramen bowl. A big thumbs up! Really good tasting food and respectful servers..
author: Lakshya R.

description: Picked up lunch to go during work. There was a lot of food and it was really good. I would go back during dinner to enjoy thd whole experience. The place is nice and clean. The service was great.
author: Jeena K.

description:
Update: came back again and service and quality of food was much better. Definitely a good addition to the neighborhood..
--------//
Not bad, not amazing. Would I go again? Maybe if they run another Yelp special!
author: Jeremie H.

description:
This is from Cherylynn N.

P.S. - I contacted Emily C. about her food poisoning incident at Kama Sushi (http://www.yelp.com/biz/...). She got delivery the same night I got the runs from dinner here. A coincidence? I think not.


100% Chinese.
But, the Best "100% Chinese" Sushi place in SF, also better than J-town kind Japo-restaurants as follows:

Iso-Bune, i said OH Shit every time when i'm walkin' by here. Smell really fishy.
Bushi-Tei, its BS, isn't it?
Beni-Hana, I don't really know WTF here?
O Izakaya, this place is heading down to hell house. not good.
Mifune
Mifune Bistro
Osaka-Ya
Kushi-Tsuru
Sapporo-Ya, 100% Chinese
Fuku-Sushi, The original F-U-sushi here!
Sanppo, 100% Korean
Izumi-Ya
Iroha
Juban Yakiniku House, Totally bullshit fake BBQ place.
Mifune-Don
Kuishin-Bo, another bullshit 100% Chinese place
Mums home of Shabu Shabu, I don't know what the F?
Shabu-Sen
Kippu, new non-Japo-owner.
May's coffee shop, totally bullshit place.
Suzu, very disappointingly failing.

Thses J-town restaurants are totally BS.
And Kama-Sushi is a lot better than them.

Read my lips, "Kama-Sushi is better than most Japantown-Japanese restaurants."

Some people doesn't like me sayin' "100% Chinese" for Chinese own Japanese restaurants. But, I am not Anti-Chinese, it may sound like it, and it is true that I am Anti- Chinese Gov, only because human rights issue, also there are many rude Chinese waitresses. That's true too.
I have been sayin' that most Chinese own Japanese places are simply bad especially when it comes to Sushi because most places are not clean, but service is SUPER-Nice-Friendly, it freaks me out, and fish isn't good, and rice isn't right.

The place isn't traditional set-up, it isn't Sushi-only place like all traditional Japanese/Japanese Sushi places that I like. 

As most Chinese own Japanese restaurants, you can get almost every typical Japanese dish.
So, I dislike a place like here.
But, there is something about Kama-Sushi.
Kama Sushi is very clean. include bathroom. That's something already special and totally different than any other Chinese restaurants. 

I had Saba-Nigiri, it was lightly bbqed, it means the chef does know "Saba" is very difficult to prepare and lightly bbq get rid of smelly fishy flavor and gets nice smoky rich flavor.  

Maguro was nice cut.

Tamago was good.

I did not ask any more for Sushi because I knew after I had the 3 items, Saba, Maguro and Tamago, those 3 items are my basic Sushi to judge how the Sushi-Chef does for my first time.

The Chef, OK, Pass.

Anyone can make any Jiveass-roll and taste all the same with the red-hot sauce, BBQ ell, avocado and salmon + Maguro, what ever it is.
You don't need to be a Sushi-Chef, ANYONE CAN MAKT THE SHIT.

Why don't you put some oranges, watermelon in, and donuts, Yeah, how about donuts to go with it and deep fried? I bet you Paula Deen would love that shit.
Oh, I hate Jiveass-rolls crap!

So, i know nothing for any "Signature Rolls" in the menu.
The "Signature Rolls" means Jiveass Rolls in my Sushi dictionary.
I didn't order any of it, but I know the Chef understands the basic Nigiri that most Non-Japanese Sushi places don't.

About the Ramen.
In the menu said that:
Tonkotsu Ramen, Pork or Soy flavor.
I was like, "WTF?" because THERE IS NOT SUCH A THING IN JAPAN.
Pork or Soy flavor?
"Tonkotsu" means Tonkotsu-Flavor, period!

But, what can we do? I had the Soy flavor kind of Tonkotsu Ramen for First time.
I am pretty sure that the ramen is instant, from Japanese market, high end kind, because taste so familiar. I am sure of it.

http://www.yelp.com/biz/instant-ramen-san-francisco-2#hrid:Fiwz4tNuob4ska1-_ocI5A/src:self

But, the Chef add fresh ginger to go with the "high-end" instant Ramen's Soup. I didn't mind the Ramen because the Chashu was very good and thin sliced, egg was nicely done half cooked.
They have to make a profit and stay on the business so I understand that the Chef doesn't have enough time to get the Ramen from scratch. So using good high-end instant Ramen maybe a good idea.
It was not too bad.

The Fried Chicken was good as Popeye's! 
It was really "surprise!" kind of fried chicken. Nothing fancy but really good as real Popeye's like. I don't think it's from Popeye's. I don't care, I liked it.

Service was professional- good.
We got extended happy hour deal. that was nice!
The Kama Sushi is more like Good-Izakaya with a little bit of Sushi like place.
I think the Chef and manager are well trained, and managing very well to find what is best but keep reasonable price.
I liked it.
But,
Am I going back?
Not.
author: Nobu K.

description:
This review is for their ramen only.

In San Francisco, there are only a few places in the City that is good or worth mentioning, Katanaya, Halu, Izakaya Sozai( and I'm really stretching it by saying these restaurants are great).  My all time favorite.......................... is still Ramen Dojo.  However, we can only work with what we got in the City without having to drive 1/2 hr away to get really good ramen.

The broth was exquisite, the noodles were perfectly cooked, and the ingredients are all inclusive.  You know how some Japanese ramen houses charges you for ala cart items like corn, mushroom, egg, seaweed etc.  This place does not do that. I love that!!!!   Upon arrival of the bowl, it looked messy.  The corn, mushroom, lettuce(yes lettuce) sea weed, and the katsu chicken just looked like a pile of mess and the broth wasn't up to the level it should be in terms of broth to noodle ratio.  Presentation was somewhat lacking but they sure made up for it with taste and flavor.  They do charge an extra dollar for having it extra spicy.  

I bought the yelp deal and if you check in you get a free bottle of hot sake.  Service was attentive, food came out a little slow but I guess that's how it is on your first month in the new location.  

I would definitely come back  here for their ramen.  Plenty of parking spaces, the place felt and looked clean, service was great, price is very reasonable.

I will be back to try the sushi.  To be honest, my expectation is not too high on their sushi but they shocked me once with their Ramen.
