author: jason g.

description:
Free sake check-in coupon? Some of the best maki rolls I've ever had? 

Complementary edamame?

HELL YES!

This place was really great and I had a really good experience here. I look forward to having an excuse to be in SoMa and getting sushi again.
author: Gh S.

description:
Kama Sushi, thank you for being in my neck of SOMA.  I'm a sashimi-kind of girl myself, and this place always hits the spot. The sushi is pretty darn good, waitstaff is uber polite and responsive, location is great, free delivery, and prices are reasonable. everyone i recommend to go there comments on what a great experience they had. my only gripe is the edamame, they don't prepare it right so it's always brown and soggy and tasteless.

I love Kama Sushi and will be back soon, maybe even tonight.
author: Loralyn S.

description: My favorite place for Japanese food!!! They have the best Unagi Don ( fully covered with Unagi!)  I tired many other dishes and they never disappointed me. Staffs are always very friendly and helpful. I love this place and will be coming back a lot!
author: Debbie C.

description:
Alright so in this area of SOMA we had no sushi restaurants and this was a great idea to open up here. Thanks! 

As a (99% of the time) vegetarian, who cheats only for the occasional sushi excursion, I was pleasantly surprised how good and fresh the fish was. The decor was nice with wood paneling and a nice bar (small) that we at ate at.

Go for the happy hour 4:30-6:30 if you want a deal. My friend and I had a couple of large beers and got more than full on $40.

Definitely new staff as they were a little over-eager to take your order, clear the table, and bring you more drinks, etc. but I'm sure once they get busier they'll not hover as much.
author: J. S.

description:
What a delicious menu! We visited the first week it has opened and it was all great! They had provided us with some freebies.
We ended up leaving 30+% tips
author: Andy M.

description:
Hot Mama.

Don't miss the titular roll. Filled with crab, topped with salmon and a spicy but not to spicy dressing. Loved.

Not as much love for the Veggie Lover.

Expected a roll. Received a platter of asparagus, eggplant, mushroom and zucchini. Ponzu sauce in the middle.

Individually nice. Collectively meh.

Complimentary edamame was appreciated and devoured. Soybeans were soft and delicious.

Arrived just before closing and service was as prompt as you can get. Didn't feel rushed. More akin to being kept on schedule.

Overplayed '80s music did not add to the otherwise contemporary design. Shame.

Be sure to mind your Mama.
author: Jason B.

description: Yummy rolls and ramen. Great for take-out because they know how to pack everything! Fun atmosphere and these "Japanese-style" (sort of) booths for big groups. Love hitting this place up with a big group from work after a long day.
author: Brittany F.

description: Finally a sushi place that makes great quality sushi! We had the tempura udon which was delicious, the tempura was light and not empowering the veggies and shrimp; we also got the hot mama and autumn roles which were also delicious! I plan on coming back often!
author: Sherry F.

description:
This review is for sushi delivered from the SOMA restaurant to Mission Bay.   In terms of delivery sushi, it was perfectly acceptable.  We ordered the spicy hamachi roll, spicy tuna roll, the Boston roll, the Pyramid and a few nigiri.  Nothing blew our minds, but everything was at least average.   The nigiri was probably the least inspiring (maguro and tamago), while the pyramid and Boston rolls were the best.   

I found the phone service and delivery to be prompt and respectful and thought they made a good effort to think about the customer (double checking card and phone numbers, etc.).

Will likely order delivery from here again, but it's not so good that we would want to dine in.
author: Gary C.

description: You get free sake and the sushi was awesome for a reasonable price. Its a small place but good for date night.
author: Nan T.

description:
Yum Yum!!!
I got the Chicken Karaage Ramen with the Pork soup base + spicy. The soup was not too over powering yet very flavorful. The lettuce is great with the spicy soup. The noodles was served perfectly al dente. 

We also ordered the Aji sashimi which was fresh and no fishy taste at all. The Sake something nigiri that you eat with no soy sauce was wonderful. The Grilled Toro Roll was delish!

Most definitely a place I will go to again!
author: Linda L.

description: You can easily walk into this place and have a great, reasonably priced meal. The free sake upon check-in is a plus! The service is very quick and attentive.
author: Maryam A.

description: Very good happy hour menu, and great food for the price.  They offer a variety of options from sushi to ramen, and contrary to other similar places, every item I tried was decently good.  Only came here for a quick hh dinner but would definitely return for another meal.
author: Josh Q.

description: Great service. Great food. Nice ambiance. KAMA is reasonably priced for SF. Serving size is ample. They also have lunch specials on the weeked. The food is fresh and tasty. I will definitely be back and highly recommend if you are in the area and are in the mood for sushi. Also if you check in you get a free hot sake.
author: Brandi R.

description:
The service is right off the bat - excellent.  Very friendly welcoming and friendly staff.  

The sushi was very fresh and really was more like and upscale place.  Tasty and great presentation.

The beer selection however is slim but there are a variation of saki's, wines and Soju drinks.

All around a great experience and will come back since I live in the hood.
author: Martin S.

description: I love this place. It's right up the street from me, it's fresh, delicious & affordable for lunch. I love the squid teriyaki & the toro sake sashimi.
author: Gelina A.

description:
Stopped in with the co-worker for lunch. It is on the left hand corner of 9th and Folsom so for parking considerations be aware of the one way streets there. 

We were geeted warmly by a server when we walked in. There is no hostess area so don't feel awkward about standing in the middle of the resturant waiting to be sat. 

Price range is reasonable for the city. Expect around 12 dollars a roll 14 dollars for the lunches and ramens. 

I looooved this place because they do no over load the rolls with rice, use real wasabi, do not dye their ginger, and use fresh fresh fish. When the salmon basically melts in your mouth you know you are getting a good piece of meat. The decor was alos nice without being garish or too plain. I think there was another room but I didn't walk into that area of the resturant. Was relativly busy at lunch time but we didn't feel like we had a "wait" for anything.

Hands down best miso I have had to date as well. I would return just for the miso.  I would highly reccomend the C27 roll for anyone who likes salmon and scallops.
author: Meg N.

description: I only give this place 3 stars instead of 2 because the service was good and we got the free hot sake with our Yelp check-in. The decor is nice too. The food was nothing special. My salmon and toro weren't as great as I'd hoped they'd be. They should melt in your mouth. They were a little chewy. I didn't even want my last piece of salmon. That should never happen. I would go somewhere else next time.
author: Adrianna A.

description: Have always been a fan to their Church st. location. Excited that they are opening up in SOMA where my company is. Very impressed with the interior design and atmosphere. Friendly, speedy service. Most important of all, GREAT food. One of the signature rolls, Crunchy Lobster (14.95), is our favorite -- a roll made with lobster, salmon, and avocado hidden in crunchy flakes made by tempura batter. Must have! We also tried the grilled whole squid. Very tasty. I was even impressed by the complementary edamame -- if you've ever try boiling edamame yourself you know how easy it is to overcook -- but those they served here were just done right, not over, not under; and the taste of salt was just right, not over, not under. The best edamame I've ever had. Thumbs up to Kama to attend to even such trivial details. My pictures will speak more.
author: Mei P.

description: This is a great spot for a casual but quality sushi meal. Great happy hour. Fish is good quality for a casual spot. Fresh and tasty. Plenty to drink. Count me in.
author: Dale S.

description:
Kama Sushi! Oh my. I am so glad I was craving ramen and I am so glad that Yelp led my girlfriend and me to your establishment!! Definitely a good choice.

Let's talk about the pros:
+ There was a Yelp deal ($10 for a $20 voucher) going on for this place (awesome. snagged one right as we walked in). Basically gave us the food half off. 
+ You get one free hot sake for just checking into Yelp. EXTRA BROWNIE POINTS!
+ Ramen was delicious (not too flavorful and overpowering, but just right. I recommend the Tonkotsu with soy broth). Also, EXCELLENT price for just $8 each bowl.
+ Complimentary edamame is a good free treat for when you're drinking sake and starting to get munchies. (Maybe I was just super hungry)
+ Staff was friendly
+ The "specials" for sushi they have are all on the board at the sushi bar and not in the menu. These specials are supposedly all Kama Sushi originals and have their own twist. I HIGHLY recommend trying some of these. We tried a couple and they were both incredibly delicious. (I forget what they are called, sorry.) The waiter suggested them for us, so you can ask for suggestions!

Cons:
- Good sushi adds up in cost. Beware if you're coming here for sushi only. There are better places for loading up on sushi. 
- Really don't have many cons here... haha. The yelp deals really added so much sugar on this deal.


RECOMMENDATION:
Get a bowl of ramen (tonkotsu with soy broth) and then one or two of the specials on the sushi board at the sushi bar. You won't regret it. The ramen will fill you up and the sushi will be yummy treats for your taste palette to savor. Make sure to check in on Yelp and if the Yelp deal is still active, to get it.
author: Mitty C.

description:
This place is good to go to if you want to satisfy your Japanese food cravings. My biggest gripe is that if you know good sushi, average sushi just doesn't cut it anymore--and the quality of fish here is average. 

Best dish: I normally just get the dinner set
Food: 3.5/5 stars
Ambiance: Fun
Price: 20/person 
Service: Good
author: Kevi L.

description: I'm giddy that this place is so close and delivers.  My first dinner here was not only satisfying but left me excited.  Just the mere thought of ordering everything from Ramen to grilled Hamachi collar delivered to my door gave me a mischievous smirk.  It is moments like this that showcase how deprived my suburban living friends are.
author: Darin E.

description: Everythings are delicious. I like the Beef Teriyaki and Donkatsu.. These meats are melting inside my mouth. I'm confidence to suggest here to others as the one of the most delicious Japanese restaurant in SOMA. Price is not so cheap tho..
author: Bum P.

description:
Kama Sushi has really good service.

I came here for lunch on a weekday and the restaurant gets a fair amount of lunch goers. There are a few lunch specials to take advantage of.

As soon as I was seated, I was given a glass of water and a side of edamame to munch on. I ordered the Chicken Karaage Ramen which came with a roll of avocado sushi. The food was decent.

I recommend this place for their lunch specials and great service.
author: Jenny T.

description:
Beautiful restaurant. 
But the nori in my rolls was really chewy
author: Rachel G.

description:
Went here for lunch today with some friends. I ordered the veggie ramen with avocado maki. We scored a free large hot sake because I checked in on Yelp.

The ramen was fine but not good or great. The broth was well balanced, the noodles were mediocre. I paid an extra dollar for "spicy" and it was not spicy at all. There was nary a drop of chili oil or a fleck of spice in it. It came with two fried veggie potstickers which were not good. The avocado maki was as expected.

The hot sake was so gross we couldn't drink it. Thank goodness it was free.

The service was dismal. It took forever to get seated even though there were open tables, took forever to get our food, they forgot our drinks (I had to ask after our food started coming out), never once refilled our water, and we waited forever for our check and to pay. Others in the restaurant were showing similar frustration. 

Maybe the meat-flavored ramen is better here but I will probably not be returning because the service is just so bad.
author: Tala D.

description:
Been here twice and enjoyed it both times. The service was great. The price was good (Yelp coupon helped), and the food was tasty.

There are a ton of sushi restaurants in this city. It seems like they are either super pricey, small, and good or cheap, dingy, and bleh. The super pricey good places often leave me bored. Sashimi sake toro is incredible. But it takes no imagination. I really appreciate a sushi restaurant  that goes above and beyond to create unique dishes. A sushi chef has a lot of license in creating new and unique sushi rolls. So when the same old spider roll and dynamite roll show up (whether named as such or some local sports team) I am disappointed. Luckily Kama Sushi has a bunch of rolls that really interested me. And while not all were the perfect balance of flavors that I would expect from Umami or Nihon, I have never left a single bite on my plate. And plenty of rolls I scarfed down.

So I highly recommend you check this place out. It wasn't crowded, it was clean, food was tasty, and the service was great.
author: Ben V.

description: So good! Check in to get a free bottle of sake!! Have to go back here! Everything was made quick to order and tasted delicious!
author: Julia D.

description:
I have to say... after experiencing the service and food at the location on Church street, this location was an utter disappointment.

First, we arrived around 9:30 on a Friday night.  I know that's a bit late, but I had just gotten off work and a girl's gotta eat, yo!   We weren't seated right away because it was pretty packed.  No big deal--usually that's a good sign, right?  hmmm, yeah right.

When we were finally shown to our table we asked if we could get hot saki.  We were told that they stop serving alcohol at 9PM. Say wha..?  I'm sure that's not by choice, but really?  Anyway, okay, we'll settle for tea.  BUT, it never came..  I would have asked again but our server just disappeared...??

We waited...and waited ......and waited... 20 mins later, just before we were going to get up and walk out, a different server came to take our order.  Did the other server get off and forget to tell her replacement that there was a table waiting??  No one glanced our way to noticed we hadn't been helped?  I couldn't even make eye contact to get anyone's attention.  C'mon guys...

The food was just okay... I had one of the specialty rolls, the Fujimoto I think?  It was forgettable.  I also ordered the salmon tower and there were little bits of tin foil stuck on the fish (I know you're thinking "um, it was probably skin!"  No. No, it wasn't.).  Have you ever accidently chewed on tin foil?  Crrringgge... my teeth hurt just thinking about it.  I was so disappointed because that was my fav dish at the other location.  

We might have enjoyed it more but the service was so abissmal it put a bad taste in my mouth.  And I had NO sake to wash it away. boo.

The sashimi my boyfriend ordered was really fresh and tasty, so I'll give them that...+1 star

Sorry but I won't be giving this place another try when I can go to the Noe Valley location and recieve better service.  I know it's relatively new, and everyone else has been giving glowing reviews, so maybe they just need to work out the kinks... I really do want to give them more stars since I like the other one so much... :/
author: Olivia D.

description: Beef skewers were very good. Lobster roll was a little too heavy with all the creamy sauces on top. The crunchy stuff was a little saggy. Friendly staff, although we had to wait longer for someone to get the order, and that only after calling the waitress..
author: Manal C.

description:
This is one of my favorite spots in SF...the sushi is unique and delicious, the poeple are fantastic and it's great to finally have a neighborhood spot for good sushi.  

I actually went there 3 times in one week..I'm hooked.
author: Daniel D.

description: This is by far my most favorite place to go to for Happy Hour Sushi. The albacore tataki is an always must order and the agadashi tofu satisfies me every time. I also love the yelp deals that they have. Every time I've been there, they have a free bottle of hot sake deal when you check in with Yelp. Try their happy hour, you won't regret it.
author: Marlene T.

description: I wanted to like it.  Really I did.  But ... alas ... I got SOOOOOO sick after eating here I can't even remember what the sushi tasted like.
author: Mihae T.

description: The Lobster Roll was amazing; everyone had a great meal and the server was attentive and friendly. Wished we could have been seated at the larger space near us as our lighting was glaring over the table; we were told it (and one other) was reserved for a (potentially) slightly larger group but no one arrived during the time we were there (for our 8:00 reservation and we stayed for well over an hour). We suggest the owners figure out a way to soften the overhead lighting in the booths as everyone in our party commented on it negatively. I hope  to return to this lovely place as the menu is extensive, creative and reasonably priced. Was surprised by the food safety warning attached to this restaurant; but we all survived nicely!
author: Pamela S.

description: If I would give kama sushi more than 5 star , I would! Love the ambiance here.  Wonderful decoration and love them sushi here!! The services is super fast and attentive.  Will definitely repeat.
author: Kitye L.

description: Just moved to SF and we found our place! Fresh and delicious, great service, and amazing atmosphere.
author: Ryan E.

description: I went for lunch and had the sushi special. The sushi was well prepared and tasted delicious. The staff was friendly and fast, overall it was a good and reasonably priced lunch.
author: Tom V.

description:
Great food and that's not all. The prices were reasonable for Sushi/Japanese/Asian food.

I came in here with my date and I was glad I did. We both loved the place. Waitress welcomed us with a big smile. We ordered maybe four kinds of food including sushi. We also got four glasses of beer as well and guess what? The total bill was only 16 dollars! because I got the Yelp deal! 

Awesome food at value price! I will definitely come back.
author: Joe K.

description: Wow, i have live in soma for 5 years now. I never hear any good sushi place around that area. Until one day my friend from east bay telling me we are going to meet there for a dinner. I was like "are you sure soma", but i will try it out since so close to my house anyway. The first step when i walked in the restaurant i already feeling i have a regret( why don't i know this place sooner). Food i will give 4.5 stars, service 5 stars, decoration 4.5. So it turn out above 4.5 stars and it is my first review at yelp. Go check them out.
author: Teresa Z.

description:
Very happy Kama Sushi moved in to the neighborhood. The food is excellent, and we really didn't have any good sushi places in the area. 

To start with: complimentary edamame! And it's /good/ -- not overly salted, very tasty. The miso soup is excellent and the bowls are nice and big. The sushi is fresh and beautifully made (the Autumn roll was a very creative surprise), and the Dinner Box is a great basic meal. The service was excellent -- very friendly.

Can't wait to go back.
author: H. P.

description:
This place is much bigger than it looks from the inside and was only half-full on a Wednesday evening. It's located in a sketchy part of SOMA but there was plenty of parking street just outside.

This is what we ordered
Albacore tataki- this was my favorite
Soft shell crab- meh
Gyoza- already room temp when it got to our table
Crunchy lobster roll- what they are known for but I thought it was mediocre
Beef curry over rice- pretty tasty and beef steaks were not overdone
Due to happy hour appetizer and booze specials before 7, our sake and beer was pretty inexpensive. Get a free small sake if you check in!

Service was alright and kitchen was quick to prepare food.

Bottom line: there are many better options for japanese food in other areas of SF
author: Alfred L.

description: Oh my god. I love this place. The sushi is insane and the people are so nice. And the seating arrangement is so cool!
author: Mark M.

description: Delivery took 1hr50min; sushi does not last two hours in a car. Normally I tip over 20% but I'm sorry to say yall lost out. The food was delicious though, crazy good rainbow roll and hamachi.
author: Ben C.

description: A good sushi spot on the Folsom block nice seating and great service. The food was good and they have happy hour as well. The only problem that it was a  bit pricy but the food sure was worth it!
author: Ahrmon R.

description:
This is some of the best sushi I've had in a while, and this is comparing to many highly rated, more expensive spots in the area.  

VERY impressed with the quality of fish, and the service was exceptional as well.  

Easy 5 stars.
author: Charles A.

description:
The service was fine, but  the food was terrible.
The gyoza (potstickers) were awful, like those cheap frozen ones you buy at supermarkets. The agedashi tofu tasted unfresh and stale.
I felt bad after eating here, not coming back.
author: Nathalie K.

description:
I've been to Kama two times now. The first time was almost a year ago and I had a good experience. No wait, good service, good food. 

I came back a second time today and their happy hour prices drove me here. It's a really good deal ($4.95 apps, $3.45 nigiri) and the selections are plentiful. I'm a huge fan of The One Sushi in Hayes Valley which has comparably priced items for their happy hour. 

The food this time was just ok. We got the albacore tataki (good), vegetable tempura (good but the veggie selection was limited), tuna poki (just ok. Really salty and didn't finish it; poki at The One is much better), spicy tuna roll (good), ika karage (soggy, greasy but the dipping sauce was tasty), and some nigiri (sake, hamachi, walu). The walu was nice to see on a happy hour menu and was cut well. 

The food was good but not great. I wouldn't be opposed to coming here again with a group but I wouldn't suggest it as a great place for sushi in the city. For now, The One Sushi reigns supreme for sushi happy hour at a really low price. 

But if you're looking for good priced sushi in this area of soma you'll be ok going here.
author: James G.

description: This was my first time here. I looked up a sushi place in soma and decided to drop in. Glad I did. I had the C27 roll, and Walu nigiri. Both were insane. The Walu melted in my mouth. I'll def be back
author: Jamie D.

description:
I got take-away sushi last night and was pleasantly surprised. I am SO HAPPY there is a decent sushi place 1 block from my home. No more bad take-out sushi from Whole Foods (little dance) :-)

Everything I ordered was fresh and well made. I ordered Walu, Maguro and Kampachi Sashimi as well as a few maki and hand rolls. In addition, the Kama Hama
(Thinly sliced yellowtail w/cucumber, lemon zest, shiso leaf in house dressing) was excellent and I will be getting it again. 

They even sneaked in a bonus roll with ume plum - which is my favorite. Thanks guys! :-)

Keep up the good work and see you soon Kama Sushi.
author: Maïa Cybelle C.

description:
You get to check in this place and get free sake so dont forget to check in (1st time only). 

So I came here twice.  My first time I got the chicken udon which was really good but the second time I got the Chirasi which I did not really like much. 

service was ok but a little slow during the lunch rush.  Prices are good for SF.
author: sonya h.

description: Fuji Yama for takeout. Surprisingly wonderful! Really great sushi rolls. Fresh, well-prepared, and some creative menu options!
author: Jordan J.

description: The stop serving booze after 9 p.m., so we were pretty much the last people in.  Best service ever. . . and man was the sushi good too.  We order 8 different rolls to share amongst 6 people, plus two appetizers and it ended up costing us $20 per person including tip.  I was rather impressed.  The place had great decor, atmosphere and the food was awesome.  My favorite was the spicy scallop roll.  We order the Hot Mama, Veggie Dragon roll, the  pyramid, 49er and much more.  All were great.  And if you check in with your yelp, you get a free small sake.  So make sure to check them out.  Corner of 9th and Folsom. . .
author: Janice F.

description: Great SOMA Sushi joint, ask for the specials, and order the Omekase (Chef's Choice), Ramen is good too!
author: Frederic B.

description:
I ordered a Tonkatsu ramen and when asked if I wanted it spicy I said I want it mild.  The ramen came covered in spicy red pepper flakes.  I tried to eat it anyways since I was too hungry to wait for a new one.  However the broth itself was not flavorful and the pork slices made my stomach queasy.  I think the pork was old and the broth was just too bland to be a Tonkatsu ramen.  

Also I noticed the 75 health score rating before dining in, but didn't think about it until we sat down and noticed that our table was sticky and had pieces of food on it. These are all red flags on how they care about their restaurant and customers. I still feel queasy a day after.
author: dublin a.

description:
Dance party for your stomach...In an amazing way, of course. If the festive decor doesn't get you moving, the delicious menu items definitely will!

You can't go wrong with the curry udon...My goodness, it is like a perfectly balanced pillow of spices on my tongue. Be sure to order the fried green tea ice cream to top off your meal and then rejoice when the bill comes out to be wayyyy less than you expected :)
author: Reis H.

description: Excellent hamachi Kama and miso! Free green tea. Nice ambiance, we come here all the time. I'm going to be mayor soon.
author: Joann K.

description: SO GOOD. delicious sushi and a huge selection of entrees. The sake though, omg. Fantastic selection of cold sake that is very reasonably priced. Staff are always friendly and quick!
author: Zana L.

description:
I work within walking distance of Kama, so I decided to try it out today for lunch with a friend. I ordered the Foxy roll, and she ordered the lunch special bento box with spicy tuna and another simple roll.

Both of our meals were not very appetizing. My hamachi was pretty gross. You could tell just by looking at it that is was not fresh at all. I had to pick a couple pieces off because they just looked inedible. She didn't even touch her spicy tuna, the fish also looked, off. 

The service was OK, a little slow for such a small place. 

All in all, I will not eat here again, which is too bad because there aren't that many places within such a short walking distance to my office!
author: Erin R.

description:
The sushis are delicious! The products are clearly super fresh!!

The service is not as good: he forgot to serve 2 of my friends...
author: Philippe M.

description: Food is good, quality of the fish is good as well. For a neighborhood sushi place, it works well for us. I wouldn't consider this a 'must visit' place, but I certainly wouldn't turn it down if you're in the area.
author: Garrett B.

description:
GREAT PLACE! Neighborhood in SOMA.  
Fresh, and good qualiy sushi! Friendly people and speedy services! Great coupon for Yelper! I will come back again and try different food later!
author: Jaimie K.

description: It's ai'te...pretty nice interior at a slightly more rough part of SOMA. Food is A-OK!
author: Thomas C.

description:
This place was the highlight of a weekend trip to San Francisco. In a sea of overpriced mediocrity, we found this gem of affordability, great food and excellent service. Their menu is expansive, their cuisine authentic, and their staff impeccable. We never wanted for service or water (the cucumber water was a very nice touch), but never felt harassed or rushed. The balance of fish and rice in their sushi was perfect.

Between happy hour and the $10 off yelp deal, my friend and I had sake, sushi (two rolls and two pairs of nigiri), appetizers (x2), and fried green tea ice cream for $35 before tip. By far the best dining experience I had in the city.

I look forward to going back next time I get up to San Francisco.
author: Allison N.

description:
Wow. And not in a good way. I placed an order for delivery on Eat24 2 hours and 40 mins ago and my order is still not here. I get that it's Friday night and restaurants are busy, but this is absolutely ridiculous by any standard - esp. when you are ordering $70 worth of food.

When my husband first called to inquire about the status of our order, the woman on the phone said it's "10 mins away". That was about 40 mins ago. When I just called, the woman apologized and said she would "give me 10% off my next order."  Seriously?  1) There won't be a next order after this ridiculousness and 2) 10% off was  just as insulting as the half-assed apology we got after 2 hours and 45 mins of waiting.

The food is actually good, but if you are ordering for delivery and would like to eat relatively soon, I would pass. At this point, we could have walked over to the restaurant, ordered, eaten and come back before our delivery ever arrived.
author: Samantha S.

description: We decided to have a quick bite to eat before headed over to Foundry. The happy hour menu was perfect to tide us over for the night. We had the gyoza, chicken karage,  along with a roll. Prompt service that was very nice about making sure we got out orders in before HH ended, and very accommodating since we were in a bit of a rush.
author: Shauna S.

description:
A great place to come for casual dinning or a relatively medium sized party (5-7). Chair and bench seating.

Great service and helpful servers give good insight if you are curious about any of the specials. Kind enough to let us know if we wanted to order anything else before happy hour ended.

Food was very good.  Serving size and portions were appropriate and satisfying. Oysters were on a small side but good.  Nigiri was almost like sashimi because of very little rice under each cut.  No complaints. Sashimi was fantastic. Great cuts and fairly fresh.  Only saba nigiri was a little fishy but that is to be expected of that type of fish in my experience. Personally, I like it very much.

Be sure to get a house hot sake.  It goes very well with the food and warms your stomach just like tequila before you start on your entrees.

Bring a date here.
author: Alejandro A.

description:
My go to restaurant when I don't know what to eat. It's close to my apartment and has a wide variety of Japanese food.

The sushi here is pretty good and it is a good deal at happy hour. The donburis are really good and include some nice big pieces of mushroom and onions with the eggs. 

Need to try the curry and ramen the next time I go here.
author: David N.

description: I think this place is pretty good for the price you pay for.  Good sashimi quality, not long wait, free hot bottle of sake with check in, good service.  I'd definitely come back again for dinner or what not if I'm going out around this area.
author: Stephanie C.

description:
So glad to have a legit sushi option near work!  Lunchtime seem so much brighter now. I've tried the lunch combo (tempura and grilled squid for me), the lobter roll, amaebi, and the sushi lunch special. All were yummm!
However, I got a headache after eating their ramen....not sure if it's related, but could it be monosodium glutamate?
author: Jonsey B.

description:
This is close to work for me so great location-wise.  I don't think i'd travel out of my way to get here though.

Sushi is fresh.  Ambiance is cute.  The only major downfall for me are the special rolls.  Everything seems to have a deep fried or cooked component.  Why?
author: Brian M.

description: Dynamite roll was really good. I d recommend that and the bacon wrapped Mochi, but all their skewers are amazing. Plus The service is good! I'd recommend this place. :)
author: Nancy P.

description: service is great! portions are big. I recommend the seasonal uni if you see it on the specials.
author: Kevin L.

description:
SOMA SUSHI THAT'S ON POINT! 

First off, easy location (9th & Folsom) on the corner. No problem finding parking. At first I thought the place was empty since I didn't see a single sole looking through the window, only to realize that if I walked down a little, the primary entrance was totally packed. Guess that was the 2nd room for overflow. 

Next, the menu choices were great. Nice variety of rolls plus the standards. Now I'm not one for all the extra sauces as it masks the taste of the fish. Also, I was so happy to not find cream cheese and cucumber in every f*%king roll. THANK YOU. 

Next, quality. I went on a Sat night and the fish was super fresh and flavorful. I made sure to get the Miso Sea Bass hot appy, and it was awesome. Portions were nice. The Walu, Hamachi, Maguro tuna, Unagi... all solid! Oh... loved loved loved the "AgeDashi" Tofu hot appy. Very subtle but a perfect complement to an assortment of fish. 

Next, price. For the quality of the fish/rolls, I don't think you can beat it in the SOMA neighborhood. If you really want to know, hit the on-line menu for reference. 

http://order.zonicordering.com/?str=kama-sushi-soma-san-francisco

Service.. even with the place packed, our server was attentive and friendly. I didn't have to wait for my beer... nuff said. 

My "only" comment is that the lighting inside was not conducive to reading the menu which was printed with a red font. Had to use my cell phone for added light. So if you looking for a place with more ambiance, this ain't it. It's simple, clean, easy. 

I've been to over 20 sushi spots in San Francisco alone, and this place is the first one in a very long time that evoked such a great overall 1st impression. Looking forward to my next visit.
author: Sen-Sei S.

description: Just got here for dinner. Open sign is on but the restaurant is closed and the interior is all disheveled.
author: Katie M.

description:
Great food. The server messed up our order but made up for it in spades with a free roll and clam miso soup. We used a yelp offer $10 for $20. And the prices were already great to begin with. The hamachi carpaciao was excellent.
-Dan
author: Daniel C.

description:
Great average sushi spot that won't break the bank.  
Clean, nice decor, great service.


Get:
Ikura - They marinate it so it is sweet and delicious.
Free Sake with yelp check-in.
Sushi on the board.

Cons:
Their higher end Sakes are a little over priced.  The carafe is a tiny little thing, so make sure you know how much you getting before you order.


I've only ever eaten sushi here so i don't know how the other food is.
author: Steven F.

description:
Finally, we have a restaurant worth patronizing on the corner of 9th & Folsom.  Yay!!!

I was impressed at the quality of their food, menu prices, and the staff was very courteous.  Welcome to SOMA, Kama Sushi!
author: Rocky D.

description:
these guys were amazing and the food was great. such a gracious and attentive staff. oh did i mention one of the people in our party was over an hour late? the host and hostess took such good care of us and never made us feel bad about waiting. 

oh my god and that dragon roll? like heaven. I could have died happily after that meal.
author: Bekke S.

description:
Free sake with check in on yelp!

I got the spicy Tonkatsu Ramen lunch special and I was very satisfied.  The broth was delicious & I loved the seaweed & kim chi in the soup. the lunch special also came with a cucumber roll. very refreshing but I was pretty stuffed after my ramen.

the place is pretty small so try to beat the lunch rush!
author: Lisa N.

description:
Yay, free sake at check in!  

It was my first time here and I was surprised that despite the huge variety of foods on the menu, the prices were actually pretty good! 

We started with oysters on a half shell with ponzu sauce (6 for 8.95) and lamb chops.  The lamb was succulent, juicy with just the right amount of red inside. Mixed nigiri was good, but the unagi was SOOOO tender. I could have just eaten that alone for dinner...!

Lobster salad looked like a volcano and tasted pretty good, though I felt like I obliterated any burning of calories I may have done that day... it's a pretty indulgent dish.  

If in the area, I'd totally return. It's just like Naked Fish, a favorite spot of mine, in the Marina, but less expensive without sacrificing quality.  

Staff was super nice!!! Our waitress was SO cute and sweet! 

The sashimi dinner (donburi?) was BEAUTIFUL. It looked like it came right out of the stalls in Tsukiji.
author: Annie W.

description:
I came here last Tuesday night after buying a certificate from restaurant.com (and also because of their proximity to the War Memorial Opera House where I had a performance to watch that evening). This is a sister restaurant to the one on Church Street in Noe Valley where I've eaten before, so I have some familiarity with their quality.

The experience here was just as good. The sashimi was very good quality and fulfilling. The servers were very nice and attentive, often coming by to refill your water and such. They also currently have Yelp check-in offer for a free small hot sake, and they honored mine even though I was redeeming a certificate.

They're definitely worth returning to, especially if you can get a certificate from the restaurant.com website. When I ordered mine last week, it was the last $25 offer they had for the period.
author: H K.

description: Brought a client here today, and he was impressed with their sushi, ordered: Rainbow roll, 49er roll, Tamago and Unagi, we literally devoured everything; definitely coming back, and referring this place to friends/family!
author: Shane S.

description: Happy that there is a near sushi place in the neighborhood. Now when I'm craving some Japanese, I can just head to Kama!
author: Theresa D.

description: Fresh, tasty sushi. Tonkotsu ramen is delicious and satisfying. Perfect broth, not a lot of pork, but lots of other goodies. Super happy to have found this place near my apartment.
author: Lauren D.

description: I have been craving some authentic Ramen and found this place on yelp. So we went today to see how good it was.  I can say that it really hit the spot!!  We even got there during happy hour and that was a treat. We even checked in on yelp and got a free small hot sake on the house. The staff were all very nice and attentive to anything that we needed.  Thumbs up for this establishment.  Oh ya the sushi was great too!!
author: Jay S.

description: I just ordered delivery and it was TERRIBLE. The worst Cali roll I have ever had (too mayo-y, had shells in it and not a good taste), ice cold and un-salted edamame, overly fishy seared tuna roll and seaweed salad that was dripping in sauce. I would NOT recommend this place for anything other than it's fast delivery.
author: Casey H.

description: Proper sushi w/ free sake. Their ramen bowls are good too.
author: Nathan B.

description: Sushi is decent, but not anything out of the ordinary.  The warm sushi rolls are a little weird to eat.  Service is very friendly.  The ikura quail egg nirigi here is pretty good.
author: Robyn F.

description: Good sushi  good service.  Better than average fish and they deliver, and have great hours.  They can't service alcohol after nine pm which is a bummer but I guess some of the local bars complained that the were taking business ????
author: jeff c.

description:
Great sushi - especially for the price. Super affordable but not like most cheaper sushi that's stuffed with cream cheese.

Tastes like it should cost much more. Stick to their chalk board of special sashimi if you want the best in the house.

Outstanding service, repeat customer, so consistent
author: Alex P.

description:
Excellent sushi and phenomenal service.

My friends and I have been patrons of Kama Sushi SOMA since last year and dine there at least once a week.  The food is delicious (A+ quality) and reasonably priced (for sushi).

It is also conveniently located near Civic Center and the easy parking is a major plus.

I recommend Kama Sushi without reservation to any sushi (or food) lover.
author: Rosanna L.

description: Tonight was my 2nd time ordering delivery. The 1st time the food was decent (gyoza & tempura udon- good, mochi skewers - greasy and gross) and hot. This time everything was bad and ice cold - veggie gyoza was weird tasting, beef skewers were super fatty, panko shrimp were not cleaned so there was big nasty black streaks on the top and they forgot my coke. Not a good experience for $30+
author: Jennifer A.

description: Great sushi at affordable prices.
author: Mark S.

description: Came here while on a vacation to see some friends. We weren't greeted which isn't a huge deal, its just nice to be acknowledged when you walk into a restaurant. We were seated in the second larger room even though there was room in the front and were literally the only ones in that room the whole time. The service was absolutely horrible. Once we got our food, our waitress went M.I.A. but was occasionally spotted socializing with her coworkers and helping other customers in the front room. Didn't end up ordering more sushi because it took about 30 minutes to even get her attention. The sushi was pretty good but the terrible service ruined the experience.
author: Jade T.

description:
New sushi location and my boyfriend and I came here since he snagged a few restaurant.com deals.

Ambiance and service was pretty good, and the food wasn't bad. I ordered an Unagi-don and a Hot Papa roll while the boyfriend order a Tonkatsu Ramen(? i don't remember haha) and the Crunchy Lobster roll. 

My unagi-don wasn't bad, but the portions of eel could've been better. The tonkatsu ramen was pretty good too, better than many not solely ramen places. Also had no complaints about their crunchy lobster roll, but I was pretty disappointed with their Hot Papa. I know its baked, but the tuna was way too overcooked and I didn't enjoy that texture. Don't think I'll be ordering that roll again.

The happy hour menu doesn't apply to the restaurant.com deal, but the prices looked pretty cheap (~$5 a roll) with a pretty wide selection, so you can bet we'll pop by again for happy hours once in a while.
author: Harriet W.

description:
My fiancé and I are both a big fan of Japanese food. We often eat out for Japanese food 2 -3 times/week ( at least ) We have heard of this place so we thought let's give it a try.  We went there last night,  we were there around almost 9 and the restaurant wasn't busy. The server put us into a small table (table for 2) It seems like they really be crumbs about the chair. If you only 2, you won't be able to get a bigger table. 
The reason I mentions about this because we always order a lots of dishes, and we both know that it won't be enough space for us to put other stuff.

I asked the server about the drink menu, but she said to me that we are just stop serving alcohol (but wait...It's only 9 pm?) I asked her again why..she said we don't have license. That made me confused...Don't get me wrong I am not american born here so English is not my first language too but for what I talked with her...It's really confused. Later on, we were be able to order hot sake...Yahoo...yum yum with sushi.

However, our foods were really good but they came into really small portion ( like sushi or nigari) We got another service from another server, this person was poor service though. She tried to make everything quick even though I was still eating my soup but she almost took it away from me. And when the bill came, we showed her a coupon to her through the phone. She did click something on the phone very quickly and the code was gone. I told her It wasn't our mistake but she wasn't happy though.

Anyway, all I can say is 3 stars for overall.  I had a better experience real Japanese food than this place.
author: Sasitorn O.

description: Great value! Go during their happy hour (4:30-6:30), checkin and get free hot sake and buy the yelp deal ($20 for $10). Ate like kings and a mere $14!!!
author: Wendy W.

description: Great ambiance and great food with the right company you can't go wrong at this place.
author: Lloyd M.

description:
1.  it states they open at 5pm...they didn't open exactly at 5pm and we and other patrons waited outside until they opened.

2.  For just opening, I don't understand why there would be crumbs on the chair.

3.  A plus is that they kept our water glasses filled and attentive to that....but our waiter took forever to check up on us.  We were done with our meals a good 1/2 hour before she even came back to say if we were finished.  Then we had to ask for the dessert menu.

4.  Seafood, granted was fresh, but not the most greatest or unique that I can only have it here.  With such a variety of sushi places in San Francisco, it doesn't rival other places.

It would have been a good experience where I would frequent it if in the neighborhood or for future sushi cravings, but the service is what makes it lack luster and desire to return.

When you are the first one in the restaurant and other people are coming and leaving before you - there is a problem. We only ordered oysters on a half shell, amaebi, uni nigiri, and 2 other rolls....those came out timely, but seemed like we were forgotten after our food came.

I see other reviews said attentive service...maybe our waitress was new or having an off day.  I don't know.  We just didn't get that and we weren't even snooty or demanding.
author: JJAMZ C.

description:
This is a typical sleek looking sushi joint. A little more expensive than I'm used to but you pay for the cool ambiance and attentive service.

My friend and I shared two handrolls and an order of sashimi. The sashimi was deliciously fresh but the handrolls were on the weak side... only two little strips of fish in each :(

The yelp deal makes this place a steal. Get it while you can!
author: Khanh T.

description: Recently tried Kama with a group take out order. I guess it's priced fairly but wasn't particularly outstanding. The spicy tuna roll was lacking flavor. Also sampled some of the Katsu, and it's no match for Muracci's. The salad was a bonus and sets it apart though. Will provably give lunch or dinner another chance.
author: Amy Z.

description: So far my favorite all around Japanese food restaurant in the Bay area. Having eaten some of the best Japanese in LA (still haven't been to Japan yet), this place satisfies cravings. The yakitori and nigiri are dope. Happy hour and lunch specials all day, everyday.
author: S Z.

description: We usually never get out of a Japanese restaurant for less than 40 bucks. Well, we got an appetizer mochi wrapped in bacon, the Foxy roll and Deep fried chicken Ramen for only $31!  The service is excellent! The food was delicious and prepared perfectly!  For you East Bay peeps, Ramen Shop is so over priced and pretentious. There's happy hour pricing on mon-fri from 5-6:30. What a find!
author: Kai N.

description:
I found this place on yelp while visiting San Fran for work. Definately a fan and would highly recommend this place to anyone and everyone. We made reservations however we got there like 1/2 hour early and it wasn't a problem at all. In fact it worked out in our favor! The only reason I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 is because they don't sell booze after 9 pm! That's kind of an important detail to me. ha! :) But they gave us (and I think maybe everyone) a bottle of hot sake for free right at last call. I don't care if they did just have to get rid of it, free is my language! 

Parking wasnt' a problem but I'm not familiar with the area so not sure if it was just because it was 8:30 on a Saturday night or if it's always easy parking. The food was great, the hot sake was really good (coming from somoene who doesn't normally like hot sake) and the staff was super friendly.
author: Candi B.

description: Still waiting for my food :/ at least I got free sake. Probably be drunk by the time my food gets here.
author: Justin T.

description:
This is probably the most disappointed I've ever felt about a restaurant recommended so highly on Yelp.  The ONLY reason im going with two stars is because the waiter was attentive and friendly.

We had a bad feeling from the start of the meal when we were brought edamame that was stale and flavorless.  I don't think the hubs and I have ever let a free bowl of edamame go unfinished but that one did.  

Based on the yelp reviews we ordered the whole squid, the crunchy lobster roll, bacon wrapped shrimp and shrimp tempura.

The shrimp tempura was ok but nothing special (try North Beach Sushi if you want memorable tempura).  The bacon wrapped shrimp was fine but that's a pretty hard dish to mess up.

The whole squid could have been good if they chose to feature the nicely cooked squid instead of covering it with a sickly sweet teriyaki-like (although it had an additional odd flavor neither of us could put our finger on) sauce that basically made the whole thing inedible.  

The crunchy lobster roll was also really disappointing.  Barely any lobster, a mound of tempura flakes, and the salmon did not seem very fresh.  Another dish we didn't bother finishing. 

I went straight for some gum after we left because I needed to get the taste from that nasty sauce on the squid out of my mouth.
author: wingless g.

description: Great place to get Japanese food. We ordered more than 6 rolls and several other options and they were all great! The service was amazing and overall a really great place for friends to get together and hangout.
author: Julie Y.

description: This is my go-to place for a delicious dinner.  It is walking distance from where I live, the people are friendly and accommodating and the food is really good.  They have a happy-hour with some reduced price items.  Really wonderful place to return to often.
author: Ruth L.

description: Had the ramen, YUMMY! Service was pleasant and attentive. Thanks!
author: B L.

description: Pleasant staff, great service; enjoy the fresh specials especially uni served in its shell and mirugai.
author: Victoria Y.

description: Mediocre. Chinese prepped sushi. Rolls varied but not great. Service was ok, ambiance, well remember where you are................Ho hum........
author: Nicolas E.

description:
This place is just ok.

Went here last night for the second time. First time around I remember being unimpressed, but I had a sushi craving last night and this place was two blocks away. This time was a bit better. 

The service here is a little off, there doesn't seem to be a system for servers dedicated to one table, so there are a lot of mix ups. We nearly ended up with a few things we didn't order, and it took asking 20 minutes after we had finished to get our check. However, my hot tea and water were constantly filled, so that was a plus.

We got the tempura fried soft shell crab, it wasn't my favorite, but it was still eaten. The fish in the salmon nigiri and simple tuna roll was fresh and delicious. The specialty rolls we ordered, the pyramid and the dragon, were non memorable.

I think the key to this place is sticking to the simple things - as their dishes get more complicated, they get less impressive. Definitely not the best sushi in the city, but a decent option when the craving strikes.
author: Lauren B.

description:
Great lunch special!

Their sushi is very fresh and service is exceptional. I would definitely reccomend their lunch box special. I haven't tried here for dinner just yet, but will definitely put that on the to-do.
author: Shel Z.

description:
I really wanted to like this place a lot more, since I live in the neighborhood.  My friend and I ordered a selection of rolls.  Most were OK, but we decided to be ultra-white and get the Fire Cracker Balls (deep fried tuna with a sauce of some kind).  There was something definitely off about them, and neither of us had more than a few bites.  Our waitress graciously took them back and we were not charged, but they never should have gone out in the first place, because they were definitely old and spoiled.  So I blame the chefs.

I'd try it again, but warily, and probably stick to the more conventional stuff.
author: Eric B.

description: At my office, everyone ordered lunch from Kama and it was really good.  We usually go to another sushi place near by and the consensus was that the food at Kama was much better.  I was disappointed they only delivery for dinner, so that will keep us from ordering more often, but I would recommend it.
author: Saus A.

description:
Haven't come here for almost half year, didn't have time to stop by SF area, everytime I come here I will stop by at Kama Soma, everytime I come here it won't disappoint me, specially the Japan Special Fish from Tsukiji Market, My wife always love the sushi they have, she tried the Aka Yagara (Cornet Fish) it have the weird long body and mouth, the taste is sweet and have a cruchy texture, and she also have Medai (Butterfish) and Sanma (Pike Marckerel), which my wife love it, for Myself when I come here I always order the CURRY with PORK CUTLET!!! if you have chance the curry is a MUST TRY!!! 

Service is great they even remember my name since I haven't been here for over 6 months!!! 

OH BTW Check in on Yelp will get yourself a free Sake!!! yay

Thanks I will back for More
author: Mang C.

description: Good choice of a la carte sushi dishes, great wait staff and reasonable priced food     and drinks. Great for a laid back dinner with some friends.
author: Natarajan S.

description:
Saw this place while driving a few times, so one night my bf and I decided to give it a try-

Because of the city regulation, they cannot serve alcohol after 9 (maybe its changed now) so that sucked, but other than that, food was good and the service was awesome!

Its nice to have more restaurants esp japanese in this area.
author: Shine W.

description: This place looks like it can be turned into a bar.  The walls and seats are dark.  The sushi is not bad.
author: Byron L.

description: The three stars says it all.  It was just OK.  I have had worse and I have had better.  It was very very average.  The service was good and the staff was very friendly.  I had the miso soup (good) and the 6 pieces of nigiri which i think was escolar, yellow tail, tuna, salmon and two other ones i was unsure of.  The fish was kind of blah.  If you are in the neighborhood and having a craving for sushi, ok, but if you are in search of the best this isn't it.
author: Kavon M.

description: We went to Kama Sushi in Soma just because the shabu-shabu place was 20 min. wait.  The muni had not only sushi but other Japanese and Korean dishes.  I decided to go Omakase sushi because nothing looked good in the menu.  I was wrong - the sushi was as good as the ones at Tsunami.  Sushi was very fresh and tasty.  I will definitely come back!
author: Suki K.

description: Really good small sushi shop. Standard stuff but very good quality for the price. Would definitely come back.
author: Michelle W.

description: Great ambience, good selection and food, and good device.  Free hot sake with Yelp check-in, tried the Agedashi, Dynamite roll and the Rainbow roll.   All were fresh and tasted great.  Definitely want to come back and sample more from the menu after seeing other's dishes!
author: Jennifer R.

description: Up here from Orange County. Spicy tuna appetizers were delicious. Service is friendly. We really liked their miso soup. Chicken teriyaki was okay - clearly this is primarily a sushi place. All in all, we'd say 3 1/2 out of 5 stars
author: Joel S.

description:
We (group of 8) came to this place looking for a great place for happy hour. There was plenty of seating available (possible sign?) The atmosphere inside the restaurant is pretty nice and has plenty of seating for big groups (giving an extra star for this). At our table, since we were seated in the back, has a light switch that you press on once you're ready to order which is pretty cool and the good things of this place end right about here. 

Lets go on to the so-so things. The happy hour menu is decent for vegetarians but I wasn't expecting much so it is okay. As for rolls, your only options are the cucumber avocado and the tempura sweet potato rolls. The regular menu has more vegetarian options but I didn't order off it so can't comment on the taste or quality. Some other vegetarian options on the happy hour menu are vegetable gyoza, tempura, fried eggplant, some fried tofu thing, and korokke (croquette). I ordered the cucumber avocado and vegetable gyoza. The roll tasted normal (but it is pretty hard to mess up rice, avocado, and cucumber) and it was my first time trying gyoza so I don't have anything to compare it to. It tasted decent though, nothing spectacular. 

And lastly, lets go on to the bad things. I ordered the korokke and it never came out so I ended up canceling it since we were all done eating. The server didn't apologize for never bringing it out and just said "okay". My friends ordered stuff that never came but they still insisted that it came out and we must have eaten it. Needless to say we canceled those orders pretty quickly. My friend ordered this chicken thing (hey, this is as specific as I can get) and part of it came out pink (I was told that this means raw). Even I know raw chicken can be no good. She told the server and he did apologize but that was the extent of it. A good place would've sent another item from the menu or taken it out of the bill but neither of those happened. We were too tired and frustrated with the experience to even argue about it. When the bill came out, we were charged for things that we never ended up getting (good thing we checked!). 

The server wasn't rude and he did try to accomodate a relatively large group so we were happy about that. We, however, weren't happy with the mess in ordering. I know it can be tough to keep track of all the orders of a large group but I'm sure we weren't the first big group to come here and I'm sure won't be the last. He did kind of apologize about all the mistakes when the bill came out but by the then, we were too tired to care. 

Even though we spent a lot of money here, we left still feeling hungry and that is never a good sign. There are better sushi AND happy hour places in the city so don't come here after work looking for something to make your day a little better.
author: Krishna S.

description: I love sushi and this place is good. Definitely small space, but there is a crowd every time i am here. Last time I enjoyed their sushi, sake and the tempura but the table was sticky which made me think they are dirty... hmm..Unless they F* up their customer service, i plan on going back there to get my sushi fix one more time.
author: C A.

description: Ate here after reading so many amazing reviews. First off there were numerous ingredients in the sushi that were not listed in the menu. By far the worst sushi I've eaten. I would rather eat sushi that is made in the grocery stores than eat at this restaurant again.
author: Garcia C.

description:
The rating is actually 3.5. We were one of there first customers so they are still learning the ropes or getting into the rhythm so to speak. We ordered the 12 piece sashimi for starters and the over all quality/freshness was good. The presentation was not as good as I've seen and the cuts were not consistent in size.

We ordered himachi, ankimo, and uni with a quail egg nigri next. The himachi was as good as it gets. The Ankimo was good, but not mind blowing. Now Uni is my gauge for any sushi restaurant in terms of there quality and Kama didn't disappoint. The uni was fresh, sweet and had the right consistency. The presentation was a little sloppy, but that will get better with more practice. 

We moved on to a lobster crunch roll and a pyramid roll. The lobster crunch roll was fantastic and the presentation was great. The pyramid roll may have been my favorite as it was clean, fresh and was in the shape of a pyramid. 

The service was good and the prices were reasonable and I will definitely be back since I work in the neighborhood.
author: S. C.

description: Eh, okay but just okay sushi doesn't do it for me.  The fish did not taste as fresh and delicious as I have grown used to having in SF.
author: Tina T.

description: Food tasted great, the portions were abundant, and the price was very convenient. Spacious, quiet, likable atmosphere, kind staff.
author: Federico P.

description:
Great great great! Almost the only place in SOMA one can safely go out to when on low fat low carbs diet.

I order shiitake mushrooms skewer , 2 beef skewers, mixed greens side salad with no dressing (I add soy sauce to it instead) - and it's a feast that still allow to follow the diet protocol.

Or:  sashimi, mixed greens salad with soy sauce instead of dressing, and Veggie Lover baked veggies plate (zucchini , egg plants and more delicious veggies!).

Can't wait to get off the diet and try the rest of  the yummy things!
Nice neighborhood place, not overcrowded - which also much appreciated.
author: Valerie K.

description: Very good sushi. Very fresh! Speedy delivery and tasty. Two thumbs up!
author: Natalie F.

description: I really Love Kama Sushi. We have been going there since shortly after it opened and we love it. Their service is fantastic. Their food comes out quickly and their fish is fresh. Only complaint which is really minor is the Hamachi Carpaccio - we noticed the blood line in the fish isn't being removed which is a bit of a bummer. You don't want to eat the blood line. Other than that, we will continue to go there for good service and delicious sushi. Its a good place to go knowing you can always count on leaving having had a good night and recveived your money's worth.
author: Tamira J.

description:
i hiked 8 miles this sunday.

it was supposed to be a leisurely 4 miler with mostly clear paths and not much elevation.

we got lost and so...it became an adventure.

what does this have to do with kama?

well, after a rough day of feeling like i was on an episode of survivor i wanted hearty and comforting and hot.  i wanted something brothy.  i wanted ramen.  the problem was my legs.  they weren't happy with me. even after a soak in some epsom salts and hot water the idea of going up and down the steps of my apartment made me break out into tears.

enter the hand and reliable grubhub.

the dr. and i say a veggie ramen option and went for it along with some other veggie rolls, gyoza and grilled shitakes.

the veggie ramen was amazing. great broth (i wished it came with a tad bit more.  when i poured it over my noodles and veggies it barely submerged all items), nice non-chunky pieces of veg and the noodles themselves were excellent.  exactly what i was craving.

the veggie rolls were ok.  tempura veggie, sweet potato tempura (was a little under and a bit chewy), avocado rolls, inari and grilled eggplant nigiri.  all decent.  the gyoza was proper and lovely.  the loser in the order was the grilled shitakes.  no grilled flavor at all an they didn't seem cooked well, almost raw.

but 5 stars nonetheless.  vegetarians will rejoice to know decent veggie ramen is at their fingertips you know, when that .25 cent crap won't do.
author: Jen I.

description: Restaurants like these are hard to come by. The fish is as fresh as it gets. The chefs specials come straight from japan and are served to order. I will definitely come back!
author: Jim C.

description:
Do not order the specials.

Generally in a Sushi restaurant I know better, and I order the "house special" sushi rolls, but this was my first visit. 

Also was a little cautious about the menu. The Udon descriptions said "pork flavored" not pork broth, or chicken broth so I was not sure what that meant. Also there were a lot of references to "crab stick",  but not a lot of clarity whether this was real crab or imitation crab in many of the rolls. Frankly I wish they called imitation crab whatever it really is, but at least label it.

Place is pricey for the neighborhood, but about average for SF.

"Specials" come with salad, My salad was dotted with curled dissicated leaves, some of the salad was ok, but clearly the greens were not well managed. Topped with some Cosco type carrot strips. For an almost $10 lunch could you grate an inch of fresh carrot from an organic source?

I ordered the fried shrimp curry special.

Best part of the meal were the shrimp, these were fresh, lightly fried and great.

Curry was tasty but overabundant and very gloppy, seemed poured from a can. Don't order the curry. 

Rice was aboundant but odd. The grains were huge, normally in a sushi restaurant they use a finer grain sushi rice.

I ordered a 'coke', got a diet coke, and they argued with me about that, even though the waiter clearly repeated my beverage order. They serve it in a fluted glass, probably get a lot less than a normal amount. Pretty but geez how do you turn "coke" into "diet coke"? They did take the $1.50 off my bill.

People to the right of me ordered sushi and they seemed to like it, but did not finish it. Sushi is also made with this huge rice so the rolls come out oversized.

If I return I will try the sushi without the salad or other stuff, but considering how many options for this type of food in SF and how many other options at less money in the same neighborhood it will be a while.

The atmosphere is dank, trying to be trendy, comes off wanting. TV blaring from a mount so high no one could see it, more like a bar. Staff stands together watching the door, but service is minimal, contact with customers edgey. They all say "bye now" loudly when you leave, so maybe that's the message.
author: ce c.

description: Pretty good. I"m mainly rating it because I took my mother there for lunch and she is the snobbiest eater and loved it.
author: Victoria K.

description: Kama is your typical no thrills American Japanese place. They have a large variety of rolls with all different kind of sauces, and hey they are yummy. The best thing about it is that it's spacious so it's good for groups, which most sushi places are not. The Ramen here is not bad, but not exceptional because the noodles are packaged. I wouldn't drive out to eat here, but if you are in the area and have a large party then I would definitely stop by.
author: Artur R.

description: Got the 12 piece sashimi delivered.  Delivered a little later than expected. Was quite fresh, didn't have problems like others with too much tuna (there were plenty of other fish).  Nothing too unique but satisfied my craving :D
author: Xue H.

description: So excited to have a sushi place nearby that's good AND affordable! Ordered the chirashi bowl which was filling and pretty decent sushi. Metered parking is relatively easy to find during the day but be prepared to search for a WHILE at night. Definitely a lot of potential. I plan on coming back to try out the rest of the menu.
author: Diana Y.

description: We were put on the second room. It seems that the waiter forgets whoever sits there, so it took a while to order, every time we wanted something. As long as the food arrived, it was delicious. We had some sushis and rolls!
author: João M.

description: Tried the spicy Tonkatsu ramen, which is very delicious. The price is extremely reasonable and the service is quiet yet attentive. Street parking is free after 6pm. Will definitely come back to try their sushi.
author: Huiling H.

description: Nice sushi and soup with udon and mixed tempura.
author: AK K.

description: Gone a couple times now and the food and service have always been good. A welcome addition to the hood.
author: Lotus C.

description:
Checked website and with store, confirmed they were open until 9:30.

After a 40 minute bus ride specifically to eat there, showed up at 9:13 with plenty of people inside, but a "closed sign" and they refused to serve us.

This is really unacceptable to list hours and not abide by them.
author: Erik J.

description: The service here is absolutely amazing, they are just so accomodating. They give you am order of perfectly salted soy beans with every order and are just the sweetest. Everything is on point, decor, ambiance, food. Really good spicy tuna.
author: Irina S.

description: Talk about last minute selection. We were driving to Infusion lounge and wanted to get a quick bite before rolling in and thanks to the trusty Yelp app, I found this gem. We were thrilled that they offered a yelp deal AND a yelp check in deal. The yelp deal was $10 for $20 worth and checkin was free bottle of sake. Even though I prefer cold sake, hot free sake will do. The folks were generous and even gave us TWO bottles of free sake. The price and quality of food was terrific even before the discount. I'll definitely be back once I head back to the city. Bravo!
author: Spencer H.

description: Top to bottom, this place is great and great for the neighborhood. My fav is the karaage chicken ramen with spicy pork broth. Service is also very friendly and attentive.
author: Brett H.

description: Great Food awesome Service!! even got a complimentary Bottle of saki for checking in on last visit!! ohh yeah!
author: Carlos X.

description: Sorry to say but I've had to downgrade my review since the original. Since then I've been 3 times. (Twice to eat in, once for take-out). My experiences since have not lived up to the 1st. Fish seemed... not off... but the texture was odd. Made us wonder if it had been frozen. Also the portions are smallish (not a problem considering the odd texture).
author: Alexis R.

description: Had their dinner box with salmon and pork tonkatsu, and was better than many Japan Town restaurants. Called for home delivery, food arrived hot, well packaged, and in approximately 40 minutes. Highly recommend  for take out.
author: Ted G.

description: Fishes are fresh and dishes are very reasonably priced. Also nice to hear staff talking in Japanese. A waiter was not that friendly. Will go back soon though.
author: Akiko M.

description:
Great lunch special, lots of food for about 10$. Very fresh sushi, too, all rolls were well made, it reminded me of that sushi movie- even the rice was good :)

The place was busy this time, not too busy last time. Good variety of eaters and one of my fav local sushi spots.
author: Eric O.

description: This place was a great neighborhood sushi bar. I went for lunch and thought it had a fun vibe and fresh fish. Since its near by I'm sure I'll be back!
author: Komal B.

description: I just found my sushi place! My son and I have been here couple times and the food is always good. The high light is their service, wonderful and attentive. Hope their business keeps well.
author: Jackie C.

description: Some of it's great, some of it's not and service is a bit off-kilter as well.   Keep trying!
author: Nate P.

description: No Ippudo in SF, but, we have Kama!  Love their Tonkotsu Ramen and haven't had it this good anywhere in the city.  This has become a weekly craving for me and for $9.95 it comes with a side of avocado maki (or cucumber - but obviously AVO is greater than CUCUMBER) Their temaki are also delicious and beautiful.  I'm also very judgemental of Uni and if it looks mashed up, I won't eat it - theirs is perfect.
author: Alex T.

description: Kama features a great lunch and dinner menu with affordable bento boxes, vegetarian sushi and ramen options. The space was clean and modern, a welcome change from the previous restaurant that owned the space. I had the lunch bento box with a cucumber avocado roll and a tempura sweet potato roll. While the tempura roll wasn't quite what I was looking for the fresh light spring mix salad and accompanying picked vegetables made up for it. My coworker enjoyed the pork ramen loaded with tons of toppings and noodles. The only negative was that it took 15 mins to take our order, but the free edamame did help the time pass while waiting. I am excited to have a Japanese restaraunt close by that has a decent veggie sushi list and offers vegetarian ramen (with soy base).
author: Cori W.

description: Quite impressed. hopping but not jammed on a friday eve. we got the last two seats at the sushi bar, which is always our preference. great fish, good prices (esp with the yelp deal!). only minor grievance is slightly inattentive service - dirty plates sat before us for a long time without being cleared. but overall, a great little sushi joint.
author: Erica W.

description: Fantastic quality fish. The Kama Nigiri was incredible.
author: Jonathon M.

description: To be honest, I wanted to love this place but I didn't. I swung by for happy hour on a weekday and ordered all the top things that people wanted. I also got the free sake via yelp. The best thing I ate was salmon sashimi and it was max a 4 star rating. The place itself is nice, although getting to there in SOMA is kind of shady. The service was pretty attentive.
author: Amy A.

description: Don't let the neighbourhood fool you--this place has high quality food and it's appropriately priced.
author: Michael K.

description: This place probably has the freshest fish I have had in a long time. Their happy hour is awesome from 4-630PM. Only problem is that they lag when it gets busy, but the happy is so worth it. $50 bucks for two people including two hot sakes and two large sapporos. Leaving completely full
author: Angel R.

description: We had a wonderful experience here the other night. Hubs and I love sushi and like to try new places every chance we get. We tried the Dragon Roll, the Autumn and the Hot Mamma and loved it so much we went for a second round. Prices are average (about $10-12 per roll) and easily exceeded our expectations for the cost. But, then, once we used our $10-off Yelp deal PLUS the free sake just for checking in, the value of this trendy sushi joint went off the charts. We will definitely be back!
author: Kristi D.

description: came here with a group of friends on friday night and happily found out they had extended there alcohol time till they close and not 9pm anymore! yay :) and on friday&saturday they have a special on alcohol which is buy2 large beer or large hot sake and get one free, who can say no to that! besides that the food and service was on point! will definitely come back again!!
author: Annie S.

description: yummmyyyyyy! fresh sushi. try the hot mama or hot papa. great rolls. also they have a great vegetarian selection on top of all the great sushi. thumbs up.
author: Chucky B.

description: Everything's great except food, I tried the 49er roll, salmon kama, spicy tuna. You can tell the chef did his best but ingredients quality was just not there.
author: Sean S.

description: good, but a little pricey, and the seating is quite tight.
author: Pat C.

description: Same great food from the original Kama Sushi on Church St, but with an atmosphere more conducive to groups and drinking. I am very excited that they opened a location closer to the downtown SF area.
author: Andrew M.

description: This place was great when it first opened, now the quality and quantity is longer in their food. With so many options in the city for sushi, I would def. not be coming back.
author: Lan V.

description: We did home delivery, it was very good! Get the hand wrapped maki with soy paper and shrimp tempura, it's delicious.
author: Francesca C.

description: Happy that a good sushi place opened in SOMA. Huge portions (seriously, even for sushi), beautiful presentation, enthusiastic staff, and reasonable prices.
author: Jono S.

description: This place is great . I have had their lunch bento box which is pretty good. The only good sushi place in the area open for lunch.
author: Ana D.

description: The food was pretty good. I used a 20 for 10 coupon which made everything super cheap. Definitely worth going!
author: John L.

description:
i can only speak of the sushi.  i have to say this is better than izakaya sushi down the street.  everything i have ordered from their sushi menu has been delicious and fresh.  the sushi arrives in a matter of minutes. 

the service is good and friendly.  they do fill your water and attend to your needs almost immediately.
gary orders those soup-bowls, which he seems to enjoy.  but I can't say anything further on those dishes.

you should know how much saki you want as the carafe is not as big as you would expect; i prefer the bottle.  easier to manage.  mmm-saki!

we do venture back to this place often and experience the same delight!
author: Benjamin B.

description: Legit sushi options, portions, and freshness. The space is efficient and cozy, and the location couldn't be better. don't spoil it and tell everyone but the super-deserved will cherish this gem!
author: eVa J.

description: Delicious! Great happy hour prices and excellent service. The yellowtail Kama was perfect and we couldn't finish our water before they filled it again. Will definatley be back!
author: Marissa C.

description: So far one of the greatest places in SF! I'm a sushi fan and their happy hour is pretty good! Fresh fresh fresh fish! Service was quick too.. I can't remember all I had but I ate a lot last night and everything tasted fresh and delicious! Will definitely go again for happy hour very soon :) is a comfy place pretty good to go on a casual date or wit friends.
author: Elizabeth D.

description: I went to Kama Sushi today (3/5/2015) for lunch with two of my co-workers. We really enjoyed the food and the service was pretty good. The sushi is very fresh and the environment is very relaxed and comfortable. I think this place will be somewhere i frequent for lunch.
author: Silas G.

description:
Delivery on a saturday night arrived in just over 30 minutes.  My requests/instructions were followed and the food was nicely packed.

soft-shell crab appetizer - decent
shishito & shitaki yakitoris - good
hamachi kama - good
saba shioyaki dinner - good

Will be ordering again.
author: dark l.

description: Came here for my birthday last Saturday. Had a group of eight. The hostess was very accomodating since it was a busy night. Got us a table in less than 5 or 10 mins. However the wait time for food was pretty long. Maybe about half an hour. I was the birthday girl and I got my food last...Cool. I ordered the tonkotsu ramen. It was pretty tasty. Overall this place is just ok.
author: Connie K.

description: Not impressed. I got the udon, but the soup had unfiltered water taste, which I didn't like. Portions were huge, but everything else in the udon was good.
