Honestly, I wouldn't go here if you have better options elsewhere. SOMA lacks serious competition in Japanese cuisine. Service is fair.
author: Geraldine K.

description: A random hole in the wall type place in seemingly no man's land but this is a fantastic Japanese restaurant. Their ramen is in particular fantastic. I think it's the best in San Francisco.
author: Ed C.

description: just ate here for the first time, and it was the best service and rolls ever!! the super dynamite was insane, best roll I've ever had. definitely my new sushi place in SF!!
author: Maggie M.

description: Another Noe Valley hidden gem. Rolls are expensive but almost worth it.
author: Inigo M.

description: Average, bougie sushi place. It was tasty, but I wouldn't go out of my way to go here. It makes for a nice lunch post-Costco, though!
author: Lisa W.

description: I used to live couple blocks away from this place and had visited it over dozen times. Sushi is always fresh and tasty!  Service is good! Happy hour has a good menue and plenty of parking around
author: Masha S.

description: We came here for happy hour and unfortunately were quite disappointed.  We ordered some sushi dishes (don't remember the names now), they were decent but not too special.  what really got me was the calamari dish: when it came, we were excited that it seemed to have lots of calamari, only realized that most of them were fried onions...  :(     If you really want to try, make sure to check in on yelp so you can at least get a free small sake out of it.
author: Tiffany H.

description: Great service. We sat down right away on a busy Saturday night. Food came out fast and with phenomenal presentation. Tasted great. Uni was fresh. I recommend the firecracker balls as well. The staff was great and super friendly. Will definitely come back again.
author: Nick F.

description: We came here bc we got a restaurant.com coupon. I'm glad we tried them bc now we have a new local Japanese restaurant that's good and serves up sushi, curry AND ramen! How awesome is that?! There were only 3 of us but we were able to try a few dishes which included the geso fries (fried squid legs), vegetable lover (grilled veggies), seafood salad, katsu curry & ramen. The geso fries were so good that my friend ordered a 2nd one!!! Oh, they also tried the uni & ebi. Everything was delicious and came out fairly quick. The service was also quite friendly! We will definitely be back!
author: Vic S.

description: There's too much competion for good sushi and outstanding service.  I've been here 4 times (because my roommate keeps dragging me) and I've been disappointed every time with the service.  They've forgotten our orders 3 of 4 times.  They didn't take our order at all 2 out of 4 times.  It's a small place so I don't understand how they loose track of people.  Also, they have problems understanding ENGLISH!  I'll never come here again, there's better sushi and better service elsewhere.
author: CHAD C.

description:
i have found my go-to place for sushi and japanese delivery!! the man who took my order was really pleasant and friendly and made sure to confirm all of my information as well as let me know realistically when my order would arrive (it ended up being 30 minutes early...yay!). i definitely recommend the unago roll (eel with mango) and the vegetarian dragon (tempura sweet potato inside and topped with avocado and grilled eggplant). the oyako donburi isn't bad, although i wish they had some veggies like carrots in there or something. the ratio of meat, egg and onions to rice is almost perfect. 

can't wait to try more of their rolls and hot dishes!
author: Stephanie C.

description: Great atmosphere and location . Went there for dinner with friends . We had the crunchy lobster , salmon tuna , the daily special ( whole fish ) , ramen ,and curry was amazing . The customer service was excellent . Been to a lot of restaurants in sf the customer service can not compare to the service here . They took care of our party of 8 . All my friends loved the food and service here if I could give them 10 stars I would . We also checked in from yelp and got a free hot sake . We would definitely be back for more !
author: J S.

description: Look up their specials on the board behind the sushi chef.  Those are the fresh stuff.  It's nice to have a quality sushi place in this neighborhood.  Enjoyed my Ramen.  The guys next to us seems to be very adventuresome and ordered the Aji.  It looked awesome, saw the sushi chef filet it in front of us to slitters and creatively arched the fish skeleton for the presentation.  I guess you can have them grill the skeleton to finish it off.  We lived vicariously through the guys in their assortment of uni and whatnot.  They lived it up.  As oppose to us, with our ramen and udon and the grilled sea bass.  All in all was yummy, but I wish they would do something about the flying insect flying around my soup.  I guess the insect was attracted to my pork soup base.  We had tea, but they didn't come to refill.  It took time to flag down to get our check. I guess it was really busy with big groups and whatnot.  My favorite word of the day:  whatnot.  I loved their stoneware.  Sushi chefs were fun to watch, you can actually see their sweat (just kidding).
author: Helen L.

description: My neighborhood sushi joint :)  Pretty good sushi and sashimi, and they have some inventive rolls too. Good food + friendly service + walkable to my house = score!
author: Connie L.

description: Cool! Great food, staff, easy to find location, and not too crowded--all in SF = I'm a fan! Came here on a Saturday night for dinner with a large party and had an awesome time. We pretty much had the whole back area to ourselves. We all loved the oysters and rolls. I did have to minus a star, only because I found the tuna poki much more fishy tasting than I'm used to, but everyone else liked it. I'll come here again! P.S. We made it just in time for Happy Hour too! :)
author: Helen N.

description: I had the Hot papa roll and it was terrible. I ordered a bunch of sushi for my coworkers and they all complained that it was terrible. I gave two stars because I have eaten there before and it was decent. Tonight was sub par though.
author: Amber A.

description: Love this place! Seems like no matter how busy they are the service is still outstanding. I never have to wait long for anything. The sushi is really good but I tried the ramen this time.  Yum!
author: Carly N.

description: This was my second time here because I thought I would give it a second chance. If you eat sushi often, I don't think you will be impressed. I tried the "real crab" sushi and thought about spitting it up. Didn't taste fresh at all and I rarely give bad reviews. This place is good for people who will order sushi at a food court and think it's fine only it's one step up because there is dim lighting. Nice servers though! It's not their fault.
author: P F.

description: Always a good choice for when we're craving sushi. There's seldom a line and the staff is friendly. Quality is always reliable and their rolls are tasty.
author: Ashley D.

description: Had sushi here for dine in and delivery about 7 times.  Four times the sushi was dry, fishy, and sickly.  The other three times were fine or good.  I came here often due to the proximity of my home, but the last time I got their sushi I felt queasy so that is the end of my visits here.  The hot food also is a hit or a miss.  I'm tired of guessing if the food will be good or sickening.  Good restaurants are consistent, clean, and fresh.
author: Obar L.

description: Ramen is good but the sushi isn't . They give you a finger size amt of rice.
author: Nori L.

description:
Excellent, fresh fish.  Prompt, courteous service.
Happy Hour is a very good deal.
author: Michael C.

description: My partners and I stayed in the city for several days attending a trade show and found this restaurant w/in walking distance of our hotel. We ate here 3 nights in a row and came away delighted with the food, service and atmosphere every time. Our group included people who don't do raw and/or prefer vegetarian, and those tastes were easily and and deliciously accommodated. Highly recommend.
author: Irene G.

description: Good solid chirashi lunch special with a generous portion of fish, with prompt, friendly service. They also give you a bowl of edamame to start. The fish seemed to be of pretty good quality and the rice was also above average. Would lunch here again.
author: Luke A.

description: Really overpriced for what you get. Exorbitant, actually. Service is extremely slow. Wait staff is very forgetful. And it wasn't even busy. Lots of vacant tables. While we waited, we checked the reviews on yelp, and were shocked to discover it has a health score of only 75%. Grimy and sticky tabletop. Sandy clams. Warm sushi. They forgot one of the appetizers we ordered. When we asked about it, cuz it hadn't come out after we had finished everything else, they said it was half way done. It still took 10 minutes to get it. Never coming back.
author: Edward J.

description: Pretty good sushi - glad they're here in the neighborhood. Great deal with the sake and groupon.  Drawback is that they stop serving beer/liquor at 9pm.
author: Lis W.

description:
Had an OK sashimi lunch here with some free sake thanks to the Yelp check-in offer. It's a nice place in the neighborhood, but at the end of the day it's just average. Service was good though with lots of water refills. 

It reminds me of a nice Japanese place you'd find in the midwest, but in SF it's nothing special.
author: David H.

description: Great food and an excellent place to get work done. Free wifi nearby.
author: Aaron F.

description: Waiter came back several times to refill our water, great service and presentation, bunch of gay couples there so that's a + or - depending on how you feel
author: Tiff W.

description: Great service - super friendly waiters, who are happy to help you out with suggestions - nice decor, but most of all, the sushi (and everything else) is great. Try the daily specials.
author: Michael P.

description: Decent sushi.  Not the best but, good enough for the price.  Will likely eat here again.
author: Jolly R.

description: I love Kama sushi. Reasonably priced, great staff. It is a chinese run japanese restaurant but the sushi is rock solid given that. I go at least once a week.
author: Martin S.

description: This is the best place to go for sushi! Absolutely fresh sushi and great customer service. I had the butter fish and uni roll and it was mouth-watering. I suggested to take advantage of the happy hour. But if you missed happy hour, the prices are pretty reasonable and affordable.
author: Kristen T.

description:
On the whole, very good.  Came in with a friend around 7:30pm and were seated quickly.  The place was about half full on the main side.  Endamames and water glasses were brought to the table right away, but I have to agree with other reviewers, the endamames were cold and bland.
My friend lit up when he noticed that they had live scallops on the special board, but was told that they were out.  I checked the specials one last time on our way out, and no one had bothered to remove them.  Makes me wonder if they had them in the first place or were just trying to show themselves as a better restaurant.  The waiter did recommend several other things, one of which was finally chosen (forgive me, I don't remember what it was).  He did also order the lamb chops small plate and was very pleased with it.
I had the wakame salad and the Jo Sushi Dinner.  Both were very good.  The salad was tender for seaweed, unlike most places were it's like chewing on a sesame flavored rubber tire.  The dinner was just enough food for me as I was not very hungry, coming with miso soup, five pieces of nigiri and your choice of spicy tuna roll or California roll (as I am allergic to cucumber I went with the California).  All of the fish was fresh and tasty, the rice was well made, and everything held together from plate to mouth.
The waiters were attentive, made sure our glasses were never empty until we were done, and were friendly.  I did have a yelp certificate and they were more then happy to take care of us even with it (I have heard that some places out there seem to "shut down" once you let them know you have such a deal, yelp or not.  Not the case here!).
Overall, I am very pleased with Kama.  Hopefully it was just an oversight with the specials board.  And once the endamames issue is fixed I do think it will be worth five stars!
author: Jennifer W.

description: Stopped in for lunch and was extremely dissatisfied. I couldn't even finish what I ordered. And, this would be the first time I've not finished sushi in my life. I ordered the toro nigiri which came unlike any toro I have ever ordered. It seemed like it had been seared and had some sort of sauce or glaze on it?!  Okay...  And, it was extremely tough to the point that i couldn't chew it. That would be the opposite of toro. I also ordered a special which was a spicy hamachi nigiri. Well, again, it seemed like it had been lightly seared and also had a glaze or sauce on it. Possibly that is how they serve the sushi here. No clue. I was expecting raw fish as well -- I ordered sushi. The yellowtail was fine and tender -- but after I ate it I remembered it was supposed to be spicy -- wasn't spicy at all. Strange. I started to wonder if I got somebody's else's order. I also ordered the Lemon Hama roll which was supposed to have asparagus in it -- no asparagus. (And Asparagus is big time in season as of writing this review.) Anyway, the roll was ok -- but again was glazed with some kind of dressing that made it kinda bland or oily in summary. I only ate about half of it as I got bored with the flavor. Regarding price, not sure why other reviewers are mentioning that this is a cheap alternative. The prices are on par with other sushi restaurants like this in SF. And, as I couldn't eat all of it for various reasons -- that made it more expensive.
author: Nate W.

description: The neighborhood is not exactly SF's most scenic, but this hole-in-the-wall has excellent, fresh sushi rolls and great happy hour specials (both drinks AND food). Dinner and a meal for $10 - done!
author: Sarah B.

description: Excellent food! Avocado is nice and ripe. Good atmosphere. Easy parking.
author: sam l.

description: This is my new favorite sushi place in the city, amazing service , ambience ,food, presentation , my new spot ^^
author: Ran T.

description: great sushi, good price, nothing special just all around pretty good
author: Anca R.

description: Loved happy hour here! I don't live in the area, but I'll probably come again when I'm back. Delicious tuna poke!!
author: Evee B.

description: The chirashi was good, i.e., it was fresh. The presentation looked somewhat mediocre, but barely bad enough for me to mention. I do mention it though since usually Japanese food is prepared to please the eye as well as the palate. The miso was delicious and the server was good. My friends' all said they liked their food. Btw, the mochi dessert was yummy.
author: Kevin Y.

description: Kama is a very cozy and stylish Japanese  place. I  am not a big fish eater, normally I only ate California roll when  I ate out for Japanese food. However, I am very surprise at Kama, lots choice and the  ramen is very good, and I really like the egg inside the ramen.  I also try the Lobster roll, and It is very delicious.  I will go back there just for it . It is busy place, and the service is very good.The chief even stop by our table to say hi. I will deferentially go back there.
author: Kani L.

description: Good service and good reasonable price sushi! Indeed rice for the sushi is very important and they did right! Liked the booth style as well as combo of tables.
author: yoriko i.

description: My only visit there felt like a rip off. The cuts of fish they serve are really tiny. It also seems like they don't know what are acceptable cuts to serve. The pricey Toro they served me was seared (only place I've seen that sears Toro) and was incredibly chewy. It was chewy because it had clearly visible sinew. It's plain unacceptable to serve fish with sinew at a Sushi restaurant.
author: Thomas N.

description: I work as a sales rep for japanese food distributor and i must say this restaurant is one of the best restaurants in bay area. Amazing customer service, atmosphere is very nice and of course the food is very good. Fish is very fresh and happy hour is amazing. Pricing is also good and quality is very nice.
author: Yu S.

description: The service was excellent...but he food sucked ate there for lunch and now I  keep running to the bath room! The sushi is not fresh and now I'm sick! Will never eat here again!
author: Nae B.

description: I really wanted to like this place since it's close to where I work and I was really craving sushi. But do NOT eat here. My boyfriend got food poisoning and hasn't ever been this sick! He had the scallop hand roll and some unagi thing. On top of that we waited 45 minutes for the waiter to take our order and another 45 before we got our food. For the sake of your health, avoid this place!
author: V K.

description: Great atmosphere and service. The food was pretty good (somethings like the autumn roll were great, others like the sashimi salad just ok). They don't serve alcohol after 9 though, something to do with their license
author: Lauren W.

description: The sushi was very fresh and tasty from every person at the table. We had the New York Roll, Phili Roll(2 orders) and 2 other rolls I forgot the names but I can describe it, one had raw quail egg and sea urchin(looked like smooth fried tofu skin) and the other had green fish eggs on top and I believe I heard our server call it "butter fish". We also had the tonkatsu ramen and a salmon mix plate. I shared the tonkatsu ramen with my daughter and sister-in-law and found that there was way too much ginger in it. My husband got the salmon mix plate and said it was very good and the presentation was very nicely done. We had the fried ice cream(this is HUGE American size and probably can share between 2 people) for dessert, fried goodness but the breading was just a little chalky. THE SERVICE WAS SPECTACULAR and I loved the glassware they used for the drinks, just added a nice touch. Our total bill for everything was about $170-WHOAH. That's the most I think I've ever seen on a sushi restaurant bill, but being that it's in SF and the sushi was the most exotic I've ever seen I guess that's why? I would recommend this place if you REALLY like good sushi.
author: Evangelyn Sacha J.

description: We expected to be blown away based on the reviews from our friends in the neighborhood.  But, from start to finish it was just bad.  The maguro and ebi had obviously been refrigerated and were at least a day old.  The spicy tuna maki was hours old -- not fresh and the aga dashi tofu was very old.  Overall -- dangerous place to go if they're serving food that's old.  When we complained they took everything off the check but what were they doing serving old food?  Even the edamame had seen better days -- maybe they made too much food for the Memorial Day weekend but that doesn't mean you get to try to kill your Tuesday customers with it.
author: Kathleen K.

description: Kama Sushi has the best ramen in soma. We just can't have enough of it. We also had pork skewers and other appetizers there and had no complaint at all. The green tea cheesecake is also pretty good. It would be even nicer if the green tea flavor is a little more dense.
author: X L.

description:
salmon sashimi 5 pieces for 10 dollars. price is fair, the quality is very mediocre. 

the dragon roll was not good at all, had a weird sweet taste. 

the cucumber and seaweed salad was delicious, but they gave me a whole plate of cucumber with literally one bite of seaweed.

uni nigiri is pretty good tho.
author: Danielle A.

description: I am visiting SF for a conference and am staying in a hotel nearby. I searched Yelp for a sushi restaurant and this one came up. I loved it. It is quaint, friendly, well-priced and delicious. The service was friendly, efficient and quick. The unexpected edamame was a nice touch and the food (soup, mixed sushi platter) was exactly what I wanted/expected for this little gem. I love little places like this - unassuming, good value and good food.
author: Tim O.

description: such good food... especially the katsu don!! BUT.. soo pricey.. also, they don't have a typical dinner combo so I was pretty disappointed... other than that, their food was so good (partly  cuz i was drunk from their HH hot sake and beer)... but i'd go here again if I was going to go to the orpheum again.
author: Jennifer G.

description: A lot bigger than their Noe Valley location, but the same quality fish and great service.  Amazing decor fitting the SOMA location.  Ordered the 24 sashimi platter - fish was fresh and presented well.  Was surprisingly busy for opening week, but the staff adapted and was up to the task.
author: Jim O.

description: WARNING: Scombroid food poisoning from spoiled fish.  I ate at this restaurant on Sunday night.  Within a few hours, I was overcome with the first signs of food poisoning, including sweating, burning-peppery taste sensations in my mouth and throat, extreme nausea, hives all over my torso, and severe abdominal cramps.  I was up all night vomiting and bed-ridden the next day.  I went on the Internet and come to learn that these symptoms are associated with seafood poisoning from tuna, which was a component in most of the items I ordered.  My dining companion was also stricken and missed work.  The restaurant refused to refund any of the money we spent ($150) and offered instead to comp a few items when we come back.  AS IF?!?  They also attempted to disclaim any liability by telling us that no one else complained about being poisoned.  Evidently, their business model requires their poisoned guests to be too sick or meek to complain.  Or, perhaps they want us to return to the dining area and announce that we are the guests who ate the spoiled tuna and are here to claim our free appetizer.  Shameful.
author: Joe Z.

description: Came here for my graduation dinner- we had so much fun! The food is yummy, with great atmosphere and wonderful staff. Also, I am a neighbor and can say the place is always so clean and already getting business- they deserve it! Def. worth going to.
author: R G.

description: great food,love the crunchy lobster,i will be back....
author: Christie J.

description: I really despise this restaurant.  While the food is decent, their service is terrible.  I've ordered from them online 2 separate times.  On both occasions, they claimed the food would be ready in 20-30 minutes, but it wasn't ready for 45 minutes (meaning I had to wait at the restaurant for 15 minutes).  And on both occasions they messed up part of my order.  I am done with Kama sushi.
author: Alan S.

description: A friend recommended this place to me and it did not disappoint. Their rolls are very well made and not ordinary rolls. Each roll has its own unique style and taste. Their Nigiri and Sashimi are fresh and well made. The prices on their menu are low compared to other sushi places that have that kind of quality. I would definitely come back again!
author: Evan K.

description: Went here during my brief stint in SF this summer.  Saw the yelp deal and decided to check it out, and I'm so glad I did.  Super delish sushi + friendly service = happy me!!
author: K S.

description: Food was decent, atmosphere cute and prices reasonable. What was subpar was the service. While friendly they seemed incredibly disorganized--forgot the miso soup, didn't put sauce on the side as requested, didn't bother to tell us there were specials, etc. Too bad the staff weren't trained better as it really diminishes the experience.
author: Geoffrey U.

description: Five of us went to Kama Sushi for dinner after a last minute search on yelp for Japanese restaurant nearby Market Street.  We ordered sushi, chirachi, tofu, soup noodles..etc  Assessing the customer service and the taste alone would probably merit the restaurant a 3 star rating.  However, the most disappointing part is that after I had the spicy tomkotsu ramen, I felt so thirsty the entire night that I kept on drinking water. I am not sure whether this was due to the excessive MSG or/and salt in the ramen. whatever it was, my eyes started to swollen at night and by the next morning, both of my eyes and the face were bloated.  i asked my friend who also had soup noodle that night.  She also felt she woke up the next day with swollen hands.  Perhaps it's because I have been eating very healthy lately (mostly home-cooked organic food) and therefore my body couldn't tolerate much sodium. but whatever it is, I will probably not be back again.
author: Susan C.

description: i love this restaurant its close to my house and the sashimi was fresh and delicious. The waiters are very nice and engaging. The lightings were dim so its perfect for a dinner date. I would definitely eat here again!!!
author: Jack T.

description: Came here due to a yelp deal and wanted to try it out since I live close by.  Food is mediocre at best.  Nothing special other than the happy hour was great and service was attentive.  I'll probably come back only because it's close, however, it will not be my first choice for a sushi restaurant.
author: Hana K.

description: So good here! I got a yelp coupon. Got a sushi roll and some happy hour rolls. I'm surprised that chinese people made such good sushi. Definitely a great place to bring friends or a date.
author: Crum B.

description: I love this place! Good happy hour, good fish quality and selection.  Pretty decent udon. (though not the best udon in the city, you don't have to wait an hour to eat after ordering)
author: Aaron N.

description: I would give this place 0 stars if I could. The service was appalling.  I waited for a good hour for a meager portion of sashimi. When the food did finally arrive, the rice was cold, and not at all the roughly body temperature that is ideal.  They must have left it on the counter and forgot to serve me, which is pathetic given that they seat so few people.  The waiter never even came around to refill my water.  It's sad to see a restaurant that cannot even manage serving a few tables well.  On top of all of this, the employees were all incredibly rude and curt in their interactions.  The food is also highly overpriced.  Spare yourself the trouble.  Skip Kama Sushi, and avoid paying a fortune for bad Japanese food and service.
author: Sebastian C.

description: Kama Sushi is pretty good given there are not many choices near where I work.  I thought the portions were reasonable and the taste were good.  I will comment that the staff could be more friendly.  I know it should mostly be able the food but lately I have noticed that I enjoy my food a lot more when I have nice friendly waiters and waitresses.  I guess I am all about the total experience.  All in all, a nice restaurant but it didn't hit the WOW factor for me.
author: Kit K.

description: I am a frequent customer of the Kama Sushi on Church St, so when I found out that they were opening one in SOMA, near my house, I was excited. The fish is fresh -- I highly recommend the Uni or the Lobster Roll. If you want something more exotic, try the Aji -- it's a whole fish. The fish fingers are also quite good, and my girlfriend is in love with the Unagi Don. All in all it's a great find!!
author: Vijay R.

description: GREAT little neighborhood addition in SOMA.  Nice atmosphere, friendly and speedy service, good happy hour specials, and fresh, good quality sushi.  Very happy this just opened, and hoping it has a long stay....
author: Matt H.

description: After living half a block away for a year, I decided to finally give this place a try.  The atmosphere is decent, the servers are friendly, and the nigori sake is served very cold.  On to the food:  the miso soup was decent - not impressive, but also not disappointing.  I ordered two rolls and one piece of nigiri.  I was there on a Thursday evening, and the restaurant was reasonably busy, but not completely full.  It took a while for the food to come out, and I think the chefs were aware that they were running slow, because they gave me a free Unagi nigiri - the highlight of the meal.  The unagi sauce is actually really good.  Everything else I ordered was actually pretty bland.  The hamachi slices used in the negihama were small, and appeared to be mixed with something a bit redder - perhaps maguro.  The spicy hamachi toro nigiri was not actually spicy.  The autumn roll was served with a tempura sauce, but would have benefitted from a bit of wasabi on the side.  Edamame was complimentary, but unsalted.  The prices were reasonable - about $35 for sake, miso, two rolls and one nigiri.  I just wish it was a bit more flavorful.  I won't be hurrying back, but also wouldn't say no to a repeat visit if someone else suggested it.
author: Miles B.

description: I have eaten many many sushi places in the bay area. Kama has been my favorite. I have eaten at both location and the quality of sushi has been the best. I have brought many family and friends here and they live in the south bay. They have driven 70 miles for some good fresh sushi. Thanks for all the sake and good service. Keep up the good work Kama Sushi!!
author: Tommy N.

description: I went there for lunch and had their bento box and a dragon roll. The chicken teriyaki was dry and definitely felt like it was sitting around, made in large quantities. The saba was ok, nothing special. The dragon roll was ordinary, but proportionally smaller than expected, given the price of special rolls. Service was not great. It took 15 minutes to take our order, forgot to bring our drinks, I had to remind them to bring it. Even with the coupon, I would not come back.
author: Linda S.

description: It was REALLY good!!! We ordered a lot. Dragon roll, philly, salmon skin, 49, mushroom, tempura. It was all awesome!! Great staff!! Sadly that corner has had so many businesses that have failed. Hope they hang in there. It was kinda slow for a Saturday night. So GO!!!
author: SFone D.

description: The sushi was great and the service was excellent but they do stop serving drinks at 9:30pm! which is a bit too early for me lol! however they do have an awesome happy hour menu.
author: Ingrid B.

description: great happy hour every day! really fun to come with a group- you can sit by the window at a sunken table and when you need your waiter's attention you turn on a light above you table and they appear immediately! all restaurants should use this system! fab local spot.
author: Mattie B.

description: love this place...one of the best sushi i even had! the shoyu raman is also one of my favorite, people here are super friendly too! i have been there many times and it never disappoint me, i brought fds there and they love it too!
author: mandy l.
